I think people are fooling themselves if they think a hand held speaker is going to give them thumping bass.  When bass is the dominant range, sound tends to be muddy in these smaller speakers.  I, for one, am happy Sinoband took the "high road" and concentrated on clean sound rather than bass Bass BASS!  There are nice bass tones to keep the sound well rounded and full sounding, just not this annoying thumping and bouncing that some people seem to crave.SOUND VOLUMEThis speaker falls somewhere in between the quietest and the loudest speaker that I've tried, but it gets plenty loud enough for a medium sized room to jam out.  The loudest speaker that I have is a 15 watt speaker that gets absurdly loud and I never get near its max volume.APPEARANCE / DESIGNI have both plain jane and crazy busy looking speakers and, again, this falls somewhere in the middle.  The honeycomb design gives it visual appeal without getting ridiculous with swirls, zig zags and colors.  Have you ever thought of a speaker as ergonomic?  I haven't until I picked up this speaker.  It fits comfortable in the hand if you decide to just carry it and the rounded corners and rubberized exterior make it easy to grip.  Finally, there is a flat spot on one of the corners so you can either lay the speaker flat to fire forward or on the corner so it fires up and a 45 degree angle.  This was nice when I set it in my passenger car seat and wanted the speakers aiming up towards my head.In summary, I really like the Sinoband S400S and would go so far as to say its currently my favorite speaker.  I received a complementary unit for review purposes, but my opinion provided above is unbiased and would recommend to others.

These locks are primarily designed for your luggage, even though it states other uses, I would not use this on a gym locker or other use due to durability.  So why still 4-stars?  Because luggage is inherently easy to "break into" when all you need to do is pop the zipper with a pocket knife or screw driver.  I view luggage locks as a deterrent for the opportunist crook that does not want to make a scene.  For that, these will serve their purpose.  I tried to twist and break the case with my bare hands and, while there was some audible cracking, I could not do it.  Given the plastic case though, I don't think it would be too difficult to break it open with a flat head screwdriver.  Again, that would probably cause a scene and if you were taking tools to a suitcase, you could just as easily break the zipper.If you view luggage locks with the same perspective as me, this may work for you, but if you want strong and durable lock, there are better options.  I received a complimentary product for review purposes and my unbiased opinion was given above.

I was anxious to try the diffuser soon after it arrived due to the simple design and shape since most diffusers can be a little too taste specific.  The first thing i noticed was that the power cord was merely a USB adapted cable.  This could be a plus or minus.  For me, i happened to have an extra USB brick. This means you can also power it from any powered USB outlet like on computers and some TVs.  For some, it will mean you need to buy a USB brick.Once plugged in, it was very straightforward to use.  I like how, when lit up, it resembles a candle, only with the mist coming out the side.  Mine did not have the ability to change color that i could tell.  The light button merely changed the brightness of the white light.  I even tried holding it down and no luck.  Not a big deal for me as i was planning on just using white anyway, but that's clearly not how it's advertised.Overall, this is a budget friendly diffuser for any small room of your home.  I received a complimentary sample for review purposes and my unbiased opinion was given above.

These headphones have very good sound quality and I like the wood finish.  There is decent bass response and good overall balanced sound.  The ear buds also stay in my ear comfortably.  The cord has a cloth type material covering it, which seems pretty durable, but can create some noise when its rubbing against your clothes.  I don't regret my purchase, but might look for a set without the textured cords next time.

While there are several alarm clocks that offer dual alarms, I was looking for one that specifically had a nap feature.  We have a newborn and need to feed on 3 hour intervals, so I thought it would be a nice thing to have.  After receiving it, I realized that it only goes up to 99 minutes.  My previous Sony alarm clock allowed for a lot more time, so I didn't think about it (newer Sony ones don't appear to have the nap timer any more).  With that said, the nap function is less useful, but the rest of the clock functions are fine.You set the time zone and DST on the back and the time came up right the first time I plugged it in.  Setting the alarm is a one button deal, so you can't set hour and minutes separately.  You can cycle forward and backwards, so there is less chance of overshooting your setting, but its still not a friendly clock if you need to change alarm times often.The USB charging ports seem to work fine.  The manual says that the phone one is 1A and the tablet one 2.1A.  Your device has to be able to accept 2.1A charging or it will default to 1A, so you cant just plug your phone in there and hope for quick charging.Overall, the clock feels a little cheap.  If I had a do over, I would go back and get a Sony clock.  The quality is so much better.  I would have done without USB charging and just got the Sony ICFC1T Alarm Clock Radio for about the same money.  As it is, this clock will serve its purpose, so we'll see how long it lasts.

I was using a stove top steam basket to sterilize, but it became too much work.  We have a Dr Brown bottle warmer and a few Dr Brown bottles, so this sterilizer was a natural choice.  Its a good size so that I can fit 2 medela pump bottles and a few feeding bottles.  Works well as far as I can tell.  I just wish there was a way to know for sure.  I microwave for the specified amount of time for my microwave wattage, but how do I really know?  Other than the uncertainty, it functions fine!  Will cause no damage to your microwave since this is no different than heating up a cup of water.

Purchased a pair of these for the nursery and the hallway.  Lights come on quick and give off a good amount of light.  It helps if you have low, white ceilings because this shoots a beam straight up and reflected light off the ceiling helps light up the room.  Also lights up the floor area around the light too.I did not experience broken prongs like other reviews.  These were nice and tight.  These are a tad bulky and not really decrotive, but very functional. Would buy again!

While Brandon's first release was an excellent book of photography, it lacked many of the stories behind the individuals.  I came to find HONY on facebook and feel the story behind the photo is half the experience.  With his newest release, it all comes together to give you the full HONY package that most people have come to know and love.  This book is a bargain for all the passion and work that Brandon puts into this project.If you are deciding on whether or not to buy the book, consider the following, which Brandon posted on the HONY facebook page: "I want to take a quick opportunity to remind everyone that HONY is advertisement free and almost entirely financed by book sales. (The only exception being income from a handful of speeches I give every year.) Proceeds from books have been used to pay for trips to twenty different countries over the past year alone. Even when working with large organizations like the United Nations or UNHCR, I’m always very careful to cover all costs and reimburse any expenses. I do this so that the content on HONY can remain entirely independent, self-directed, and transparent. By purchasing a book, you can help HONY continue to grow in a way that remains focused on telling people’s stories--- and nothing else. Thanks to everyone for your continued support."Connect with real people.  Get out of your box and learn about people different from you.  Get to know their story.  Support the project.  Buy the book!

Our newborn is a deep sleeper and it turns out that the pain medicine that my wife was prescribed for her C-Section made its way to baby through the milk and made it hard to wake him up.  We had to have him on IV for a day while my wife rid her body of the pain med so we could start feeding again.  In the meantime, his sleep was so deep, that it really worried us and we got this for peace of mind.During that first week, this alarmed us several times a night that his breathing was low (alarms for less than 10 breaths per minute) and we were able to wake him a little to get him out of deep deep sleep.  Now at the end of our second week, it looks like the pain meds are out of his little body and he's not getting into as deep of sleep.  He is still on the low end of the recommended range (30 BPM), so I think we'll continue to use it until we are past 3-4 months or so.One gripe is that you should expect some false alarms.  I got one that said he wasn't breathing and I was sitting right there watching him when it went off.  He was breathing fine.  There were also some for low breathing when I don't think it was that low.  It has helped with those few episodes where it really was low though.  I also wish it would track his BPM through the night so you could see a chart or at least the average the next morning.  There is only a live reading.  The pad is small... its not a problem in the bassinet, but I can see him rolling off of this often once we put him in the crib.  Finally, when we bought this, the listing said it was discontinued.  I take that to mean that there will no longer be support for this product and that you shouldn't expect any app updates.  That adds a little risk if there are any issues.You need to weigh the options as to if you think this will help you out or drive you more crazy.  For us, if it helped us wake him from that one episode that could have gone bad, it was worth it.

I searched high and low for a baby monitor that would fit our needs, which was to be able to pan and zoom as well as have a 2-way intercom.  I looked for one with the 'best' reviews and if you search as long as I have, you'll find that ALL monitors are hit and miss and ALL monitors image looks nothing like the box.  The attached photo was of my mom rocking our baby, but its the zoomed in screen shot.  Resolution zoomed out is a little better.With that said, this one seems to be working well for us so far.  The screen size is perfect enough to see baby, but not be too large that its a hassle to carry around.  The functions work as advertised, so I just hope it keeps working for the long haul.

If you rely on your phone as much as most people do, you are likely concerned with battery life and could use a back up plan should you run out of juice.  Some options are to keep chargers with you everywhere you go, adding a battery back up case or keeping a spare battery pack with you.  This battery pack is one of several options out there for you to consider.Some things that I like about it are its compact size and the fact that the charger connections are built right into the device.  You can also recharge the battery pack with the usb connection built in instead of needed a separate cable.  The downside(s) to this particular model is the limited battery capacity and the fact that the iPhone connection cannot be used with a protective case on your phone.  Most people I know have a case on their phone, and most of them are not easy to remove.  However, that is only an issue with iPhones since the plug for android devices can be used with a case.The downside for android devices is that most tend to be larger, with larger batteries, and the capacity of this would not even provide a single full charge.  It will, however, fully charge your iPhone, hence I feel this is an ideal backup for iPhone users that do not use a case (or their case is easily removable).  If you are in this market segment, this is a good device, otherwise, considering the price and size, I would recommend getting the 5000 mAh version instead, since its almost the same price and the physical size is not much larger.I was provided a unit at a reduced price for review purposes and my unbiased opinion was given above.

I was not aware that the shipment would come from overseas when ordering, but item arrived in a reasonable amount of time and it works and feels as expected. The puck can be inserted and removed relatively easily.

As you can read from most reviews, this is made entirely of plastic, so the rim is not soft rubber like the OEM version.  As long as you are okay with that, this is a good replacement.  Fits in the existing slots nice and snug.  Even though I prefer the rubber, the OEM one broke because the plastic trim is so thin.  This should be more durable.

I have been using Viva Coconut oil for about a year and use it primarily for cooking and sealing my cast iron cookware and sometimes as a skin softener.  I was given a sample of this to review and when it arrived, I was shocked!  Whoa, its big!  After I cracked it open and gave it a sample, it had much of the same quality as the Viva oil, but slightly more aromatic (but still mild).  If you are looking for a good quality oil and need to buy it in bulk, you might want to give this one a try.  Great value for the price... it will last me quite a while!!

My top drawer in my night stand needed some serious organization.  It is basically my "catch all" drawer and it was just a pile of crap.  With this set, I used the 2 small square and two rectangle boxes to section out my top drawer.  Its helped bring some order to the chaos.  The two remaining large square boxes are 12x12 and fit perfectly in my ClosetMaid Cubeical Organizer.After ordering, I now wish I would have gotten a color other than black.  Since my drawer is not well lit, some dark things tend to disappear against the dark background.  Not a fault of the boxes themselves though.

I first heard this band through my Prime Music account and, initially, didn't even realize that they were a Christian group.  It was just really good, ear-catching music.  As I listened to the good message, the story of a talented, God-loving group unfolded into my ears.  Even though I could listen to them 'Free" on Prime, I went ahead and bought the album so I could have them with me for good (first Prime music that I've turned around and purchased).  I recommend you do the same!

I needed a mirror to keep an eye on our newborn (coming within the next month!) and don't have a center head rest in my 2007 Honda Accord.  I want to keep the seat in the center, so whats a parent to do?  Get this mirror!  Installation was very simple and straightforward.  The only thing I had to do different from the pictures is wrap the horizontal strap under the headrest on one side, so it didn't slide up.My wife has a mirror installed on the center headrest in her RAV4 and, while it does have a direct view of the car seat, it obstructs the rear view quite a bit.  After installing this, I almost prefer this one because I still have good visibility out the rear window, yet can still see the car seat.  I have not driven around a lot with it installed, so I can't comment yet on how well it stays in place, but all things are looking good so far.  I will report back if it starts shifting.  Would recommend!

Needed a case for my new tablet and picked the blue to match the color of the tablet back.  I like how it snaps into the hard case nice and snug and how the magnetic flap stays securely shut.  Inside is felt lined so it doesn't scuff your screen.  Can prop it up easily for hands free viewing.  Good value!

I just needed a basic tablet for the main room for checking email, facebook, playing music and buying more stuff off Amazon :-)  For that, this tablet fits the bill. Don't expect to multi-task (stream music, check email and Facebook at same time), but it will manage single tasks pretty well.  Try to do too much and you will run out of RAM fast and it will get laggy.  Keep in mind that there are some apps that you can never completely shut off that will run in the background and eat up RAM.  All Facebook (facebook, page manager, messenger and instagram) and Amazon apps (product store, app store, instant video, music and kindle) seem to fall into this category.The colors are great, which was important to me, since I like viewing photos (Instagram, 500px), and the sound is good to, but not very loud. You might need an external Bluetooth speaker.  Battery life is up there with the best of them.With expectations set reasonably, you will appreciate this tablet. If you have a modern phone and expect similar performance, you might be disappointed.  I have an LG Optimus Pro G with 2 GB of RAM and it operates much smoother and can handle more tasks.  This tablet is certainly worth the price, though, for a budget tablet.  Price will bounce between a hundred bucks and full retail.  I picked it up for one hundred ten. Google the model number (ZA030046US) to find the best current price.UPDATE:  A new firmware update has helped the tablet operate a little smoother (although still not perfect) and it also added the ability to clear all the open programs with one tap.  Previously you had to close each one individually.  Still enjoying it and use it primarily for playing music (it pairs with my speaker much quicker than my phone), checking email and watching videos.  For more processor and memory hungry tasks, I stick to my phone.

My wife has needed some additional massaging being in her 34th week of pregnancy and my hands have just not been up for the task.  I ordered these and they've helped me out tremendously!  I wish the plastic was a little stiffer, because if you press down too hard, they will buckle.  This may be by design so you don't apply too much pressure, but my wife likes deep tissue massages and needs some additional pressure.  If you are the same way, these will still work well, but you may want to consider something a little stiffer.

Another fun Angry Birds game for those that have exhausted all efforts on previous versions.  Has graphics and feel closest to AB Rio.  Only starts off with one bird, but with creative control, being able to stop the bird mid-air and "slingshot" in a different direction. Hoping to see more birds as play continues!

I first encountered this game when it came pre-installed on a tablet that I recently purchased.  The graphics are clean and the game play passes the time quickly!  Its just good, clean, silly fun!  You can't help but grin when playing and those watching will probably crack a smile too!  Fun for the whole family.Now being "Actually Free", those annoying IAPs are gone!  Glad to find in the Underground!!

When I first heard of Heads Up! we immediately downloaded it and had a lot of fun, but it faded fast due to the limited free decks.  Now with Amazon Underground, all of the expansion decks are free!!  There are 30 expansion decks that normally would have been $0.99 each, but there is a line through each one and you can just play them directly.  The additional decks were:Adult SupervisionFriends (the show)Rhyme TimeBad BehavoirAnatomically CorrectExpress YourselfMix it UpVideo Game LandIcons, Legends & StarsBlock Buster MoviesHey Mr DJPerfect PairsHip HopSuper HeroesBrandedFood FightMovie BuffFavorite Fictional CharactersWish You Were HereAs Seen On TVAll the Right MovesI'm With the BandSports LegendsTotally 80sThats so 90s70s FeverBroadway BabyTake It LiterallyAct it Out - SidekickSo, with $30 worth of free expansion decks, it this Underground thing legit?  Is it for a limited time?  Did I sell my soul to the devil?  I dont know, but in the meantime, anyone want to play Heads Up!?
My wife has been using these to ease her nausea during pregnancy.  Does not eliminate it, but there is a definite improvement.  Recommend at least trying it!

Fun game until you are forced to buy your way in to playing it longer.  Play it as long as you can without paying into it or annoying your facebook friends and then delete it.  If you have kids that would throw a tantrum if they couldn't keep playing, this game could get very expensive, fast.
Package arrived with a few pieces broken, but not enough to make them useless.  Love the colors that work great for making photography announcement boards or doodling with the kids.  Would buy again!

My wife and I are expecting in October.  The first book my wife wanted to buy was this one to keep in the nursery.  She wants this to be a book that our child keeps the rest of his/her life, so I made sure to buy the hardcover.  Perfect gift for a baby shower or for yourself!

I cut the cable a few years ago and have loved not being a slave to the cable company, but there is always the struggle of getting a clear signal for the basics (what I consider to be ABC, CBS, NBC, FOX, CW and PBS).  I have not had much trouble for most of them except ABC, which is about 40 miles away and separated by a mountain range.I tried a cheaper amplified flat antenna and had no success whatsoever, but have had luck with the Winegard FV-30BB FreeVision, so I decided to try their FlatWave.  After hooking it up and doing my scan, I picked it right up!  I do have to use the amplifier and position the antenna close to the window at least 4 feet off the ground, but it comes in.  My wife still thinks this is unsightly, but its better than having the bulky FreeVision in our living room.  I did not notice anything that would suggest that its refurbished and would not hesitate to buy it again.  Recommend!

A common scenario around my house is family sitting around the TV messing with their phone or tablet and being tethered to the wall with a short, 3 foot charging cord.  Everyone is leaning off the sides of the couch the whole time.  Meet the Skiva PowerFlow SmartQuad.  I plugged this in and set it on the corner end table where our couches meet.  Not only is this a multi-port usb charger, but it also serves as an extension.  Now we can sit at the couch normally and stay charged without having to lean off the side.The unit was tested simultaneously charging my LG Optimus Pro G, my wife's iPhone 5s and a bluetooth speaker and it worked perfectly!  A nice feature of this product is that it will detect your device and provide the correct and best amperage for a quick charge, no matter which port you use.  Other similar chargers have dedicated ports for the type of device you are charging, which can be confusing and may not give you the optimal power you need for all the devices you are charging.  If you are buying one for a common area of a business (i.e. coffee house), this feature is essential as you cannot expect your customers to try and figure out what port to use.  From my testing, I noticed that all my devices charged very quickly.Its also nice that the ports are spread out so that items with a larger base can be charged and it also helped direct the cords to users sitting in different areas.  This can also be used as a travel charger, so that you don't have to pack each items 'brick' and you can just bring this and the cords.  The only down side is that its not very compact and is a tad bulky.  It may be better to bring your individual charging bricks if you only have a couple items.  Its most beneficial if you'll use all 4 ports.Nice device should you need a multi-port charger.  I received a complementary unit for review purposes and my unbiased opinion was given above.

I cut the cable long ago and have been streaming my content and getting over the air channels for a few years now.  The only problem is I have been using a metal antenna in the living room that has been an eye sore, so I'm exploring these flat antenna options.  The antenna seems okay, but the amplifier feels like its going to fall apart in my hands.  The number of channels and signal strength is no different with it on or off.  On top of all that, it would not pick up my 'trouble' channel, which is about 40 miles away.  Based on that, I decided to return it.If you can't spend more than $30 and think you can get by without the amplifier, try the non amplified Winegard Flatwave FL-5000.  Or, if you think you really need amplification and you're not squeamish about buying refurbished, try the refurbished Winegard FL-55YR Flatwave antenna for about the same price (at the time of this review).  That's what I did and it did indeed pick up my 'trouble' channel!  There is a difference!With any flat antenna, don't expect it to perform as good as a metal HD antenna, but it will get you most of your channels while keeping a low profile.

I am trying to base my option based on the cost that I paid, which was only $18.  I understand that this is an inexpensive item, but its not terribly useful, as delivered.  I don't see how this can be functional at all unless you attach it to your door at several points.  It swings and moves all over the place, even when opening the door slowly.  I used some Command Wire Hooks to attach it to the door in multiple spots and it will work okay after rigging it.  We are just using it to put small towels and bathroom items on the back of the bathroom closet door.  I would not put anything fragile or with any significant weight in this thing.I understand that you get what you pay for, but this has a hard time delivering on its basic function without further modification.

I have a Kammok Roo and love how comfortable it is. I never considered the "hammock life" until I got hooked on hanging in this thing. The problem is, my wife has also become fond of hanging, so I was off to find another hammock!While I love my Roo, its on the expensive side and its also pretty large where I felt like I was getting swallowed up sometimes. In my mind a 'single' person hammock would be just the right size for me. Having heard a lot about ENO, naturally I purchased the SingleNest without doing much more research. While its a quality hammock, it was a tad on the small side. I kept saying to myself, "if only it was a little bigger." Thumbing around the internet, I found the Grand Trunk single. Since its about 5" wider and over a foot longer, I just knew it would be the perfect fit. I sold my SingleNest and bought this one. I was right! Its the perfect size! Not too big, not too small (and it was cheaper!). To give you some reference, I'm 5'11" and 210 lbs and am able to lay slightly on the diagonal so I can get almost flat. That leaves me just enough fabric for me to prop my arm up as a little arm rest.One downside is that the fabric is just a tad rougher than the ENO, but its not something that is going to cause me to return it (it does not compare to the Roo... that fabric is heavenly). Another minor gripe is that the carabiners are huge and clunky. ENO and Kammok are using the smaller, lighter weight climbing carabiners, but thats something that can be easily replaced with better carabiners or descending rings. On the plus side, they do give you some cord so that you can start hanging immediately. If you plan on using the hammock frequently, you will probably want to upgrade to webbing or something similar (i.e. Python straps) in the future.All in all, I'm very impressed with this hammock and would recommend it to anyone considering an ENO or a hammock at all.

After a summer of wearing Birkenstock sandals, my feet are a little less desirable. They are dry, cracked, and in need of nourishment. I normally don't like creams for my skin because I hate feeling greasy, especially on my feet. But I thought I try this product. I'm happy to say that I really enjoyed it and it worked on my icky feet wonderfully. The scent is mild, and the effect is immediate and transformative. I've been using it for a week and my feet never felt better, and not at all greasy.

It's hard to imagine the loss of a child, and even harder to experience it. Artist Tom Hart lost his young daughter rather unexpectedly, and this memoir, "Rosalie Lighting" is a beautiful, heartbreaking, and emotionally wrought tome sharing his horrible experience.The memoir is divided into several small sections, creating a shattering effect that one must feel when this happens. Tom intricately introduces us to his daughter, and slowly rolls out the story of her death, and the months following as he and his wife navigate this horrendous occurrence. All of the expected emotions surface, however, Tom's approach to exploring them, both through art and words, puts his own spin on the experience. At times, you will stop at the beauty of a phrase or the emotion pouring out of a single picture.Somehow, he manages to balance both the intense pain and grief of losing a  child, and bringing her to life through this pages once again. In this way, Rosalie lives again, in our heart as well as his. Highly recommended, and have a box of Kleenex ready.

I really, really wanted to like this book. Thurgood Marshall, the first African-American associate justice of the Supreme Court has been a hero of mine. Fighting injustice in America's schools, on the front line of the civil rights movement, battling racial injustice on the field of the court system. When it came time for his due, President Lyndon Johnson nominated him for the highest court, setting him up for a potentially brutal battle.However, the results of this book are uneven at best. The author, Wil Haygood, starts off strongly with the nomination, and quickly moves to the confirmation hearings. Then takes the unsurprising detour into Thurgood's history. In fact, that's part of the problem with this story. In an editorial misstep of sorts, Haygood loses control of the narrative, as the fight for civil rights and the state of America during this time begin to sway him away from his central focus. Unfortunately, he has some factual errors that are glaring and embarrassing (FDR was not alive at the end of WWII). Thurgood gets lost in the book from time to time. I understand the need for historical context, however reading this book at times felt like Haywood was more interested in telling those stories than Marshall's own.By the time we reorient ourselves to the main story, I'd lost my own interest and focus, and chose not to finish this book. Again, I really wanted to like it, but found the literary wanderings of the author, and the historical errors, too much to overlook.

When i learned that Brian Selznick published another book, I purposefully decided not to learn anything about the book. Swept away by his previous novels The Invention of Hugo Cabret and Wonderstruck (Schneider Family Book Award - Middle School Winner), I knew that the story would encompass much emotion, realness, tenderness and heart. Alas, I was wrong. The Marvel has all of that, and so much more.The book starts with a series of amazing prints, drawn by Selznick, that tell the story of the Marvels visually. As always with his intimate, perfect drawings, the story unfolds beautifully. With the turn of a page, years fall away, beloved characters live and die, and generations are presented. It is all too tempting to turn the pages quickly through this section. Take your time. Enjoy the artwork, scope out details that later on may be important, pay attention to the eyes. Selznick is a master of drawing the eyes.Soon, the pictures give away to a story about a young boy fleeing from a harsh boarding school in England, trying to find a long lost uncle holed up in out-of-time house in London. Set in the early 90's, Joseph's story is somehow connected to the magnificent pictures you just leafed through ... but how? That is the glorious mystery of this novel. Arriving at the house, his uncle, Albert Nightgale, is strange, distant, and not all willing to help out his forgotten nephew. But he does, because deep down, Albert's heart is there, if somewhat hidden.I so want to talk so much about this book, but fear spoilers would give away the surprises that Selznick has planned. Suffice it to say, the actual story that is hidden in pages unfolds in unpredictable ways, that reveal a tenderness that are reflected in those first pictures of the story.Selznick has written a tale that honors our history and our future, explores the meaning of objects in our lives, and how and to whom we choose to devote our lives. This book is simply a masterpiece.Thank you, Mr. Selznick, for yet another tour de force. We wait so long in between your books, and now I know why. The wait is worth it.

This is my first attempt at a cordless headphone for my running. I run about 3 miles every day (not a lot), but enough to warrant trying this product. I'm just back from my first run, and they were great.First, finding the foam to fit my ears was quite easy. Although, I haven't tried to fit any of the guards yet. I charged up the headphones and soon was out on my run. The headphones are light, and the dangly cord is heavy enough that the earpieces stay put. I first noticed the cord bouncing a bit more than normal, but soon it didn't bother me. My earbuds stayed in my entire run (mind you, I run slowly... but today was windy), and the sound quality was excellent. I don't really expect good sound quality during my run, but these were great.I highly recommend them!

After finishing this book last night, I'm still a bit perplexed about this story, and I am vacillating about my star rating. My indecision stems from parts of the story that I absolutely love, the target audience that I suspect this book is intended to reach, and an ending (no spoilers here) that was a mix of disappointment and understanding. If I could give half stars, I think I'd land it at 3.5 stars.Jack lives with his family on a farm in Maine, and take in foster boy Joseph, who comes from a hideous past. Joseph, at age of thirteen, became a father of baby Jupiter, and spends the story wrestling with this reality. Jack and his family provide a warm, understanding cocoon for Joseph as he adjusts to adults (and a special cow) who care for him. Most of his time is spent with foster brother Jack, as Jack tries to navigate the complex mental issues of Joseph with honesty and occasional rule violations.It's the relationship between the two boy that drives the story, at least it did for me. Jack counting Joseph's smiles was profoundly beautiful and innocent, and a sign of Joseph's thaw. Much like the beautiful way that Schmidt describes the winter-soaked Maine countryside, deep in snow, ice, and frozen wonder. He writes his outside as frosty as can be, making the inside of Jack's home and the barn warm, nurturing places they need to be.Yet, it's in the ending that I felt I got lost a bit, and the narrative drive that kept me in the story got lost as well. Let's just say that I would have wanted a different ending.My disappointment with the ending doesn't mask the beauty of the story. This is not a story for elementary students. Schmidt's simplicity in the writing makes this a perfect story for middle schoolers who need a easier text to navigate, but not a "dumbing down" of the content. I could easily see what rich and insightful conversations this book will inspire in ELA classrooms across our middle schools.The title is Orbiting Jupiter, but for me, the true orbit is Jack and Joseph.

Long, fun, and perfect for Halloween! In fact, I haven't used it yet because it's not Halloween, but I can't wait for it. It will be the perfect accompaniment piece for the tablecloth, or our coffee table, or mantle!

This lamp was selected for my office desk at work. I like the classical styling of it, and wanted something bright yet subtle.It took me less than five minutes after opening the box to set up this lamp. It is very easy and requires no reading of directions nor tools. I noticed on the cord several odd spots of white flakes (it appears to be paint), but they were easily scraped off. Even better, the lamp comes with a high bulb already!The lamp is strong, charming, and perfectly illuminates my desk. If I am working alone in my office, and don't want our tacky overlight lights on, I'll be using my lamp quite a bit.
As a white man, I cannot appreciate this book enough. Insightful, deep, worthy of a read, and even more, worthy of a discussion. This should be required reading by every American. Highly recommended.

So I was simply looking for another cord to charge up my iPhone downstairs. What I received was a mammoth serious cord. This cord is much thicker that then one I got from Apple. It works perfectly right out of the package with zero effort to set up and start running. I imagine the thicker cord leads to a quicker recharge, but I haven't tested that yet. A great buy!

I normally use either my iPod earbuds when I'm running, or my Bose headphones when I'm out and about in the world. I wanted to try these headphones as sort of a happy medium between the two. I'm happy to report that despite some odd fit issues, these headphones were pretty great. The sound was clear, crisp, and just as good as my Bose. However, as other reviewers have indicated, the shape of the headphones fit oddly. A couple of times, they fell out because they weren't snug enough inside my ear canal. My doctor once told me that I have small ear canals, so that could be the issue. I imagine with continued use, the shape of the outside will form more comfortably in the ear. I do recommend these!

I really wanted to like this story. It seemed to have all of the elements of a novel that I would enjoy: some social relevance, a narrative that sweeps over multiple countries, complex characters. However, upon reading it, I honestly only made it through about 60% of the story. My interest began waning about halfway through. I can't exactly say why. Perhaps it was a stylist choice the author made with the the main character reading a journal from her missing daughter, and the character reflecting/commenting on what she just read. It began to irritate as I couldn't find my place in either part of the story. In any rate, I failed to finish this book.

The first thing you notice when you take these towels out of the plastic bag is the overpowering smell. It's sort of a plastic smell. However, one toss in the wash and that went away. We've been using the towels for a week. They are thinner than your normal towel, and don't seem to dry as well as our other dish towels. These seem to be more on the scale of "decorative" towel than for everyday use. If you are looking for some cute towels to spice up the look for your kitchen, then these are the ones. If you are looking for soft, hard working towels, you may want to move on.

This device worked right out of the box. It was easy to plug in and get it operational. I like devices that are high tech and no-brainer. If you need to extend your Wifi, I highly recommend this product.
We play this game quite a bit. Great for the whole family, and full of fun! Highly recommended.

To be honest, YA romance-type novels aren't really my cup of tea. However, upon reading the description of this book on the Vine website, it was intriguing just enough to get me to request it. Glad that I did! Everything, Everything, which I received yesterday, and finished today, is a well-worth your time story of trial, tribulation, and teenage angst, all sealed in a germ-free bubble.Madeline Whittier is your average seventeen year old girl, with one slight problem. She's literally allergic to the outside world. Fearing harmful consequences, Madeline's mother, who is a doctor herself, creates a home that is sealed off from the world and raises her daughter, alone, inside of it. With the help of a nurse who constantly monitors her health, Madeline has managed to have a life, get educated, and seem relatively adjusted. Until the boy next door moves in, and her heart awakens for the first time.Olly, a somewhat Emo moody youth with the soul of an acrobat, enchants dear Madeline in a way that only he can. He too has his own back story, and is saddled with a family that at its best is dysfunctional. How Yoon unpacks his story is unique, and I appreciated her skill in writing in doing so. Olly has a few surprises in store too.So far, this seems somewhat in the vein of "The Fault in Our Stars" or your typical romance-ish book. I just advise you, without writing any spoilers here, to go through the story. Yoon has many twists and turns in this plot that are both revolutionary and realistic. You end up with a book that will compel much discussion, in schools and in families, about many issues.One of the reasons this is a compelling novel is the way that Yoon handles the characterization of Madeline. She could have easily been a stereotype, or a heroic "damsel-in-distress" (which is somewhat playfully mocked n the book). Yet Yoon keeps her real, and sometimes painfully so. As Madeline's heart awakens, and she realizes more and more the life she has inside can never be the life she yearns for outside, and that conflict drives the story. Also, I appreciated Madeline's multi-racial background, which features in the story but is not the driver of the story. It's a nice touch as we begin to include more characters in our YA books that represent the many different people in our country.Through an innovative use of chats, pictures, graphs, and notes, this story of Madeline's awakening is a refreshing look at your typical YA story, and it had me hooked from the first couple of pages. I highly recommend this story.

So I've been using this pillow since receiving it this past Friday. My succinct review is: eh.The pillow comes wrapped in in plastic looking oddly like a cylinder. Opening it, you are greeted with a curvy object and an intense "new  car" smell to the pillow, which, even after several days of airing, I can still smell. The pillow flattened out nicely (as the directions suggested). It is a hefty pillow, not a light pillow by any means, that is a bit heavy as well. Laying on the pillow originally felt comfortable, but the heaviness made it harder to move around on the bed.Every night I fell asleep quickly using this pillow. And every morning I wake up with my second pillow under my head as well. It seems like I prefer more pillow than this pillow is giving me, and I honestly don't remember shoving that second pillow under my head. So I must need more.This pillow is middlin'. I'm planning to move this one to the guest bedroom, and back to my former pillow, which I really enjoy.

So, when I ordered this product from Amazon Vine, I thought I was getting blue towels. What actually came were red striped, not matching anything I have in the kitchen. And I love them.They are strong, soft, and very absorbent. They managed to dry everything in the kitchen that I needed to dry, and didn't come out soaking wet.So color be damned, I'm very happy with them. Throw out my old ones because these are great!

Do you love the old game "Operation"? Do you have a Spongebob Squarepants fan at home? Then this gift is for you! It is a pretty standard version of the classic game with an under the sea twist that makes it fun for the whole family. I think game makers are catching on to the trend of updating some of the games that we Gen Xers grew up with with a "modern" twist, making them fun for the whole family. Whatever the reason, this is a fun updating of the game, and highly recommended.

So I do love fragrances, and wear them regularly for work. I initially was skeptical about whether a fragrance would ideally work for both men and women. How is that possible? Well, this one does. The scent of this is a perfect compliment to spring. It was refreshing without being too strong, and very clean smelling. It is very different from the Tommy that I usually wear, and a couple of people that I met up with yesterday noticed the new scent. I would buy this one again!

So apparently, having electric shocks delivered through pads that you place your feet on is "a thing". I hadn't heard about it before ordering this device from Amazon. I originally thought it was some sort of foot massager, and I love a good foot rub.However, upon plugging in and turning on, it was clear the device had a different purpose. Little electric shocks began to pulsate through my feet and into my legs. Through a hand held remote, you can adjust the shocks to increase the intensity. The first time I did it, I put it at 15. After several uses, I'm up to 30.The effect is strange. Designed to increase blood flow into the legs and feet, it seems to work well. I can feel the effects in my legs long afterwards. It not necessarily relaxing, nor is it uncomfortable. But I do enjoy my go arounds with this device and can't help but feel that it's helping somehow. My partner also enjoys his time and uses it after me. They also include a few patches to attach, in case you want shocks delivered to other muscles. I have yet to try that, and honestly, I don't think I will!The AccuRelief is heavy, sturdy and well made. If you are looking for a foot shocker, it's one of the best!

I bought it's predecessor for my iPhone Five and enjoyed it, so I was excited to see that they had a larger version for my 6.I've only worn this once on my run Sunday, and for some reason, I had to fiddle with trying to insert my phone into the band, as well as the strap. It took me a little longer that normal. I also had some issues with the plastic sleeve covering the screen and not being able to easily access the apps I needed for running. Perhaps this was designed for both sizes of iPhones, and since I have the smaller one, the fit wasn't right.It still worked, just not as good as my other one, hence the three stars.

The first time I ever saw a product like this was in the movie "Juno". Paulie put something on his legs that looked like deodorant. What it turned out to be was something similar to this product. When it popped up in my Vine account, I was excited to try it.So on the last few runs, I liberally applied this product to the sides of my legs. My running shorts tend to "ride up with wear" (yes, that's an 'Are You Being Served' references for us fans out there!) and I'm always yanking them down. However, on my last set of runs, that wasn't an issue after using this product. It is odorless and easy to use.Consider me a fan of this too.

So, when I put this "shabby chic" tablecloth on our conference table at work, the first question I got was, "When did you go shopping at Dollar Tree?" The comments quickly devolved from there. This product is so cheap and awful looking, that I would have felt ripped off if I bought it at Dollar Tree. The only, and I mean the only, possible use for this tablecloth is for a junior high school production of "Hello Dolly" and you wanted the mere appearance of something nice.Buyer beware: you get what you pay for.
What a fun and engaging game for the little ones! The Frozen theme will be guaranteed to be an immediate hit. A great way to learn and practice letters.

Charles M. Blow has written a memoir that is both frank and fresh, real and incredibly painful at times to read. As Blow recounts his childhood in the South, he recounts how he and his family navigates the complex racial mores of the times in chilling and honest ways. As I read books such as this, I find myself reflecting on how I would attempt to handle such situations, and fear that I would not be successful. Blow didn't have a choice in the matter; survive or die. What is most compelling about this book was his writing, described by others as lyrical, which is apt. He doesn't overburden his text with extra words, and doesn't shy away from anything either. Definitely recommend this book, especially for those interested in real African-American experiences in our country.

At first, this book didn't grab my attention. The first chapter was a bit of slog through, and I thought that I wasn't going to like it. But then, Goldstein hits her stride, and knocks the book out of the park with her chapter on black teachers after the Civil War. I began to appreciate this book as an parallel somewhat to Howard Zinn's "A People's History of the United States", only with an educational focus. Goldstein is again less successful as she wanders through the unionization movement, but still provides an interesting story. One thing is clear after reading this book, education has always been somewhat of a societal punching bag, and that will only continue as we venture on into the future.

As a person in a grad school program to become an educational administer, I have to say that this book is not only full of good, practical advice, but has been one of the best books I've read about the job to date. By giving three tasks that principals need to follow: leading learning at the building level, becoming a district and system player, and being a change agent. It is not only informative, but personally inspirational. After reading this book, one believes that despite the complexities and hardships of the job, one can and should do it. Highly recommended!

This is another delightful collection of poems that will speak to anyone who is in education. Carefully selected, they come with personal explanations to their meaning, although they do speak well for themselves. As a mentor for new teachers, I often share a poem at an appropriate time with my teachers, and they've come to appreciate them. I cannot wait to share these!

... the story comes together in a fluid, heartbreaking sort of way that made the reading journey there all the worthwhile. After previously reviewing the fantastic book by Mr. Rachman, "The Imperfectionists", I was excited to read his newest creation. Fortunately, he does not disappoint in the slightest.This is a complex and involved story of a girl named Tooly, and the three important times in her life, and how they've come to affect each other in ways that unfold slowly over the novel. At first, you are unplaced in each story, the only connective tissue between them is the girl, but then, Rachman, a master of his content, unspools each tale and starts to fill in gaps, answering questions posed in one time frame, only to ask more questions in another. All is resolved, and the journey is worthwhile.A note about Rachman's writing style: it is profound and wonderful. He manages to make the most mundane occurances rapt with interest, purely based on the words he chooses to use in insightful ways. Another author he reminds me of, who also masters words well, is Michael Cunningham, but their storytelling is definitely NOT similar. I appreciated Rachman's handling of all of the characters, even the less than admirable ones, making them pulse with a reality, warts and all.
This is a great quality, great board to use every day. The size is perfect, the surface smooth to write on, and erases well. Highly recommended value for the money.

Meet Handful, renamed Hetty by her owners, a resilient slave who, at the beginning of this story, is "given" as a gift. Meet Sarah, daughter of prominent slave owners, who instinctively recoils at the thought of actually owning another person. Thus sets in motion the dynamics of this compelling and quite remarkable story, based on real life, of both girls finding their voice and lives in pre-Civil War America.Told in alternating chapters, the story unfolds from these two distinct viewpoints, blending and melding together to create one powerful narrative. Kidd doesn't skimp on either's story; filling each one with rich details, backgrounds, traditions, and histories, making them wholly come alive. She holds nothing back: how slaves were treated in the antebellum south smash any stereotypes of "happy slaves working in the fields for their benevolent masters".Through her rebellious and quick-witted mother Charlotte, Handful learns to both navigate this horrid system as well as take advantage of it.At the same time, Kidd explores Handful's relationship with Sarah, which is incredibly complex. Are they friends? Are they equals in any way? What must happen between the two for that to occur? There are no easy answers here, but opportunities for some rich exploration and discussion. As the two girls grow up, the relationship is tested in many ways, as is each of the girls. Both confront the social mores of the time, and strive to overcome the limited expectations placed on both of them. In that way, they are sisters through and through.You leave the story enriched, impassioned, and ready to change the world, as Handful and Sarah tried to do. As it turns out, Sarah is based on a real life figure, as Kidd explores in her wonderfully insightful postscript. Handful is almost an invention. But that didn't make her story less real. Handful is just as real and realized as Sarah. And as a reader, you are better for knowing them.

Like most video game reviews that I write, I make it very clear that I'm not one of those "gamers" that spends 24 hours on a new game to solve it immediately. I play for about an hour at a time, not only to draw out the experience, but to relish the game. Also, as a fairly "older" player (I'm in my 40's), I tend to expect a lot from my gaming experiences (not a big fan of games primarily for little kids). I'm happy to report my complete satisfaction with UBI Soft's new game "Assassin's Creed IV: Black Flag".I first picked up this line of games with Assassin's Creed III. Because of the historical content (I wanted to see the renditions of Boston and other places), I was intrigued, and loved many aspects of the game. One of them was the sea battles that you completed from time to time. It only made sense that the new game capitalized on that aspect. And boy, they did.You are a pirate, completing missions and ever increasing the strength of your ship as you progress through the game. There are still aspects of the game (the modern day story) that I'm not too fond of, but unlike III, that aspect doesn't confuse or bother me as much.The sea battles are quite fun and quite stress reducing. Having a bad day? Attack and raid a few ships! As soon as I upgraded my ship the Jack Daw, attacking even the larger ships was fun. Going on raids, discovering buried treasure, and even harpooning sea life all makes for an enjoyable, escapist environment.I highly recommend this game for casual players like me, just wanting some fun, to those more experienced, who truly want to make the most of the game and environment.

... and found it user friendly, full of practical, if not terribly new or revelatory, advice. As a mentor of new teachers, I'm constantly on the hunt for materials that they could access without a lot of background knowledge or prior experience. This book fulfills that requirement. I found the chapters full of information and easy to read, not hedging too much on the philosophical underpinnings but giving practical advice that anyone could use right away. I would recommend this book.

... and that is that I didn't pick it up sooner. I'm not sure why. I'd seen it on the shelves of my local bookstores for a month or so. A longtime Henson fan, and growing up with the Muppets as a central part of my life, I should have naturally been drawn to the book. However, it wasn't until I'd read a glowing review of the book (where, I honestly can't remember) that it landed on my reading radar, and I picked it up.My treat to myself this holiday season of 2013 was this book, and it's been so incredibly enjoyable to read. One of the reasons is purely the subject matter. Jim Henson comes across exactly as all of us probably wanted him to be: kind, quiet, wickedly funny, and completely sincere. Clearly, Kermit wasn't too far from the tree ... or the arm ... and as we love Kermit, we love Jim in return. Spending time with him doses your soul with lightness and fun.That affect definitely wouldn't have happened had it not been for the writing of Brian Jay Jones. He moves along through the early part of Jim's life to get to the Muppets, and that is where his writing shines. He manages to mention enough that you feel like you are getting to know everything quite well, but doesn't drown you in details to make it a slog.And there is so much to learn about in this book: I never knew how totally integral Jim was to the development and creation of Sesame Street. Jones writes of an "insert" in the show with two girls, a dollhouse, a tea party, and two kittens, which I'd forgotten about for over 40 years. Jim's constant striving for new and excellence, from Emmett to Miss Piggy and beyond.Jim left us too early, but he left his legacy behind: the shows, the movies, the integral part he and his Muppets have taken in American culture. He was quite a gift to us. Give yourself a gift this holiday season, and enjoy spending some quality time with a whole bunch of friends ... Jim and the muppets.

Being a White House history fan, as well as a Harry Truman fan, I eagerly ordered this book. I knew about the reconstruction of the White House, (first learning about it with My Thirty Years Backstairs at the White House and Backstairs at the White House but never gave what they did a second thought. This new book "unearths" the story of the rebuilding of the White House, from its start to end, in an informative, interesting way.Robert Klara deftly manages to tell the story of a reconstruction of the building without plodding through too many "engineering details", which was what my fear was. When he does talk about the actual structure, his writing is supportive enough of the lay person to maintain understanding, while giving building enthusiasts what they want from this story as well. I found the actual story to be incredibly interesting, from the initial chandelier swaying in the blue room to literally pieces of the building falling on President Truman.Klara also includes details of the time, some of which informs the story by supporting decisions made by the designers to include a bomb shelter in the White House. I removed one star because sometimes I felt that Klara's detour into history was more of a way to fill out the book instead of illuminating the actual story. However, such detours do not entirely detract from the enjoyment of reading the story. Klara's chapters are never too long, filled with the right amount of information, which kept the story moving at a brisk, enjoyable pace.If you are a fan of presidential history, of buildings and architecture, or of the 1950's in general, this book is a must read!

We know the absolute hell that people went through after hurricane Katrina ravaged the New Orleans area. Images of people stuck in their attics, sitting on top of roofs waiting for rescue, violence, and the horror of the Superdome. Add to that this compelling, sometimes awful, story of a group of doctors and patients at Memorial Hospital.Let me start off by saying that this is by no means a pleasant read: it's a challenging book of a challenging time. Why is it so challenging? It challenges you on many levels. Given the horrific conditions of the hospital at the time, did the doctors and nurses, that may have acted inappropriately in the handling of some of the patients in the hospital, act out of human decency or frustration? This book doesn't offer easy answers. It's a thorough examination of the dire situation, and the actions that these people took, and the reverberating after effects of those choices.This book is not pleasant, but necessary. My question after finishing this story is that has anyone learned anything from this experience? I certainly hope so. At the end of the day, so much that happened in New Orleans should have happened. But it did, and we need to take these tough lessons and make substantive changes in our system. The question is: has anyone listened?

No doubt about it. David Levithan's new book, "Two Boys Kissing", is a revolutionary text that will be lauded  as a milestone in young adult and gay literature for decades to come. That's a pretty hefty statement, yet its not hyperbole by any means. The book commends such praise for its beautiful originality, its poignancy, its realness and rawness.Meet Harry and Craig, two boys who decide to break the world kissing record. Meet Avery and Ryan, two small town teens who meet at an ersatz prom and discover much about each other. Meet Cooper, who's version and vision of gay life is warped by family and the internet. Meet Tariq, who's bashing inspires the kissing. Meet Neil and Peter, two boys navigating their love. And meet the chorus of gay men who died from the AIDS epidemic, who omnisciently narrate the lives of the characters throughout the story, and well as their own, through the ingenious use of "we".It's through the characters and this "gay Greek chorus" that Levithan manages to make his story compelling. As the men watch the kissing, and the lives of the other characters, they reflect on their own existence. Levithan honors both the reality of today's experience of being gay in our society as well as the lives of the men and women who came before us. This powerful dichotomy creates emotional, stunning moments in the novel that will cause you to reach for a Kleenex.Levithan also manages to obliterate stereotypes through the novel. The stereotype shattering aspect of two boys kissing would be enough, but Levithan expands that throughout his story. If you think you know how the characters in the book should act, be prepared to be pleasantly and wonderfully surprised. Levithan has painted with words a more complex picture of people's reactions to two boys kissing, a vision almost of how life can be, and for some of us, how life is.When asked about what this book is about, one could simply say two boys kissing, because that is the act that drives this story. But its more. Its so much more. In it, I see where I came from, where I am today, and where I will be in the future. This book is narrated with "we", but in reality, it's the story of us.

So I primarily buy another brand of pomade that I've been using for many, many years. One reason I love the brand is because of the scent. However, I'm open to trying new things, so I opted to give Baxter's a go. I'm happy to report satisfaction for this product.This pomade that I chose is unscented. In the jar, it feels thick and gooey to the touch, but not overly so. It runs very nice through my wet hair with little effort, and it doesn't take too much to use. The end result is a good hold, with a slight touch of shine that remains that my other product doesn't have. The hold lasts easily all day, and doesn't harden or become "shell-like", which I don't like.I'd recommend this pomade if you're wanting to change or try another brand!

I must admit that I'm a Jill Lepore fan. It started with The Whites of Their Eyes: The Tea Party's Revolution and the Battle over American History (The Public Square), and then The Story of America: Essays on Origins, and most recently, The Mansion of Happiness: A History of Life and Death (Vintage). Maybe it's her writing style, maybe it's the deft in which she both manages to teach and gently entertain at the same time. Whatever the case, I have yet to pick up a book by Lepore and be disappointed, and that certainly was the case with her newest book, "Book of Ages: the Life and Opinions of Jane Franklin."Given how very little information there is out there about Jane Franklin, I worried about the trappings of such a book, filled with "could haves" and "maybes" that lead to such doubtful reading. No need to fear: Jane is handled with great care, and great wisdom in this book. Lepore manages to take the subject, and shine light on her in ways that are astounding and informative. By pairing her story with her much more famous brother, which scads of material is available, Lepore gives us a sense of this woman whom Ben wrote over the years.Not only that, Lepore explores the grossly unequitable lives women had back during our pre-Revoultionary times, making for a story that also raises hackles too. If only Jane were born a boy, she might have had all of the advantages, opportunities, and privileges that were given to males during that time. The fact that she could read and write at all was a revoultionary act. Even though her spelling was erratic (as it was during those days), her intelligence was fierce.In fact, it's through her letters, paired with the fragile, fabulous book she left "Book of Ages", that we get to know her and her world. Lepore mentions on a page by itself the importance of leaving Jane's spellings intact, and with two short sentences, I was able to overlook them and get to know the writer well. When Jane writes a letter that is somewhat confusing, Lepore steps in to explain, and also give context for that explanation. It is through this process that we can meet Jane, live with her through her joys and seemingly endless heartbreaks, her worries, gossip sessions, and requests of Benjamin.So now I have a new favorite in Jill Lepore's collection. I also have a new favorite voice in our country's early history. Lepore has given us Jane Mecom, and her beautiful voice adds much to our understanding of our country, her citizens, the town of Boston and life, in general.Highly recommended!!

This guy comes in at a little over 6 1/2" tall.  It's not too heavy, but given the porcelain and glass components, it is not a lightweight decoration...and it's one you'll have to directly supervise the little kids with.  The overall white motif is nice and simple, with just a little bit of color with the gold bow and hat ring, and some color on his face and hat, a good balance.My highly scientific measurement had the action of the snowflakes in the globe lasting all of about 22 seconds.  There was no air bubble in mine, so you can't get any really energetic shaking going on; all you can really do is turn it upside-down and let the snowflakes "fall" to do their thing.  There are some glitter bits in the mix, so you get some nice multi-color sparkle with the action.Price.  About $30 for this item seems about right.  As it's an enduring product, a keepsake and it'll last a number of years, this price seems fair.Bottom line: this is a nice and simple holiday decoration, from a highly respected maker.

This is a nice item.  The color is good, and once assembled it is relatively sturdy.Assembly.  It didn't take too long to get this product out of its box and assembled.  The instructions are easy enough to decipher, and there are ample pieces of hardware.  As other have noted: be careful tightening your cams, as you can easily overtighten and then you've essentially ruined that connection.I find it absolutely stunningly stupid that the manufacturer has not provided holes in the backing through which to pass your power cords.  This would not be difficult at all to do in the manufacturing process.  Hell, you could probably charge another $10 or $20 for the product, just based on that feature.  I ended up drilling my own holes, which must be done carefully as the back is particularly flimsy pseudo-board.Once assembled, it does stand rather tall.  If you have a low-slung bed this probably would not be a good solution.  This is a good headboard for a higher bed, and the ample shelving allows for lots of books, a phone, lamps, etc, with lots of wide open space up top for your choice of urbane décor.Bottom line: for the price, this is a nice item.  Be careful with the assembly, and once you get it up and in place you'll be happy with it.

It's a simple rugby ball decal.  Easy to put on.  It's a simple design, elegant and understated, for the discerning and subtle rugby player in all of us.  You can mount it in any direction that fits your ball-orientation fancy.Great little product at a great price.

You can you not love a pillow, with a cool black/red motif, that has a cheeky/irreverent/unexpected take on the totally overused "Keep calm..." trope?And it's got rugby in it!Get one for your car, for your den, for center placement among all of the irrelevant throw pillows the wife has filled your bedtop with.

A User is exactly right in his/her review--these things are poorly made.  Do not buy.Yeah, I read that review and, needing just this kind of product, in this size, figured that it those review observations might be an unfortunate anomaly in the Lipper line of fine products.  Nope.  I ordered two, and both had fallen apart in the box.  I have to wonder if they were falling apart as they were placed in the box; wouldn't it be obvious to the fulfillment center employee to notice that the item is defective, and not even pack it to begin with?Yeah, I could get out the super glue and put it all back together again, but that's not what I've paid for.  It's no my job to put back together two items that are brand-new.Bottom line: this is my first and will be my last interaction with Lipper International.  Shoddy, flimsy product.

Disclosure: I was contacted by the manufacturer and offered this product.  I accepted, promising a fair and honest review in return.My kids have been using a low-end FM transmitter in one of our paleolithic, non-digital-friendly vehicles, and I’m sick of it, because the sound is so absolutely terrible.  This device is a massive improvement over that old one, which already has been thrown away.  This product is not delivering perfect stereophonic sound, but then again, it doesn’t promise that.This product is easy to set up and get right into action right out of the box.  Its controls are intuitive: plug in the power, click on the channel you want on the device, match it on the car radio, and plug in your device, and you’ve got digital music in your non-aux car.  Not bad.And added feature is the USB outlet right at the car power adapter.  So, if you’ve got a USB charging cord handy, you can charge whatever you need while you’re using the power socket to run this transmitter.My experience with this transmitter was positive.  I had no problems getting it to sync and spit out passable connections and music at the top and bottom of the FM dial.Price. For about $15, this is a pretty good product.  Its use is intuitive, and it’s easy to get working quickly.  That, and it also chargers our device while playing.It actually has some pretty good documentation, with text and diagrams that really show how to use the product—nice!  A little confusing are the photos for “Device Appearance,” which shows four separate adapters/plugs for this device, when it only comes with two, the standard 3.5mm male plug and the Apple 8-pin plug.  Quite disappointing is the complete absence of any contact information whatsoever; no URL, phone number, email address or physical address.  One could interpret that as the manufacturer not wanting consumers to be in contact...Bottom line: If your car is aux-deficient, this is a good interim solution to get your digital content through your speakers.  It’s easy to put to use, and provides a stable connection, for a decent price.

Disclosure: I was contacted by the manufacturer and offered this product.  I accepted, promising a fair and honest review in return.This is an entry-level, low-cost head lamp.  It works relatively well, in that it provides a good amount of light in the dark, in a fixed—and adjustable—position on your head.The headlamp requires 3 AAA batteries, which are not included.  Installation is relatively easy, by squeezing two tension buttons on each side to remove the back.  A plus is that no tools are required to access the battery compartment.  I note there is no gasketing for the back, just a molded lip.  This product would likely do okay in the rain, but immersion would ruin it pretty quickly.  I have not tested the product for battery duration.The light works in three modes: full on, lower-power and a blinking full-on.  The zoom function is performed simply by pulling the lens in or out.  The zoom function is mediocre at best, and at full in provide an acceptably wide beam; at full out the beam is relatively narrow.  The convex lamp lens is relatively well protected by modest side shrouds.The tilt of the lamp adjusts on the headband through six positions.The headband is adjustable for head circumference, and also adjusts for the crown.  There is adequate plastic padding where the headband meets the lamp.Price.  For approximately $8 this is a pretty good entry-level headlamp.There is no documentation, nor are there any instructions on how to use the lamp, maintain it, install the batteries, etc.  If you aren’t familiar with this kind of device, you’ll need some help.Bottom line: This is a simple, low-cost headlamp, suitable for the car emergency kit, work around the house, or for infrequent campers.  For the more hard-core outdoor-types and those who need to rely more heavily on a more stringently constructed lamp, this is not quite the right one.

Note: I recently reviewed the Cailler bar almost exactly the same as this one, the one with cranberries instead of raisins.  This is basically the same review as that one, with the slightest of modifications to address the presence of raisins instead of cranberries.I received the standard Amazon.com shipment of two of these bars—thank you!  They were quite enjoyable.I’ve had my share of European chocolate, having lived in Europe for almost nine years total, and visited many more times (Belgium, most recently).  But this brand I’d not heard of (it’s a Nestle brand); that’s one of the reasons I wanted to try it.This bar is big, thick and heavy—they’re calling it a tablet—so you’re getting a lot of chocolate bar with your purchase.  Or you think you’re getting a lot…I note that there are a lot of deep longitudinal and lateral grooves in the product…so that packaged it looks big, but the bar’s actual volume is considerably less than what the box is showing you (see image).  It’s a big box, but the actual weight of the bar is less than seven ounces.You also get a lot of wrapping, the very sturdy box, and then the bright red paper wrapping, with the foil-wrapped bar inside.  Yeah, I was definitely channeling Charlie Bucket as I opened this product, and was a bit disappointed not to find a golden ticket waiting for me.When you finally get to the bar, it’s a bit different in appearance.  It is not all smooth chocolate exterior, with the goodies buried inside.  The pouring method intentionally makes the almonds, hazelnuts and raisins visible (see image).  This tends to make the bar appear a little less refined, less sophisticated, and may actually detract from the “fine European chocolate” image.  If you’re used to granola, trail mix or chunky cereal bars, being able to see the ingredients is a nice touch, and could even be considered to be somewhat thoughtful on the part of the manufacturer.The closest similar bar that most would be familiar with would be the Ritter Sport hazelnut or raisin bar.  This one is bigger, and puts it all together, the raisins, almonds, and hazelnuts.Yeah, yeah, so how does it taste?  For the chocolate, the traditional soft and very sweet traditional milk chocolate taste is moderated by the crunchies.  If you’re tuned in that deep, sweet and smooth traditional Swiss chocolate taste is in there.  The raisins are good size and chewy and the raisin taste is discernable.  The hazelnuts and almonds are nicely crunchy, and are both good size in the bar.  The taste of both comes out relatively clearly.There is a salty undertaste, but not quite the trendy salted caramel.  Just like with the other bar (with the cranberries) I detected the same smoky aftertaste, not like smoked meat, but to my mind closer to open fire in the outdoors, sort of a chocolatey-sweet campfire taste…strange, but pleasurable.  I think this is an aftertaste of the roasted nuts.  Not bad.There’s basically nothing good for you in this product.  Fat, saturated fat, sugar, gluten, nuts, egg products, etc.  One positive is that is has zero trans-fat.  Don’t worry about the label; just enjoy the product.Price: This is basically a $9 bar of chocolate.  Wow.  On physical size (more than $1/oz) and origin, that’s about right, I guess.  I expect there is some craft that goes into it and choice ingredients as well, so I guess that’s about right.  But on taste, it’s just not quite a $9 chocolate bar taste.  I’d go $7.  If I saw it in the store, I might buy it, but not for $9.  As a high-end candy gift, this would be a good choice, for something like a Christmas stocking.Bottom line: This is a nice n’ tasty, crunchy and fun Swiss chocolate bar.  It has an interesting taste and some really good texture, but is somewhat spendy.

I liked the packaging, arriving very secure, in layers of packaging that are classy and replicate a much more expensive watch.  The opening/unboxing for this item is a nice experience (for the female consumer).The only function of this watch is time.  There is no date indication, nothing else.I noticed immediately that the entire face is the same color as the entire case, the rose gold tone throughout.  The entire watch case is the same rose gold tone, as is the buckle.  As such, the face’s numerals do not stand out in any way.  You have to roll/rotate your wrist to get some light angling to see the numerals and tell the time.  The numerals do not illuminate/glow, and there is no way to read this watch in the dark (unless you’ve got a flashlight).For wear, the watch is light and unobtrusive.  The nice smooth leather lining on the inside of the band is smooth and makes wearing it very comfortable.During the brief period using this watch it has kept accurate time.  It is easy to adjust quickly.The documentation says this watch is water resistant to 30m.  I did not test this, although I cannot imagine using this watch in any kind of wet environment, given its band.As a guy big on documentation, there is a lot of it here, but unfortunately it’s a boilerplate document for all Invicta watches, so there is a ton of extraneous material which is not applicable whatsoever to your purchase of this specific watch.  Also, a lot of the documentation inside the package is for an extended warranty for the product.Bottom line: this is a simple ladies fashion watch, best for dress-up occasions.

Disclosure: I was contacted by the manufacturer and offered this product.  I accepted, promising a fair and honest review in return.Okay, I’ll admit it: I didn’t read the product description that clearly.  Specifically, I didn’t notice that this set comes WITHOUT a battery.  So, you’re supposed to already have the battery, or purchase one separately to use with this set.  It arrived, looks cool, seems to be very sturdily constructed, but I have no way to test it, as I don’t have a battery.  And, I’m not really inclined to go out and pay for a battery…I’d figure that if you’re offering one to a reviewer that you might want to include a battery…I also note that the item came with no documentation at all, no instructions, no user’s manual, nothing.  It was just the flashlight and the charger in a nice little package.  There was no information on what kind of battery you should purchase to use with this product.  If I were selling this product it would make a lot of sense to make that information available to my customers, but it’s not there.  Also, nowhere in the product’s online description is there any kind of information on the battery that should be used with it.  I’d think that manufacturer NockNock or vendor Raysourcing would be interested in offering the battery for sale, or at least want to offer information—or a link—to where a buyer might find the right battery.
