Even their regular sodas contain sucralose. The taste has just been off because of that, even for things like Root Beer and Cream Soda. Instead, we decided to use Monin soda syrups instead. Essentially, you could use anything with the Soda Stream, not just the SodaStream labeled syrups. (We've done essential oil infused fizzy water, as well.) But with this kit, you'll get a taste of their syrups so you can judge the quality for yourself.

I have tried some of the cheap cases before, and the silicone is holding up much better than the hard plastic ones. It took forever to ship to me, but for the price, I didn't mind. The picture on the case is a little fuzzy and not quite as clear as I expected. It also has silicone covers over the power plug and the headphone jack, which can be annoying to open and close. However, both can be accessed and used with the case on. I just wish they weren't there. The case is slim enough that my phone still fits into my wallet with the cover on.

I love this tea. I tried it in the Sampler Tin first and fell in love. I had to order more. The packaging and tea bags remind me of The Republic of Tea. This black tea has a nice floral smell and taste to it. It  really is lovely. The bags are paper disks. The can seals well, so I don't worry about loss of freshness. Though since the bags aren't individually wrapped, I would say this tea is for home use only.

I really like the way this saffron is packaged. It makes it easy to store in the pantry and easy to use. The saffron isn't crushed, but I also don't have this half empty container with a few threads sitting in it, either. The saffron smells strong and tastes good. I have no complaints about this product.

My 5 year old is obsessed with Lego Hero Factory. They aren't your typical Legos. More like Lego and Kinex had a baby and Hero Factory was born. The Hero Factory sets all work together, but they don't work with regular Legos. My son loves them. He builds the Hero straight out of the pack using the simple directions. Then he'll eventually dump all the pieces into his Lego Hero Factory box and make his own versions of Heros.
My 5 year old is a big fan of the Lego Hero Factory sets. He has had his eye on this set in particular for months. He has been thrilled with it.

Got this charger this week and I am pleasantly surprised. The T-connector is actually much more stable than my previous L-connectors have been. The box gets a little warm, but not as hot as my previous model did. It is a little short and has no grounding plug. But it works, my MacBook Pro is charged, and it didn't cost me an arm and leg to make that happen. Now if the toddler chooses to eat this one, as well, I won't be too stressed knowing I didn't pay Apple price for the thing.

These planning cards are pretty handy. They are grid marked, but the grid is pretty tiny. The acrylic try is slightly bigger than the cards, so they fit in easily without having to fight to get them in. They aren't very secure inside the tray. Just a stack of unattached to one another cards. (In an office, it isn't so much of a problem. But I keep mine on my kitchen desk, so it sometimes becomes an issue.) The cards are not attached to one another, it isn't a pad that you tear off. It is a stack of cards. I really like the copper edge on the cards. The cards themselves aren't very thick. They are a little thinner than card stock, but a little thicker than a standard piece of printer paper. The bonus in that is that they are easily folded and tucked into your wallet or pocket. The downside is that they aren't really card like.Overall, I find them very useful for jotting quick notes and reminders. I find them handy and convenient.

The bottle is cute, but really impractical. It was extremely difficult to get the saffron out of the tiny bottle because it was packed so tightly. I thought the flavor was fine, I just won't buy this particular container again. The cork in the bottle broke, as well, making the bottle that much more difficult to work with. This bottle is tiny. Like comical tiny. And it is packed full. The saffron doesn't just pour out easily. I won't be making this mistake again.

My kids love this box set. They love the circus characters and find it very fun. I was a little surprised with the size of the pieces. They are small. Choking hazard small. The warning isn't a joke- the people are tiny. I'm also not very impressed with the quality of the box. It is cardboard, and while slightly heavier duty than most toy boxes, it really doesn't hold up well. The box had to be taped back together the first day after my 5 year old stepped on it.It is a cute toy, I would just like to see the pieces slightly larger and the box more durable, since it is a part of the set.

The range of motion on this microphone kit is really impressive. There are 3 different joints: two in the arm and one near the microphone itself. Combined, this makes the whole thing very flexible and even the pop filter has a flexible goose neck that you can twist and turn with ease. The base uses a clamp to grip onto any surface. I currently have it clamped onto my bookshelf, but make sure that you tighten it couple times a month to be safe.There was actually no instructions that came with kit because everything was so simple. There are no tools required and all you have to do is look at a photo to know which part goes where. Everything looks high quality and very professional, which is why I like it so much. I personally think the kit itself without the microphone is worth the 31 dollars.After testing the microphone out for 2 hours, I find that this microphone has a tough time picking up sound unless you're 3-5 inches away from it. I wanted to use this microphone as a nice to way to look professional when I'm streaming games or even talk to my friend, but if you have to put the microphone that close to your face, then it's going to hindrance. After moving the microphone around and trying all different directions, I found a sweet spot for me. This is something you're going to need to experiment with and I think if you're in the market for a good microphone kit, then this will definitely do the job.*I received this product for free in exchange for a fair and honest review

This is a perfectly fine backpack to use as a laptop or school backpack. It looks very straight forward and won't turn any eyes, which I like. I steer away from backpacks that usually look too extravagant for me. I really like the foam padding on the back, it's actually really thick and soft. This backpack does make a decent amount of noise when you walk around because of all the zippers that' are on it.The reason for all the zippers is because of pouches in this backpack. The amount of storage and pouches in this backpack is insane. It's like the nesting dolls of backpacks. Each pouch has their own pouches within. I took as much photos as I can so you can take a look inside the backpack.* I received this product for free in exchange for a fair and honest review

If there is one thing that I have to commend Dice on, it would be re-creating the authenticity of Star Wars. The Star Wars theme was captured beautifully. Music, sound effects, and visual effects combine so well to give you that immersive feeling in this game. Even if you have an underlying hate of the game for whatever reason, one thing you cannot deny is how beautiful the game looks and sounds.I wish the same thing could be said for the actual gameplay. Moments where you’re running alongside your teammates, with lasers flying past your face and explosions going on all around you are extremely exciting. However, with that said, the gameplay still feels very awkward. Vehicle camera angles could be better and the controls are frustrating to handle. This really surprised me because Dice is the master of vehicles. The first few hours of game play were extremely fun, but sooner or later, it'll dull on you. The fact that you can play key characters in this game like Darth Vader and Luke Skywalker was really fun. Not only because you're playing these iconic characters, but because they're moves feel so cool and you can turn the game around if you play them correctly.The map design on Walker Assault modes are terrible, with the rebel side having the largest disadvantage because of their horrible spawn points. For horde mode, the AI felt like actual Storm troopers in the movie. By that, I mean they miss every single shot and sometimes run around aimlessly. In the end, it’s still a fun game mode for you to play with your friend in co-op. This game is definitely curated towards the casual player. There just aren’t enough diverse weapons, skills, or customization that would really improve your gameplay. This game was definitely catered towards casual Star Wars fans who wanted to enjoy a Star Wars game.Overall, the game isn’t perfect, and I don’t expect it to be for a very long time. The lack of story mode in this game was disappointing. Map re-balancing needs to be done as soon as possible and those vehicle controls definitely needs improvement. If they fix some of those issues, then this game would play and feel a lot better.

This truly is a fantastic USB cable. I am currently using this particular USB cable in my day to day life and I've been very satisfied with this product. The look of the USB cable is incredibly stylish. It has real walnut wood on each end of the cable and the cable is itself is made from a braided leather-like material. There is a version of this with a longer cable, so you sure to buy one instead if you need one. This USB cable is exactly 8 inches long end to end, the cord itself is 5.3 inches long, and it's also reversible on both ends. This means either side can be used to connect to a USB port, instead of having to flip it and try again.* I received this product for free in exchange for a fair and honest review

This truly is a fantastic USB cable. I am currently using this particular USB cable in my day to day life and I've been very satisfied with this product. The look of the USB cable is incredibly stylish. It has real walnut wood on each end of the cable and the cable is itself is made from a braided leather-like material. There is a version of this with a shorter cable that measures at 8 inches, so make sure to buy that one instead if you need one. This USB cable is the longer version and it measure around 48 inches. I love that it's also reversible on both ends. This means either side can be used to connect to a USB port, instead of having to flip it and try again.* I received this product for free in exchange for a fair and honest review

If you're someone who owns a lot of keys, then you might want to consider this key holder. I tested it out and it was able to hold 4 keys on each side without any problem. It doesn't really hold the keys in place, they will most likely move out of place in your pocket as you move around. It also comes with a few extra parts that I've provided in the photos. This is a great product, but only for someone who has a lot of keys. It holds on to keys well enough that you'll never hear any jingling in your pockets when you walk around. If you would only put a few keys in here, then the screws will protrude out the top unless you put the rubber parts in there.* I received this product for free in exchange for a fair and honest review

The thing that surprised me the most is the audio quality on this headset. I own a Gamescom 780, as well as a Sennheiser 598 and the audio is on this headset is comparable to those. I'm loving the bass on this headset, it was definitely not something I was expecting. You can actually feel the bass because of the vibration from the headset itself and it'll definitely improve your gaming experience. The blue LED lights on either side of the headphones are extremely bright. The options to turn off the bass, lights, and volume are all located on the left side of the vehicle.The cord itself is coiled and covered in a rubber sleeve for protection. I would've liked it better without the rubber sleeve because it makes the product feel cheap, but the extra protection is definitely nice. The top of the headset reminds of a Siberia V2. The top of the headset can extend to fit the shape of your head. Unlike most headsets that wrap around your head, it feels like this headset is pulling on the top of your head because of its band.Since this is a open-ear headphone, do note that you will pick up outside noise. For example, I am able to hear the fan from my computer when I use this headset. The upside is that with open-ear headsets, the sound stage is amazing. Surround sound is more immersive and you will easily be able to tell which direction enemy footsteps are coming from. The leather padding on the ears and underside of the headband feels extremely soft and smooth. Definitely a high quality padding that will make sure your ears stay comfortable throughout playing.As for the microphone, I can't honestly attest to it because I haven't been able to test it yet. Next time I play some games with my friends, I'll make sure you let you know how it sounds.★I received this product for free in exchange for a fair and honest review

Waist packs are really great if you like to travel a lot. Not only are they great for storing whatever you need, they're perfect for protecting you against pickpockets. There is no way anyone would be able to steal anything from you without you noticing. The belt on this waist pack is handy. You can unbuckle the pack with ease if you want to take it off and the belt itself is very stretchable and will accommodate a reasonable waist size. The waist belt has 2 different pockets; the top one is wider than the bottom one. The entire pack is made with an amazingly comfortable and soft material, you'll have no problem wearing this around the whole day.* I received this product at a discount in exchange for a fair and honest review

Trust all these reviews that say that this washcloth is incredibly soft, because it really is. It feels amazing on my skin and even though it's meant for babies, I use it for washing my face all the time. The material itself is all natural bamboo fiber and doesn't have any synthetic properties at all. This means that it has a natural tendency to prevent anything from growing on the washcloth and it doesn't build up bad order as quickly.This purchase gets you 6 individual washcloths that will last you for a long time. They're all machine-washable and comes in a very neat pouch with a smooth zipper. Can't recommend this product more, really in love with it.* I received this product for free in exchange for a fair and honest review.

This is such a great device to charge all of your devices at once. You might wonder what makes this device better than just a regular computer USB or a wall charger. Well, I have to say that it's definitely the charging speed and the ability to charge multiple devices at once. I really do notice a significant increase in the speed in which my iPhone, tablet, and Bluetooth headphones charge. I just plug this charger near my living room and my whole family uses it. There are times when all 5 USB ports would be filled at the same time and it would maintain the same charging speed. My phone used to take over 4 hours of charging in order to get a full charge, but this charger cut that time by an hour and a half. The LED on the side of the charger itself lights up green to let you know that your device has been fully charged and it stops the charge to stop it from overheating.* I received this product for free in exchange for a fair and honest review

Out of all the products I've reviewed, this keyboard is among one of my favorites. The keyboard itself is just so well designed and functions so well. Starting with the red buttons on the top, it has shortcuts to open up your Outlook, internet browser, and control your volume, which I think was great because I use them so much. The keyboard doesn't have any mechanical switches, but it still sounds really nice. As someone who can type 132 wpm, switching to this keyboard from my Razer Blackwidow didn't feel awkward at all. I was still able to type comfortably and clock 123 wpm on Typeracer on my first try.Something else that impressed me is the backlight on this keyboard. It has multiple colors that you can choose from and even a mode that cycles through all of them. They colors are bright and vibrant and even the back of the keyboard is lit too. I tried to to provide a video and some photos for example.* I received this product for free in exchange for a fair and honest review

This tablet won't match any of the standards Apple or Android tablets, but it's more than good enough to get by. Just keep in mind that you get what you paid for.The touchscreen on this monitor is actually very good. It's responsive and has certain multi-touch functionalities. The resolution itself feels lacking in many aspects: You have to tilt the screen at a certain angle in order to see it clearly. Otherwise, it will have this weird gray tint to it. in other words, it has bad viewing angles.The speakers are located on the back of the tablet and it's actually not that bad. The volume is high enough that you'll be able to hear it easily whether you hold it in your hand or lay it on a surface. App functionality is perfectly fine on this tablet. You can easily browse through apps like Facebook or even play games like Candy Crush without a glitch. Something I really like about this tablet is the screen protector that it comes with. It is already pre-installed on the tablet itself and saves you the trouble of buying one and putting one on yourself.The camera isn't great on this tablet. It's only a 2.0 MP camera that can't take photos of anything that is moving or else it comes out incredibly blurry. The coloring on the photos itself is pretty bad as well. Mostly black, white, and gray so it's very hard to get detailed photos. The battery life is surprisingly good; I fully charged this device and left it on standby overnight and it was at 75% the next day. It will definitely offer you a solid 3-5 hours of use, depending on what you're doing.In conclusion, this is a great tablet for the casual users. I see people using this tablet for reading Kindle books, watching YouTube videos, playing apps or going on Facebook. Someone who wants to use Excel or Word on this tablet will not be able to do it.

Very satisfied with this product in general. I lost my FM transmitter when I was switching my old one moving between cars and this was a great replacement. The channels were very easy to shift through using the knob on the front and connection was crystal clear. There wasn't really any static at all, especially if you find a good channel to transmit it on.There are many different colors that you can pick from, I got the pink one for the review and the colors looked very nice. The digital display is as basic as it gets, but is very bright and this transmitter shuts off with your car.Tip: You have to go online to search for which FM channel works best for you, mine was 96.5 and I live on Long Island; it will most likely be different for you* I received this product for free in exchange for a fair and honest review

This router is a pretty big step up from what I was previously using, which was the basic Verizon Fios router. I've been using this router for a while now and I think I finally have a good opinion of it.The router itself has a very old fashion look to it that I really like. It can be mounted using the brackets given to you or set on a flat surface. For the most part, this is a really good router for a casual user. What I mean by that is if you're someone who would heavily test the settings in the UI or set VPNs and Qos options, then this not going to be a good experience for you because of the glitches you might encounter. On the other hand, for people like me, this is a great router to use. My signal strength as well as connection has vastly improved over my previous model. There are times at night where my old Verizon router would drop connection and reset itself because there were too many devices for it to handle. This router has remained steady and call me crazy, but I definitely noticed a greater range of Wifi and speed increase.First thing I noticed when I tried to install this router is that it doesn't have a Coax Cable adapter--it has been extremely difficult for me to run a WAN cable all the way across the room and try to plug it into the router. I had to move around my piano and my cabinets until I was finally being able to connect them together.The instructions are a little outdated, but still steered you towards the right path on setting up the device. I didn't use them until the later parts of the installation when I had to put in my IP address. You are required to be a bit tech savvy if you want to set this up by yourself. If you do get stuck like I did, however, you can call up their customer support center which is based here in the U.S. and they should be able to help you out.The Qos option was what really caught my attention. Most of you can relate how awful the connection is when everyone in your house is using the WiFi. With the Qos offered by the router, you can actually limit how much bandwidth gets devoted to each device.

My dad's left knee always kills him at the end of the day after a long day of work. Running around back and forth in a restaurant really takes a toll on him, especially when it gets extremely busy. His knee loves acting up on him and I've tried to buy him knee sleeves, but he always has certain complaints against them. He really like using this knee sleeve because it's breathable, yet holds a nice tension on his knee to support him. It warms up his knee at the end of the day, he feels like it doesn't hurt as much.The thing that impressed me the most is how incredibly soft and stretchable the material is. Make sure you get the right size when you purchase this item, it's very important that you get the right tension.* I received this knee sleeve for free in exchange for a fair and honest review

Please take note that this is a transmitter, not a speaker. The little dots on the surface of the device might look like speaker holes, but don't be fooled. I was having trouble using this device at first, but I was able to figure it out after I emailed their support. They answered back really fast and sent back a detailed instruction. Just take the aux cord and connect this device to your TV/PC, or any other device that you have. Turn it on and let it pair onto your Bluetooth earphones/speakers. I'm using it right now to listen to music from my PC that's transmitting to my Bluetooth headset. This is meant for someone who doesn't have Bluetooth functionality of their devices and is a quick and easy way with no software installation.One gripe I do have with this device, and the reason I took one star off, was because of the static in the background. For example, if i was to watch a music video on Youtube, I would be able to hear the small static sound in the background when there is no music playing. As soon as I start playing the music video, the static goes away completely, but once it gets quiet the static returns. It's not a big deal, but it does get irritating.*I received this product at a discount in exchange for a fair and honest review.

This belt looks amazing straight out the box. It's extremely flexible and you can definitely feel the quality on this. I only wish that I got the medium size instead of the large. I'm a size 35-36 waist size, but the large size of this belt was 4 inches too long for me. Make sure that you go one size smaller when you buy this belt.The colors on this belt are really nice. The entire backside of the belt is smooth to the touch, while the front of the belt feels rougher due to all the stitching. The red, white, and blue color looks really nice next to each other and I really like how lightweight this belt feels. The buckle itself is made from a very light material and it doesn't feel like it's weighing me down.* I received this product at a discount in exchange for a fair and honest review

This is a really awesome doorbell kit. Remember that there are 2 different sets, the one I received comes with 1 plug-in receiver, 1 wireless remote door button, adhesive, and screws.You only need 1 receiver-- the receivers are very loud. I plugged it in downstairs in my living room and was able to hear it all the way upstairs with my bedroom door closed. Since it has a range of 1,000 ft, you can virtually plug this on any floor of your house and still get the signal. The sound of the chime is adjustable. You have a total of 4 different volume options that you can choose from. I love the variety of sounds that you can get. You have a total of 52 different sounds and 4 volume options so you can really just mix and match to your liking.The wireless remote is what you put outside by your door. To install the battery that comes with it, you just pop the bottom of the wireless remote and after that, put the battery in and the case back on, peel off the adhesive, and slap it on the back. Note that you can also just screw the remote into your door if you don't want to use the adhesive, but it's pretty strong and I don't think it's going to fall off. The remote will glow blue when you press down on it to show you that it's working.Overall, I really like the design of this door bell. It's sleek, stylish, and doesn't make a huge dent in your pocket. The installation was super easy, the chimes are loud, and I don't have a problem with it at all.* I received this product for free in exchange for a honest review* Pictures will be uploaded soon.

I really like the way this earphone sounds. Unlike most earphones I've used that are under $15, it doesn't have that high treble and sharp S sound. Instead, this earphone has a richer and warmer sound than your typical earphone. Considering the price is only $15, that's pretty impressive.They really went all out with the whole green theme. Even the spare earbuds that comes with this purchase have tints of green in them. The LED light itself is green when you first turn on this device. Connectivity have been great for the most part. I have crystal clear connection, even when I'm all the way across my bedroom.I haven't tested the battery life to its full extent--I wasn't about to sit there for 8 hours and test it, but I've used it for the past 2 hours, and it still hasn't died. It comes pre-charged straight out the box so that was really convenient. The inner ear hook helps the earphone stay in your ear and the earphone itself really stays in there. Overall, this is a great Bluetooth headset to buy for only $15.

This dental floss is similarly priced to all the other ones on Amazon. You get 200m of dental floss for only $10.59 and if you do the math, you can see that it's either at the same value as the other dental floss, or much better. One reason I like this dental floss over others is because of the Prime shipping option. The other dental floss on Amazon comes as a add-on and you have to purchase 25 dollars worth of stuff to get it shipped. This purchase comes with 4 individual packs of 50m dental floss and the dental floss itself gives off a really minty scent when I first opened the zip lock bag that contains it. The floss itself is extremely thin-- it will be able to get into all the nook and cranny between your teeth, but it is also wider than most dental floss I've used. That means that it'll cover a better surface area when you use this.I like the amount of mint on this. Not too strong, but not weak in flavor either. It gives you that sharp mint feeling when you breath in between your teeth and I really like that. I also like the small metal cutter located on the top of the dental floss. Just simply wrap the floss around it, pull, and it cuts the floss off. Overall, this is a nice and dependable product. The cap closes and opens easily enough and the dental floss itself is stored within the container so it won't become easily contaminated.I guess if I had to nit-pick on something, it would be that once in a blue moon, the floss itself would leave behind shavings. I assumed it was just the mint, but sometimes it is the floss itself breaking apart.* I received this product at a discount in exchange for a fair and honest review

The biggest thing that popped out at me when I was testing this product was the sound. I've tested a lot of Bluetooth headsets in the past and I've always hated how they sounded. They always had these high treble sounds and sharp S sounds. This earphone, however, sound AMAZING. The sounds are rich and warm-- it reminds me of the sounds I get from my Sennheiser 598. I'm sitting here listening to Adele's new song Hello, and it just sounds really great.The build quality is above average. The buttons themselves are made from plastic, but the band is made from a very flexible silicon. It will not tear, nor will it move around easily when you run because it does have some rigidness and weight to it. The ear-hooks themselves are especially rigid--it might be because my ears are weirdly shaped, but I have difficulty fitting it behind my ear. It might be different for you, but I wasn't able to fit it completely behind my ears.I love how easily accessible the volume changer, pause and play, and answer call buttons were. Connection was extremely easy well, just hold down on the play button and it'll turn on. Once it's turned on, it automatically searches for any devices and connects to them. Signal was great the entire time I was listening to music on this; no static and no break in connection as well. I should note that it also comes with it's own USB charger and changeable earbuds.Overall, this is a very good Bluetooth earphone, especially if you're someone who wants to hear good sound quality when you run. Hopefully, the ear-hooks fit well for you.*I received this product for free in exchange for a fair and honest review

This is an extremely nice watch for only 33 dollars: The watch itself is made from stainless steel and real brown calf leather which really gives it that classic look. It includes other accessories such as: A laced bag to hold your box, a pouch that contains your manual and warranty information, and a hair clip which I found weird since this is a MEN's watch.There is no doubt that this is a really high quality watch -- You notice that from the moment you hold it. I really like the simplicity of it; unlike most watches these days that have so many features that clutters the analog face, this watch only shows date and day, which I really like.The functionality and design of the watch is simplistic as well. You pull or push on the crown of the watch to turn the watch on or off. You can also use the same crown to adjust language settings from English to Spanish depending on your preferred language. The Japanese quartz gives it that final classy and simplistic look to the analog face of the watch.To wrap things up, it also comes with a warranty as well as being water-proof to a certain extent, but I wouldn't take a shower with it on.* I received this product for free in exchange for a fair and honest review

If you're an outdoorsy type of person that loves to go hiking and camping, then this is the absolute perfect external battery charger for you. The battery in this charger is quite big, holding a 8,000 mAh charge. Just to give you an idea of how big that is, an iPhone 6+ requires around 3,000 mAh, so it is enough to charge it twice over.This charger comes with a few interesting features. The solar power charging is very convenient when you're outdoors and have access to direct sunlight. A full charge using only solar power takes around 8 hours, but it is a convenient and cost-effective way to charge your devices. The thing I love the most about this charger is the flashlight that comes installed in it.  You simply press twice on the power button to turn on the bright white LED light. By pressing the power button again, you can switch between the settings on the flashlight to make it blink periodically or rapidly. That is such a great tool to have if you're outdoors; not only does it help you charge your devices, it can also double as a flashlight.The external battery itself is well protect with thick coat of silicon. It is heavy duty in quality, but still maintains a light weight. One thing I do notice is that the coating on the side picks up debris very easily. Just from taking it out the box, I notice tiny pieces of dust all over it. It's not a big deal to me and shouldn't be for you, if you plan to take these things outdoors.To wrap things up, this item also comes with it's own USB cable for charging via USB port if you want a faster charge, and it comes with a metal hook so you can attach the charger onto your backpack.* I received this product for free in exchange for a fair and honest review

I think most of us feel pretty hesitant to buy another Assassin’s Creed game after the last disaster that is "Unity". I still remember the first few weeks, yes weeks, of single digit frames, week late patches, and game-breaking glitches that came out with the game. Luckily, those problems aren’t as apparent in Syndicate. Don’t get me wrong...this game has a couple of bugs here and there, but definitely not as bad as Unity and it’s actually playable.I played this game for about 5 hours overnight and I just wanted to give you guys my thoughts on it so far.Pros:Twins- I'm loving the decision of dividing the main role into 2 people. Evie and Jacob are like polar opposites of each other and their sibling rivalry really keeps the story alive for me. I love that they both have their own skill trees; Evie takes a traditional assassin route, while Jacob is a brawler in the streets.Victorian Industrial Revolution- With a new era comes with new characters, history, architecture, and technological advances. Historical characters like Charles Dickens and Alex Graham Bell are just a couple of historical characters that will appear in this game. This game has a fun and wittier side to it than most AC games, and I really like that about it. I LOVE the rope launcher; it is literally my favorite item in the entire franchise. It makes traversing the entire map really fun again and gives climbing a fresh new feel.Cons:Same problems as always- Controlling your character’s movements have become easier with each passing AC game, but that doesn’t mean it’s perfect. You still get moments where you hop on to the wrong ledge, or the character just doesn’t do what you want. Combat was pretty cool at first because of the new takedowns and skills. But, it does get boring sooner or later because of the repetitiveness. At some point, you just realize that you're spamming the same buttons as you're automatically killing enemies one after another.That’s just my thoughts on the game so far, but there are a lot of things I didn’t touch on yet such as graphics and story. I just wanted to give you a brief overview and update it when I beat the game. So far though, I’d give it a 8/10. It’s not the best AC game I’ve played, but it's certainly not the worst.

This is a really awesome doorbell kit. Remember that there are 2 different sets, the one I purchased comes with 2 plug-in receivers, 1 wireless remote door button, screwdriver, adhesive, and screws.Honestly, you only need 1 receiver; the receivers are very loud. I plugged it in downstairs because you need to place it within 500 ft of the wireless remote, but I was able to hear it very clearly upstairs. The receivers themselves have 35 different chimes pre-installed in them. They have a large variety of sounds going from birds chirping to your regular doorbell sound.The wireless remote is what you put outside by your door. To install the battery that comes with it, you take the screwdriver and jam it in the underside of the remote, and then you just pry the back of the case open. After that, put in the battery, back the case back on, peel off the adhesive, and slap it on the back. Note that you can also just screw the remote into your door if you don't want to use the adhesive, but it's pretty strong and I don't think it's going to fall off. The remote will glow blue when you press down on it to show you that it's working.Overall, I really like the design of this door bell. It's sleek, stylish, and doesn't make a huge dent in your pocket. The installation was super easy, the chimes are loud, and I don't have a problem with it at all.* I received this product for free in exchange for a honest review

I played this game for more than 2 hours already and I know it's not much, but I just wanted to tell you guys my thoughts on it so far. The combat is very unique in its own way. Unlike most JRPGs, it's not actually turn based. Don't get me wrong, turn based games are fine. I love games like Final Fantasy Tactics, but eventually I just got tired of the slow combat. The combat style in this game is so fun and refreshing; it's fluid, interactive, and you can dash and sidestep behind creatures to evade their attacks. To be fair, there's quite a bit of hack and slash In the beginning of the game, but that's because of the lack of skills available to you. As you level up and acquire new combos with your skills and teammates, it gets insanely addicting.The story itself is actually very good so far. The main character you play is the "Chosen One" otherwise known as the "Shepard". He is among the small amount of people who can see Seraphims (spirit like people in tune with the elements. A seraph generally has magical powers related to one of the four elements: Fire, Water, Wind, and Earth.The Shepard can harness this energy to fight his enemies.Anyways, I really like the game so far and I will update this review as soon as I finish this game.

For only 23 dollars, this purchase gives you some really great utensils. Utensil set include: Spatula, soup ladle, mixing spoon, draining spoon, and pasta fork. I love the non-stick aspect of all of these utensils. The normal spatula I use always accumulates a lot of grease and undesirables after cooking, and this spatula has been so great to make sure nothing sticks to it. I really like the high temperature resistance of these utensils. That means that these spatulas will last much longer than your regular kitchenware, especially the ones that are made from plastic. I've had plastic spatulas in the past where they were noticeably melting around the edges over time. It actually worries me that the plastic would get in my food so I would end up throwing them out. I didn't want to get metal spatulas either because I didn't want it to scratch up my pots and pans. So, in the end, a silicon utensil was the best option.*I received this product for free in exchange for a honest review

Apart from Code Black, the only other medical show that I've really watched was House and Scrub, and that was a while ago. The show is incredibly fast paced. There are so many things going on at once and it feels like you're holding your breath almost all the time. This show definitely knows how to play with your emotions and introduces some down to earth and relatable characters. This pilot did an amazing job in mixing both character development and story development. I really felt like I got to know the characters from the get-go and what they're problems are going to be in the future. The pilot really held nothing back and I really can't wait to watch more!

Just finished episode 2 of season 3 and so far I really like the pacing of the show. All the characters have seen great development and you can start to see the wheels turn already. This season has already shown a lot of potential by all the events that has already happened. I really notice how much Skye has changed. Definitely much more confident in her abilities and grown up as opposed to last season. I really don't like the fact that they're still trying to shove HYDRA down our throats. I was really hoping that we would be moving on. This show has show much potential with the introduction of the Inhumans and certain alien technologies, but I guess HYDRA is coming along for the ride too.  Hopefully we'll also see some new characters, can't wait to see what next week brings!

When we last saw Barry Allen in season 1, he was desperately trying to stop a vortex from swallowing Central City. It was definitely a dramatic way to cap off the season and left the audience wanting for more. Season 2 didn't start off with a bang, but it paced along very well. It doesn't continue immediately from the ending of season 1, but rather 6 months after. You'd think that the disaster level event would have brought the team closer, but it actually left the team worse off. Barry taking the events that occurred especially hard, putting the blame on himself.I'm very excited to see how this show will continue to develop as the weeks go by. This show's potential is limitless as they continue to introduce iconic Flash characters from the comics. Atom Smasher looked great for the most part. The costume design, especially the helmet, looked amazing, but the awkward looking CGI did throw me off a bit. Anyways, can't wait to watch more of this season, I know it's going to be great!

I did need to readjust one right after I had placed them in my shoes and was thrilled to find that it was easy to peel off and re-position without losing the adhesive bond. I did receive these cushions at a discount but price doesn't change how comfortable my feet are through 8+ hours walking on them, nor does it effect my review.

I prefer to use a BB cream on my face in the morning, and I've never been able to blend it the way I'd like with just my fingers. Susentone's 4pc blending sponge set has been a great way to blend my makeup without having to lug around a giant sponge!There's nothing worse than a visible line of foundation, especially when I've spend an hour on my hair and makeup before noticing. Each of these four sponges works to spread and blend foundation evenly without leaving a noticeable space. The large rounded ends on all four sponges are great for cheeks and foreheads, while the tapered tips get into eye areas and around my nose without a struggle. These four sponges come in two shapes, either hourglass or teardrop, and help blend around any facial feature.Some blending sponges I've seen in the past have been huge - easily the size of my palm - and way too large to fit into my regular makeup bag. These four sponges are surprisingly small at only an inch or two high and maybe an inch across. Because of their small size I found it was easy to sneak one into my purse and another into my relatively small makeup case without having to sacrifice much space at all. I also found that, because there are two of each shape, I was able to give two away and make my sister's day as well!Susenstone's blending sponges are a great way to apply makeup like a pro and I'm very pleased with the results I've had! I'm very excited to use these sponges over and over again!

We've been dismantling watches for a jewelry project and have wanted to make sure every piece we made could be easily worn without weighing someone down. Smart Weigh's high precision digital scale has been a great tool to help us accurately determine exactly what we're working with!Watch parts are extremely small and we needed a compact scale to weigh them on that we'd still be able to see them on. This jeweler's scale is self-contained with a clear acrylic flip-top that keeps our pieces safely on the scale until we're ready to pick them up again. The display at the front of this scale is easy to read, and the four buttons are easy to press and use. The power switch on the left quickly turns the scale on, and the mode button next to it makes it easy to cycle through different units of measurement. The tare buttons works quickly to zero the scale, and the pieces button has made counting tiny cogs and springs so easy!Included with this scale were anything you could need for working with and weighing tiny pieces. This scale is battery-powered and two batteries were included with it, and there are spaces in the included hard-shell case for a backup set. Two 20g weights are tucked into the molded Styrofoam as well so it's easy to verify that the scale is working properly. Tucked just below the scale is a pair of long-handled tweezers for picking up extremely tiny objects, and an owner's manual was discretely placed into a velcro and mesh pocket inside the top of the case.Smart Weigh's digital high precision scale is so much more than I was expecting in a scale! I did receive this scale at a discount but price doesn't change how easy it is to use, nor does it effect my review.

I love unique serving items, and enjoy impressing guests with my finds. Classique's Moscow mule mug is a very cool mug that stands out on a table!Typically when people think of cups, they imagine either a glass or a ceramic mug. This mug is made from solid copper, which no one is ever expecting, and shines beautifully on my table! The metal construction transfers heat and when this mug is full of a cold drink a wonderful layer of condensation forms on the outside. The handle is a bit lighter than the rest of the mug and gleams brightly.A lot of typical ceramic mugs are small and don't hold much liquid at once. This copper mug is extremely large and holds a surprising amount of drink - far more than it looks like it should! Unfortunately, because of the metal design this cup does have restrictions (no hot liquids, no soaking) and must be washed promptly by hand, which has made it hard to use on a regular basis. We've ended up using ours more for serving utensil storage than for drinks, but even then it still looks great!Classique's Moscow mule mug is a beautiful large mug! I was provided with a free sample of this mug but price doesn't change how unique it is, nor does it effect my review.

With summer drawing to a close insects and spiders are looking for a new warm place to stay, and inside my home has always been an attractive option to them. Thanks to Hoont's powerful plug-in pest repellent I can make my house a much less desirable place for them to spend their winters!We live less than a mile from the Great Lakes and get a variety of bugs that aren't easily controlled with one method of pest control. Hoont's indoor pest repellent works using both electromagnetic and ultrasonic technology to drive away pests of all kinds! The electromagnetic waves penetrate through our walls at all times, driving out anything living within them or trying to get in. The ultrasonic tones can be set to either fixed or variable, so that if pests are becoming used to one tone it can be changed to drive them back again.Outlets are scarce in my home and we need to get the most out of everything we plug in. This pest repellent is not only an effective way to control insects, but also an unobtrusive night light that helps to guide our way! We placed our unit in our kitchen against an exterior-facing wall to help keep outdoor pests back and it's become an easy way for us to find our sink without turning on switches and waking people or dogs up.Hoont's plug-in pest repellent has been a wonderful way to keep my home bug-free! I did receive this product at a discount but price doesn't change how easy it is to use, nor does it effect my review.

My hair is straight, thin and flies out of every ponytail I've ever put it into. Tough Headband's 12-in-1 headband has kept every stray strand out of my face all day long!I have to wear a hat all night long at work and don't want to wear something during the day that constricts my head in the same way. This soft headband is very stretchy and holds my hair without putting pressure into my scalp! Even with the light amount of pressure this headband uses it stays in place well and I haven't had to keep pulling it up like I do with some conventional headbands.I don't like wearing plain things, and the bright print on this headband is anything but plain! The bright colors are gorgeous and consistent throughout the headband. I opted for the rainbow zebra print design and the colors shift and change throughout the length of this headband, making it a funky way to get a touch of every color into my wardrobe!I'm a huge fan of Tough Headband's 12-in-1 headband and I absolutely love wearing mine! I did receive this headband at a discount but price doesn't change how comfortable it is, nor does it effect my review.

Rubber ducks are an important part of bath time, and you can never have too many of them. Now that we've got Kangaroo's pack of rubber ducks we can have cherry, happy faces floating all over the surface of every bath!Rubber ducks are iconic, with their round eyes and bright orange bills. The features on each of these ducks are clearly printed and don't fade or rub off. The yellow rubber body is vibrant and the perfect sunny shade, making each duck really pop against the surface of the water. These ducks each have a hole on the bottom so that any trapped water has a chance to dry, while still being small enough that these ducks stay buoyant.With eighteen of these ducks, the possibilities are endless! The small size is perfect for tiny hands and these ducks would be perfect for number or color games. Kids and adults of any age identify with rubber ducks and they're great for carnival-style party games! Their durable plastic bodies can take a decent amount of abuse and these ducks can be played with over and over.Kangaroo's multi-pack of rubber ducks has been so much fun! I was provided with a sample of these ducks but price doesn't change how colorful they are, nor does it effect my review.

0:35 Mins My friends have all started having kids, and I love finding new toys to keep their little ones entertained when I see them. Techege's bump'n'go helicopter is a loud and bright way to capture their attention!Toddlers are notorious for having no attention spans, so it's a challenge sometimes to find them something that will keep them entertained for longer than a few minutes. With its bright lights and loud music this toy really holds their attention and keeps them playing for quite a while! The blades and cockpit of this toy light up, and music continuously plays from the moment the switch is turned on.Everybody loves a toy that moves, and Techege's helicopter doesn't disappoint! The top blades whirl and spin, and each blade has a hinge in the middle so they will safely collapse if something gets in their way. The bottom wheels spin and turn this helicopter in any direction and keep it moving even after bumping into walls or furniture.Techege's bump'n'go helicopter toy is a great gift for my friends' kids! I was provided with a sample of this toy for review purposes but price doesn't change how bright it lights up, nor does it effect my review.

I'm a huge comic book nerd and love the various styles of 2D art that can be found. This Sketch messenger bag looks like it just popped out of my favorite graphic novel!By using forced perspective this bag really looks like a drawing, even up close. The top flap is asymmetrical and actually hangs lower on the left side, making that side of the bag appear as if it were closer. The "side" panel is actually on the front of the bag. and the strap is actually attached to the front and back of the bag instead of at the actual sides. The white and gray colors are vibrant and the black edging is even and bold throughout the bag.For looking like it takes up no space at all this bag actually holds a surprising amount of stuff! The front panel has an outer zippered pocket that's perfect for things I need to grab quickly. Inside the bag is a large, deep main pocket big enough to hold notebooks, folders or binders. The bottom of this bag unzips so the inner pocket can expand to hold wider items.This Sketch messenger bag has turned a lot of heads since I started using it! I did receive this product at a discount but price doesn't change how great this bag looks, nor does it effect my review.

I have a unique phone that doesn't conform to many traditional selfie sticks. I'm so happy to find that URPOWER's selfie stick held my phone safely and securely!I purchased a smart phone without plastic borders, so a lot of so-called "universal" devices have a hard time getting a grip on it. URPOWER's stick is easy to adjust by just pulling the top of the mount up, and the spring action brings it back down around the edge of my phone firmly. The rubberized finish stops my phone from sliding out of either end, and tilts to whatever angle I need without any struggle.I've used sticks with cables to connect the stick to my phone, and I've always found that keeping my phone plugged ingets awkward. This selfie stick works via bluetooth so I can just attach my phone and go! The shutter button has a quick response and I was able to easily find an app that it worked with for Android.URPOWER's selfie stick is the best I've tried yet! I was provided with a sample of this stick but price doesn't change how well it holds my phone, nor does it effect my review.

I dye my hair all the time and love to use multiple colors at once. To get the effects I want I need to be able to pin my hair out of the way, and these plastic prong clips have been a strong and colorful way to do so!Black clips can get lost in my hair, especially when I'm dyeing it a dark color. These plastic clips come in bright, neon colors that I can see at all times! Since they cover a wide range of colors it's easy for me to find a clip that I'll be able to see while I'm working on my hair, and each color is vibrant enough that I'm happy wearing them out of the house as well!Hair dye can be slick and I love when I find clips that I can easily hang on to. These prong clips each open by pinching the larger end and require very little pressure to open. Inside of the clip, as well as on the bottom of the opening end, are small teeth to keep the clip from sliding around on my head. The spring holds a flat section of hair well and keeps it in place when I move my head or need to work with hair right next to the clip.These 10 prong clips have been wonderful additions to my hair dyeing tool collection! I did receive these clips at a discount but price doesn't change how well they hold my hair, nor does it effect my review.

We cook from scratch most nights and often have leftovers that make it into the fridge. Since we've started using this micro air ionizer from BestFire our refrigerator doesn't smell like a week's worth of dinners!Some foods, like eggs, can easily absorb odors from the air around them. With it's powerful deodorizer motor this tiny air purifier pulls every odor out of the air and keeps it circulating through the fridge. The motor does let out an ambient noise but it's not noticeable over the noise of the refrigerator motor itself, and isn't loud enough to be noticed when the door is closed. The mode can be adjusted from low to high power to address the level of odor that needs to be taken care of.Our fridge is tiny and doesn't have a lot of room. This ionic deodorizer is just a few inches tall and fit easily onto a shelf without me having to adjust it! The base is small, only a few inches wide, and thin enough to fit into the door of my fridge as well. The white and gray color makes this deodorizer very discrete and the lights are dim so they're not obtrusive.BestFire's ionic deodorizer has made my fridge smell like nothing at all - which is exactly what I've been going for! I was provided with a free sample of this deodorizer but price doesn't change how tiny it is, nor does it effect my review.

Maybe I didn't read the descriptions well, but I was thinking this was sized like a standard desk lamp.  It's not tiny but it is small.  Fortunately for me it actually works better for my needs than a bigger lamp anyhow.  I have some DJ equipment I keep in a big steel cabinet and this sticks to the cabinet great and gives me enough light to see my controls without giving out blinding light.

In my subdivision we have gas pole lamps in front of every home.  It looks nice, and adds an extra layer of safety to the subdivision.  However the site planners made a big mistake they planted the pole lamps just inches away from the drive way.  It's fine most of the time because we don't park in front of it, but just about every time we have a dinner party or several guest come over invariable someone parks next to it and when they open their door BAM the mantle breaks and we're left with no light.  Because of that I've gone through a lot of mantles.  For the price/performance aspect these are the best I could fine.  The hard kind I find are more fragile and prone to breaking up with even less force against the pole.  At least these are fabric and can withstand a little bump here and there.  However with time the material gets more brittle and will break and fall off when someone bumps there door against the pole.Regarding the mantle itself.  It comes pressed and squished up, which is fine because it's just fabric.  You have to grab the ring and pull on the fabric an kind of shape it.  I've learned from experience that before you light it and while it's soft you have to try to shape it somewhat like a nice rounded shape.  Once it's been lit, it'll keep that shape.  Following the instructions you need to turn off the gas insert the mantle and then light it on fire - then wait till it's burned through.  It'll turn black and smoke a lot then it will turn ashy colored, and the flame will go out.  After that you can turn on the gas, and relight it.

The Sony Xperia Z is a big phone - it's not much different than a phablet.  I might just get a phablet next time around and get a bigger screen with the big phone, if they come out with one that is water resistant/waterproof that is.Anyway, I wanted a slim bumper case that only help protect from bumps on the corners because that's basically where most of the wear and tear show up.  I didn't want any extra bulk around the back of the phone.  There are some super slim cases that cover the sides and back but they look like they barely cover the front edges.  This was pretty much the best option if I didn't want a metal bumper and potentially loose signal strength.  It's pretty much what I was looking for except the quality is not so great.  For the price it's about what you could expect.  I actually wouldn't mind paying more to get one with better quality.  Also the bumper is a little fatter than I would like.  It extends out on the front and back a good bit.  Good for protection, but it makes the phone feel even bulkier.  I bought a similar bumper case for my wife's iphone but it was a brand name one that cost about three times as much but it's slimmer and much better quality than this product.I ran into a couple problems though.  The case interferes with some headphone jacks.  I had to take a dremmel to it to make room.  Same goes for micro usb adapters.  I had to take a dremmel to that opening as well to make room.  Another issue is that since the battery dies really quickly on this phone I use a extended battery that was designed to snap on to the phone, so that means I have to take the case off to put the battery on.  I kind of solved that by buying a slim external battery that I just hold onto which actually has better battery capacity.  However the whole package, phone & case, & external battery pack is just too bulky.  So now I don't use a case at all and use the snap on extended battery.I'm still giving the product 4 stars because it was pretty much the kind of case I was looking for and if I didn't need to attach an extended battery (every day) then I would've kept using it.

I have a D-Link Dir-655 at my business, it's an older router but a workhorse that's served me well for years.  I started using some previously unused rooms that are farther away from the router and the signal would not reach back there.  I researched my options and considered upgrading the router & wifi adapters to the newer standards or getting an extender or running cables.  I tried this Securify Almond router and it was really easy to set up and I was able to get a signal in the back rooms, but the speeds were not very fast.  I ran a bunch of speed tests trying all different kinds of ways to set it up and changing the position.  Still it would work but not as fast I would like.Since my router was getting long in the tooth I decided to try to upgrade it to the latest and greatest and see if that would be any better.  I wanted to try that option vs running ethernet lines because who knows where I would want to set up computers in the future and I'd rather not have to keep running new lines.  I purchased the Netgear Nighthawk AC1900 R7000.  It was pretty easy to setup.  It was a lot of busy work because I have ip cameras with port forwarding and other stuff, but it was still relatively painless and easy enough that I didn't need any tech support.  But I was surprised to see that it actually reached the back rooms just about as well as using an extender with my old router and the Securify Almond in b/g/n.  However in 5g AC it's blazing fast - just as fast a wired ethernet connection.  Granted your devices need to be compatible or upgraded with AC wifi adapter.I'm sending the Securify Almond back and going with the newer tech.  Yeah it's going to cost more, but I rather be spending more to upgrade to newer standards and hopefully have a longer future than going with already outdated tech.  I'm still giving this product 3 stars because it really is very easy to set up and if you don't want to upgrade your router and wifi adapters it's a good option, I'm not giving it more because it's pretty pricey for what it does though.

I had no idea what the heck this connector was when a bulb went out at work and tried replacing it.  Like they say google is your friend, until you really don't know what to ask for.  I just looked under light bulb here until I found something that looked right and I found it.  Then I see they have adapters so I can just use regular bulbs instead of these weirdo gu24's.  So I looked around and these have better reviews than the others, so I bought it to try.  The construction is ok, and they actually work fine over the few days I tried it. However the light fixtures I'm using it for is too small for a standard bulb and the adapter together as it sticks out too far, so it really defeats the point of getting this to use a standard bulb.  I ended up just buying a new light fixture that uses standard screw on bulbs and put in an led light bulb.

Updated review below...Original review 04/19/2014:This could've been a great product but it's not.  First of all it's a battery case, as in... it's also a case, as in... it should protect the phone or at the very least cover enough of it that it give you a sense (maybe even just a false sense) of security.  It fails at that.  The case does not cover up to the front of the device, well actually it kind of does on one side and not at all on the other... huh?  On the side with the charger connector the protective edges go up to the top edge of the phone to just barely (but not really) offer some protection to the corners or edges, but for some reason it only goes up half way on the other side, so basically the other side has no edge protection and no corner protection.  OK, whatever, that's weird.  So the case is kind of lopsided/tilted from one side to the other.  I can't tell if the whole thing is lopsided or just the battery part, but it fits weird and not flat and not flush.  I figured that out after mashing my phone into it for DAYS trying to figure out why won't it sit flush.  It's always uneven, and I'm kind of OC, and one of my compulsive habits is that I CAN"T STAND it when a lid is not on a cup or container perfectly flush - like soda cups at fast food restaurants or tupperware and tupperware like containers.Ok, next.  Well, as for an extended battery, it's kind of short there as well.  I've used it just about every day since I bought it, so I have a lot of cycles done so I have a pretty good assessment.  It will recharge my phone fully from about ~35ish%.  Below that and it doesn't reach 100%.By itself it's pretty light, on the phone all of a sudden the combination becomes really bulky and heavy, so I guess I wouldn't have used it as a case anyway.  Because of that I put it on and off all the time.  As another reviewer mentioned the little connectors are tiny and fragile.  Mine haven't broken off, but they are tiny.  Actually skinny, like little needles, and they are wobbly.  They are held in by springs I guess so they give, which makes them wobbly.  I can totally see them breaking off if you're not careful.  There is also a wonky edge that juts out where the connector pins are, I guess it's the housing for the spring mechanism.  It's pointy and just adds another odd visual feature to an already lopsided design that totally contrasts the Omnibalance design philosophy of the Sony Xperia.The kick stand is a joke, not even worth mentioning and don't know why they include it.  The concept of having a kick stand is nice, just a bad execution.  Flimsy, doesn't hold the heavy phone and battery up, and doesn't stay in position.I thought about the higher capacity version of this battery case to deal with the issue of not fully charging below 35%, but the other issues I have would still be there.The one positive about this is the price, and that's the only reason I'm not going below 3 stars.  It kind of gets the job done, and at an inexpensive price.I bought a bumper case for my phone so it's too much of a hassle to remove that and put this on, so I just bought a slim anker case which is actually more compact and has nearly double battery capacity.Update 09/01/14:So it's a little awkward to carry two loose devices in my pocket so I went back to using this battery case and gave away my slim anker case.  It worked fine for a while (just I had to remember that it doesn't charge all the way if the battery level gets low).  Well, now after I've used it several months (recharging it daily) it now doesn't charge very well at all, maybe only gives it a boost of about 20%. I'm in a pickle because I don't know if I want to order another or buy another slim anker case, or just get a newer xperia with the larger battery capacity already inside.  I have to do something because the battery in the phone just doesn't last me a full day.

I'm an android guy and my wife is an iphone girl.  She recently upgraded to the iphone 5s, with her old iphone 4s she used to have one of those case back external batteries where you had to use their specific phone case.  This time around she wanted to be able to use any pretty case she wanted so I had to find another external batter for her to use.  I bought one of those lipstick batteries, but it's still an odd shape and it's awkward to hold both together if you want to talk and keep charging it (which the case back chargers are awesome for).  I saw this battery when it had zero reviews, and just saved it in my wish list to keep an eye on it.  In just a few weeks time it started getting great reviews, so I was like "SOLD!", and bought one.Just got it yesterday and I'm sending it back without even charging it or trying to charge my wife's phone.  In fact I'm too embarrassed to show it to her and not even going to mention it to her.  I usually don't bother her with techie stuff and just figure out what she needs and just order stuff and give it to her, and she's happy as long as it work and is easy enough to use and convenient.BUT, the construction on this thing is awful.  It looks like something they put together in one of those urban city hacker/maker spaces, or like what they build in my nephews middle school robotics club.  The back of the metal case looks nice, but the front has wonky machine grooves on the insides of the curves that cuts out into the bevel edge and it really shows very well because the crappy plastic cover doesn't fit right all the way around and doesn't sit flush.  On the side with the button, it sits so high off the case and the gap is so big you can actually see inside.  I went back to look at the pictures and you know what, the gap shows in the pictures.  Look carefully you can see a sliver of a black gap towards the end where the checker board plastic cover meets the bevel edge.  I totally didn't notice in the smoothed over photo shop, but it shows clear as day in actual life.Also, maybe I'm not very observant but I had just assumed it was metal all the way around, I didn't notice from the pictures or descriptions the top part was plastic until I got it.  I went back and noticed it does say the top is plastic in the diagram in one of the pictures.  However, I just want to clarify that it's more like cheap acrylic that they use on dollar store toys that was just trimmed to fit by hand, and not a custom molded plastic cover.OK, well even with all that I was almost going to give it a try, because it really is about the size of an iphone 5/5s.  It seems it would be convenient to stack them with a short chord and charge while using it, but 2 things.  First the output is not in the center it's off center, so I can't use the overpriced mini usb to lightning chord because it's so short it can only be bent back to go directly from the output in one device right above it to the input of the other, which would have been perfect it the output was in the center so it would plug right into the iphone which has it's input right in the center.  The only way to use it, is with a long chord, which is really awkward.But, even that might be overcome by a slightly longer mini chord, I saw some that were 5" however...All those items I described really only makes the product lose 2 or three stars.  The main reason I'm giving this 1 star or zero if I could, is because it's pretty obvious the manufacturer is loading this item with fake positive reviews.  If you look you'll see that the majority of the people giving positive reviews have only reviewed or mostly only reviewed items in this manufacturers product line up and not much else, and they sound very similar, and are all done in about the same time period, and have goofy grammar.  It does looks like there is a review from someone that got a free product to test, take what you will from that review.  I'm giving this 1 star to balance the questionable reviews and to give everyone a heads up that the actual build quality is nothing like the pictures provided.

Update 10/28/14:I see that Kenu has a model now for larger phones (phablets): http://www.amazon.com/Kenu-Airframe-Car-Mount-Phablets/dp/B00LU5LWQK/ref=pd_sim_cps_3?ie=UTF8&refRID=12KH68PGYH3BMQVVFSFCI think the larger model would address a lot (not all) of the issues I had with this particular model, so I am going to up my review by one star in appreciation of Kenu listening to their customers and making changes to suit larger phones.  Ironically, I've decided to downsize my phone to a Sony Xperia Z3 Compact so I'll be keeping the original model and using it with the new phone.  I've actually supported a new mount on Kickstarter and looking forward to giving it a try when it's estimated to ship in late November, but it's kickstarter so I'm not holding my breath - and which is why I'm not mentioning the name of the device as I don't want to recommended a product that turned out to be vaporware.Update 07/05/14:Apparently this review has gotten a lot of views and some comments, so I thought I would update it.My wife got frustrated with another car mount that I had with clips that are more difficult to install and remove (because she thinks it's a big eyesore and she didn't want to look at it) so she ripped it out and broke it - without remorse.  So, I went back to trying to make this clip work.  It doesn't play well with my Sony Xperia Z with a case, so I just roll without a case now.  It does makes it easier to clip in and out without using the case, and I've gotten better at it with practice.  I can clip my phone in one handed now that I've gotten used to the action of the springs, you need to push up against the right side of the clip to open it up. Removing is tricky but still doable, and sometimes it does slide around on vents - though I can do it now without it completely falling off the vents.Someone, commented that they had no problem using this case with an LG G2 phone.  My father has that phone so I'm familiar with it.  What makes my phone any many other big android phones different is that the LG G2 has all the buttons on the back, so that means you can clip it right in the middle and you can man handle the phone without worrying about pressing any buttons - as apposed to my phone which has the volume rocker and power button taking up most of the middle of the phone, leaving only a little area in the top or bottom.  I've got to feel for where the buttons are on my phone and clip it in so that it doesn't keep pressing down on the volume, and I've done this enough times now that I've gotten used to it.  However, even though I've gotten better at clipping in my phone it's still wobbles when I drive since I can only clip in from the bottom or top.  I like to keep my phone in landscape, for gps etc, so my phone falls over completely upside down, so I've found a work around for that as well.  I've figured out a vent placement that let's me put the phone in a lopsided landscape mode where one side of the phone rests against a radio nob - it doesn't leave any room for adjustment, and the screen is very crooked but at least it's not flopping around any more.Since I have found a way to make this work, I'm bumping up my original 1 star review to a 3 star. I've had to make comprises to make this car mount work and it's not perfect, but it's ok.Original Review:At first I thought this was an awesome minimalist design.  I even showed it off to friends and recommended it.  However after using it for some time I have changed my opinion and decided it's terrible in practical use.Clip.  The way it attaches to your vehicle is with slide on clips - they are metal clips with rubber boots on them - and you slide it onto your ac vents.  The rubber pieces detached from mine after removing it from the vents only after a few times.  I reattached them with epoxy.  However even still it doesn't hold still.  It's constantly wiggling loose.  You can bend the clips a little bit to get them tighter, but that doesn't help, it still wiggles loose.Clamp.  It clamps onto your phone by a spring loaded side clamps.  The force of the spring is very strong.  It makes sense because it has to really hold onto your phone, but it's really strong.  If you have an iphone your phone is much narrower so it's a little easier, if you have an android phone and one with a bigger screen (like mine at 5") the phone is bigger so you have to really fight with the clamps to open wide enough.  It's is a two handed affair to clip your phone in and out, and it's not fast and easy at that.  It's a struggle each time to pull and grab and at the same time the weak vent clip doesn't hold tight so the whole thing wiggles around and half the time just pops off the ac vent.Clamp length.  This was obviously designed to fit thin square edged phones (ie iphone) and not much else, because it only extends out a short length, plus it has pointy rubber hooks that are supposed to hold the phone edges, but they are too short for larger devices so it ends up only holding your phone in with pointy rubber hooks and not whole side.  If you have a case, it probably won't fit or hold tight.  If you have a phone with a rounded back, it probably won't hold.  If you have a phone with an extended battery pack, it probably won't fit.  I had a phone with an extended battery pack with a rounded back and it would go in, but one bump in the road or a turn and it would pop off and the phone would go flying into the foot well, where I have to hope it doesn't slide under my brake or gas pedal or I don't wreck trying to grab for it. I upgraded to a new phone and it's too big with a case, well it fits just barely with a very minimal case but it's a struggle and it doesn't hold very well.Narrow design.  Because it only holds with two narrow clamps it may be a challenge to find a place to clamp onto your phone securely.  Most android phones have power and volume rockers on the side (and around the middle or at least mine do), so you basically have to clamp onto a bottom or top edge, which makes the phone top or bottom heavy - which relating to the issue of the wobbly vent clamp - it causes the phone to tilt and move around quite a lot while driving.  I have to constantly readjust the angle of the phone and I drive a prius v for goodness sakes so it's not like I'm hot rodding it.So basically I would only consider this if you have an iphone without a case or a very minimalist case.  I'm way past my time to return, so I'm going to stick it in a drawer and move on to the another car mount.

Update 10/30/14:There are a lot of dead spots in the wireless reception so the sound goes in and out as you walk around the room. I noticed at first but didn't think it was that bad, but everyone that uses it complain to me every time.  With the one mic not working and reception dropping out I'm forced to move on to another wireless mic setup.Update 05/21/14:I'm taking away one star.  The one mic is continually going in and out, and mostly out when I need it for a gig.  I have too many gigs coming up to send this in for repair and as long as the other 3 mics are working I'll just keep using it. I'm glad I purchased the squaretrade warranty now.Update 04/29/14:It's been almost two months since I've had this system and I ran into an issue.  All of a sudden one of the channels stopped working.  I spent an afternoon trying to troubleshoot it - changing channels, changing batteries, unplugging all cables, etc. - and nothing seemed to work.  The display and led on the mic seemed to show the mic was fine, but there are two small red led's on the receiver for each channel, one shows that it's connected and the other lights up when a sound comes through.  The first light showing it should be connected would never come on.  The other three channels works fine.  I gave up and decided it was nothing I could troubleshoot, so I contacted the seller the next day.  They responded in just a few hours with instructions to return the device (and they included a paid shipping label) so they could test the unit.  Today (the following day) I went to pack the system, but decided to test it just in case and it's working fine, like nothing was wrong.  I don't know, since it's wireless system I'm only guessing there was some interference.  One thing I noticed is that each channel/mic are set to work on a particular frequency band.  You can adjust/change the frequency within that band for each mic/channel but they are separated so that neither can overlap.  That also means you can't test one mic with another other mic to make sure it's a problem with the receiver or the mic.  Anyhow, it's working fine now.  All I can do is just keep an eye on it to see if/when it happens again and if it does if I can try to figure out if it is interference and where it may be coming from.  For now I'm still satisfied with the system and the sellers customer service.Original Review:I've used Shure, GTD Audio and now this Awisco wireless mic systems.
