Shure are probably the most well regarded and expensive systems.  Shure does have entry level systems which cost twice or more than GTD Audio & Awisco but their entry level stuff isn't really better than the no name brand, especially build quality wise.  The GTD Audio wireless systems seem to have the most reviews on Amazon so I gave them a try.  They were ok, nothing stellar.  The mic's look really cheap with the plastic cladding.  I experienced a lot of feedback with them and then after about a year an a half the receiver stopped picking up one mic.  The system was cheap so not a huge deal.  After researching a little more I decided to try these Awisco with basically a leap of faith because there are hardly any reviews here.First of all the price is very inexpensive - I know it's all relative to what you're used to, but for me $399 for a four mic wireless system seems pretty inexpensive as long as they work the way their supposed to.  Even the least expensive Shure's would be double or more like triple that price for 4 mics.  They looked better than the GTD Audio in the pictures too.  When I opened the box I noticed it was packaged really really well.  Custom foam cutouts.  Everything bagged and taped very carefully and almost perfectly.  Then I looked at the mics and the receiver and the build quality is way better than GTD Audio and probably even better than the low end Shure stuff.  It came with four - 1/4" cables for each channel, and you can connect them to control the volume individually or it also has connections for a mixed line with all the channels combined into one line.  Make sure you connect the cable to the right slot to get separated channels or mixed.  I would have preferred xlr speaker connections but in practice they work just fine.  There is a single all mixed xlr connector, but I like to control the volumes and effects individually so I don't really have a use for that.The mic's are pretty nice as well.  They feel more solid than the low end Shures and way better than GTD Audio.  It has an on and off switch - it's not a push button, but an actual switch that slides up and down with definite clicks to let you know if you turned it on or off.  Also the display is nice.  It has an LCD that shows you the frequency and battery indicators.  There is also a led light, which when you turn on the mic it glows red to let you know it's searching for a signal and then turns off when it's locked in with the receiver, which takes only a second if that - and it's nice to know for certain you are connected to the receiver before you start talking.  There are volume controls on the receiver for each mic/channel.  The manufacturer also preset each mic to a channel frequency to match the receiver, plus labeled each antenna (with color coded labels with text) for the right frequency (you have to screw in each antenna, so look for the frequency number or the same color stickers and attach them to the right one).It was pretty much plug and play.  All the channels were all preprogrammed so all I had to do was plug everything in and turn it on.  I also like the fact it comes with rack attachments with all the screws - which only come on the more expensive Shures (if you don't want to just tape it down onto a rack shelf).I do have a caveat - I'm not a sound expert or a singer.  Saying that, they sound fine.  I have enough controls and effects in my mixer to get the right sound I want anyway, and the signal coming in is clear and full enough to work with.  I tried to see if I could get feedback, and by doing things that usually gets me all kinds of feedback from the GTD Audio or the Shures I couldn't reproduce feedback, or at least I had to really boost the gain to levels I would never actually use to finally get a little feedback.  I did try to walk around my facility to look for dropouts.  I have a 5,000 square foot room that I use this in and I walked around the entire room with each mic.  I did notice drop outs in some places.  Keep in mind I have the receiver installed in a rack, that is itself inside a steel cabinet, and the antennas are in the back so they are not really line of site.  I would imagine you could reduce some of the drop outs by placing the receiver outside of a cabinet and having all the antennas in a line of site of the mics - I don't really know though as I haven't tested them that way.  The drop outs are very subtle and only a fraction of a second, and I think you would have to be looking for them to notice, and you would have to be standing in just the right place.  The stage is closer to the receiver and I didn't notice dropouts anywhere around the stage otherwise I would have put some tape down to mark them. I really only noticed the dropouts in the middle of the room, where I doubt we'll have any performers using the mics anyway.  I also tried using the mic's really close to each other - another sure way of getting feedback.  At least in my tests they seemed to be able to handle it without any problem. I tried walking in front of the loudspeakers and they passed that test as well - just walking around in front of the speaker while talking, I didn't actually put the mic right up to the speakers.Each mic uses 2 AA batteries, and they even include batteries in the box.  That was nice, but I prefer to use eneloop rechargeable batteries.  The battery compartment slide cover is a little fidgety but not really hard to use.  As I mentioned before there are battery level indicators on the little lcd.  With the eneloop batteries they seem to last a really long time.  I haven't timed it to exact number of hours yet, but I used to replace the batteries in the GTD after every gig to be on the safe side because the indicators only had like three bars total and after every gig they were down to one bar.  On the Awisco there are a lot of bars so you have a better idea of how much you have left.The manual is not really big and detailed but at least it looks like it was put together with some thought and it's in an intelligible english and has just enough to figure out what you need - at least for me.One thing I can't comment on yet is long term durability.  The price of the GTD Audio is comparable if not a little less but I was only able to get a year and a half out of the receiver.  I'm hoping these will last longer.  For the heck of it I purchased a square trade warranty which I never really do for electronics, but from my experience with wireless mic systems I thought it might be a good idea.I wanted to mention that I read another review for the two channel/mic version of this system and he mentioned the mic's were made from metal.  I read though in his comments that he purchased an previous version of that system and it may have changed.  I wanted to clarify that the mic's I received were plastic an not metal.  They feel nice though still plastic.Something else I wanted to comment on is sound from handling the mic.  I had a Shure Beta 58 wireless mic that didn't make a lot of noise from handling, then I tried the entry level SM58 and it was like someone was stroking sandpaper over the mic and I had to return it.  The GTD Audio wasn't really that bad as far as that goes.  The Awisco does pick up some noise but you really have to bump it or grab it from one hand to the other roughly to even notice.  Nothing near as bad as the Shure SM58 did.  If you're just holding the SM58 and your hand changes position even slightly or you even just tighten or loosen your grip it amplified it like crazy.  If you're just holding the Awisco mics and you need to adjust your hand or you're moving around a lot it's fine.

Based on the positive reviews I ordered this, but had to return it right away.  I've owned another shure wireless mic system with a wireless beta 58 mic and had good experiences, but it was a different design than this.  I've also used other wireless mic systems from other manufacturers.  From the reviews I thought this would be a good economical way to get another shure system with two mic's.  When it arrived I hooked it up for a test and right away it was amplifying every single movement of my hand, and very loudly.  Maybe if I leave it in a mic stand I could do away with that, but this is a wireless mic so my intention is to be holding it so I can move around the stage or room.  Any slight movement of my hand on any part of the body of the mic is heard throughout the room.  It's not acceptable.

Like most businesses we have to prop the front door open very often.  It's a heavy aluminum frame glass front commercial door with a strong auto closing spring.  I've been going through door stops like they were door mats (which means every few months).  We've been using the kind that swing down that they have at the local hardware superstores, and I pay extra for the heavy duty kind.  But they get beat up and the springs mess up and the whole thing becomes useless after a while.  I searched online for another solution and found these that you step on and the part that grabs the floor slides down.  I wasn't too sure about it, but what the heck I can try it and if it doesn't work, it's not like it would be any different than what I am doing.  First of all it's heavy and big.  Everything about it heavy duty.  I don't know how it will work in the long run, but it seems to be sturdier than the swing down type.  It mounted pretty easy, but I didn't account for the bulky size of it.  After installing the door wouldn't close because it's so big the front part bumped up against the door frame and the door couldn't close all the way.  I had to take it off, move it over about half and inch and re-install it.  After that it was fine.Couple observations though.  It's not as intuitive to use as a swing down door stop.  So I've noticed people fiddling with it to figure it out.  Also since it doesn't swing down and hit the ground at an angle it doesn't grab as well so you have to work it a little to make it stop the door from closing.  If you don't have a strong auto closing door, maybe that wouldn't be an issue, but for ours it is.

I was at a Japanese supermarket on a business trip right about when my daughter was born 7 years ago.  I saw this and noticed the construction looked better and more precise than anything I could find at any local baby or department stores.  It worked great.  It really is made very well, the build tolerances on it could make Lexus envious.  You can clip the tiniest finger nails with this thing and it works just as well now as it did the first day we bought it.  My sister-in-law just had a baby and the first thing we thought of giving her was one of these.  We still use it for our daughter so we couldn't give her ours, thankfully found it here on amazon and we ordered one for her.  We had it shipped to us first so we could mail to her in Canada and when it arrived it looked just like the one we have, so it seems they are still made the same.  Buy this once and be done with it.  This little thing is so treasured in our household that we have a special place we keep it so we don't loose it.

I have to mention I HATE watery soap.  I hate it when people (cheapskates) somehow think that when you only have a little soap left that if you mix in water then presto you have a full container of hand soap.  First of all you have to use ten times as much to get any kind of lather going and second it feels icky.  My wife knows never to mix water with the hand soap at our house.  At my business I occasionally find that someone mysteriously mixes the soap containers with water (I think it's the janitors just being lazy, because I'm the owner and I'm not that cheap to tell my janitors to do that).  Whenever I catch that I dump out the whole thing down the sink.  I don't want my patrons to think I'm being that cheap and I don't like washing my own hands with icky watery soap.That being said, you do have to mix water with soap in this dispenser, and I was apprehensive, but it's not bad.  I use a different brand liquid hand soap, and not anything made by or recommended by the manufacturer and have gotten good results.  As others have mentioned I do pump it 2-3 times to get enough soap to wash my hands, but it's more just preference as I like a lot of lather.  I do notice that if you get impatient and slam down quickly that the mix is more watery.  If you press more normally or even slower the lather is thicker.As far as the pump itself, the whole top part screws off and then you're left with the clear bottom container.  It's actually kind of small - maybe half the size of the whole dispenser.  There are fill lines so you don't really have to guess, but there are no real instructions other than that.  First you put in water up to about 60% of the container, then pour in soap till the container is about 80% full, then leave the rest empty - I guess it needs the air to mix in.  So you really don't have that much product overall.  I noticed the soap was all swirly in the container and there were no instructions so I just put the top back on and shook up the whole thing so it was mixed well.  I don't notice any drip from where the soap comes out, but I do notice the bottom is constantly wet.  I don't know if it's just from water spilling onto the sink from using the pump or leaking from the pump itself - I'll have to figure out and update this.  There is a black foam pad on the bottom to keep it from sliding around, but since it's always wet I'm having  wash it off and dry it on occasion.Overall, though I like that it does save on soap use and the foaming lather is alright so we'll keep using it.Updated 04/19/14I finally figured out the excess water was coming from the soap dispenser and not just over spill from the faucet or spilling off of peoples hands.  The top of the actual clear soap container has a big wide opening and just a narrow threading band, so there is not much purchase area for the threading to hold tight.  Also, the outer top part comes down over the whole thing so it's impossible to see how it's screwed on.  If it's tilted and not seated on flat then you have gaps where liquid can get out.  If you over tighten then the threading gives and it pops and spins around again and if its not on just right it could leak.  I have two of the dispensers and one tightens more securely than the other, but oddly enough, the one that seems to tighten securely seems to be the one that leaks more, and the one that the threading seems loose and keeps spinning around unless I finesse it just before the point it will pop loose seems to not leak.Also, as I mentioned the actual soap container is very small.  Just for kicks I tried to estimate how much this thing is actually saving in soap use since I tend to give it a few pumps every time I use it instead of just once for a regular liquid soap dispenser.  I used another 'normal' soap dispenser to pump in soap to the fill line.  I counted about 50 pumps give or take to fill to the fill line.  I used this dispenser in our downstairs restroom that's near our living room which gets the most use.  With 3 people in our house I would guess each person uses it about 3 times a day, so that would be 3 x 3 for about 9 pumps of soap per day with the regular dispenser, so 50 pumps of soap would be equivalent to about 5-6 days worth of soap if I were using regular liquid soap dispenser.  Though to be more accurate I probably did give a harder pump than I would normally do when I was filling the container to get it filled quicker so let's just say it's a little over a weeks worth.  I've noticed that this foaming dispenser has to be refilled after a little less than three weeks which seemed pretty quick compared to a normal liquid soap dispenser, but after measuring out and comparing it does look like I'm stretching about a little more than a weeks worth of soap that I would use in a normal soap dispenser to a little less than 3 weeks with this thing, so that's not really a full 70% savings but still close at probably around 60 something percent that I'm seeing.I mentioned earlier that I run a business.  I thought about using these in my business but decided not to because it doesn't really seem sturdy enough to handle commercial use, especially with a finicky closing top that tends to leak.  Also, the capacity is so small it would be more frustrating having to refill way more often.  So, I'm just using it at home and it's fine for residential use, as long you're careful screwing on the top.

I have 6 of these chained together for uplighting on a stage.  I usually leave it on the fade program and it will fade from one color to the next, though occasionally I'll use other settings.  It's a nice effect and really upgrades the background look of the stage.  I don't use the remote and should have purchased the version of this light without it because if you have them set up as master and slave the remote will override the slave setting and cause the other lights to change.  You pretty much have to have the remote inches away from the master light, and if you're going to be that close it's just as easy to use the controls on the bar itself.  These come with easy tool-less bolts that you can pretty much tighten and loosen with just your hands, but I would recommend changing them out for screws with allen heads.  People keep fidgeting with the angle of the lights and I had one stolen once.  I went to lowes and got the allen head screws and solved that problem.  Just take the existing bolt with you so you can find the right threading, size and length.

I had a carpet cleaner come clean my carpet at my business and he used something like this on a drill to remove gum.  I purchased this and tried it.  It takes a lot of finesse, and even if you're careful the roughed up carpet it leaves behind might be uglier than if you had left the gum in, but it works for our purpose.  Just don't overdo it, and use a brush to clean up the carped and scissors to trim the loose strands.  If you overdo it you can pretty easily destroy your carpet.

I suppose if you have a fairly clean facility without a somewhat normal traffic this mat would be fine for help containing over spill and smell.  We tried it in a high traffic restroom (where there are intoxicated people) and it doesn't really help much in that situation.

I loved the first season.  It didn't have a lot of special effects, but it was like Jaws in which they really pushed the story and creating tension to make up for the lacking effects.  The show really grabbed your attention and made you anticipate the next episode.  In season two you can tell the budget got bigger.  The look became more film like, gritty and the action was bumped up.  Some of the characters were just gone from season 1 without explanation and I feel the tone really changed and there was less focus on keeping up the tension and anticipation.  It was still entertaining but I felt they were spending more time trying to incorporate the gee wiz special effects and got a little lazy with the story and character development.  Season 3 was disappointing compared to the first two.  In the first season each episode was crucial to developing the story and characters.  In the second season a little bit less so, and in the third season you could probably have skipped most of the season and not miss much.  You really have to watch the entire 3rd season to be able to judge it, and if you do that it was fine and worth watching, but on an episode by episode comparison not as strong and entertaining as the first two seasons.  I'm on the fence about the 4th season.  Not really as excited to see it, but I probably will when/if it's included with prime membership.

I have a 7 year old daughter that really wanted to see this movie.  We really don't let her watch PG-13 movies yet but I thought since it was a contemporary take on Snow White and had Amanda Bynes (when she was somewhat normal) it might be o.k.  The story line is fine and follows somewhat the story of Snow White but there are some strong sexual innuendo and a good bit of foul language that I wish I had known about beforehand.  We don't use any foul language in our house, so thankfully our daughter not knowing any better did not pick up on it and never even noticed (I hope).  I guess I should have known that going in to a PG-13 movie.  As a movie, it's just o.k.  The content I would say is more suitable for older teens and if I was that age I'd probably still just give it 3 stars.  It's not really one of Amanda Bynes' best movies.  If you have smaller kids, I would recommend skipping it until they're older.  It's not the worst movie to show young children and we came through unscathed and if you ask my daughter she would probably say she liked the movie, it's just as a parent I would have rather to have not let her see the movie.

I wanted a flood/spot light for work and picked up a Stanley rechargeable spot light at my local wholesale club.  The brightness was fine but the battery life was atrocious.  I decided to do a little research and get a better light and for the price, light output, battery life, and size this seemed like the best buy.  I've had it for a few weeks now and I can say it does not disappoint.  Battery life is great, we use this just about everyday and so far it hasn't run out of power between charges and we use it a good bit.  The light output is fine, it has a brighter spot in the middle and then a larger ring of light that's much less brighter but still usable.  I have much more expensive bicycle lights that put out more lumens and have just as long battery life, but they are small making them easy to drop or misplace.  For work I want a big light that's easy to carry with a big grip and easy to find in the tool box or on the shelf and easy to set down and pick up quickly, it's just an added bonus that it's not all that expensive.  It is heavier I guess due to the type of battery type, but it's still light enough to carry without really noticing - it's no anchor by any means.

This seems like a popular swim suit because it's practically sold out everywhere.  We got the citrine because the color my daughter first wanted actually is sold out everywhere even on Speedo's website.  My daughter is tiny for her age and we want her swimsuit to fit just right and even a little tight is fine so we sized down.  It turned out to be too small. We changed for her right size and it was actually just right, so sizing fits.  My daughter likes the suit and says she feels like a pro athlete when she wears it.  She's just 6 so she's got a long way to go though.  She's been taking lessons for nearly two years and she's gotten pretty good so it was time to grow out of the cutesy swim suites from the kids clothing shops.  She's able to move better and glide through the water better than her old swimsuits.

I needed this to display a 7" tablet for people to use without my supervision and without the worry that they would walk away with the tablet.  I'm using a nook tablet that are available pretty cheap and actually about the same price as this stand but better to buy the tablet and this stand than having to replace a tablet often.  It fits perfectly, well since it's adjustable it can clamp down to any "mini" tablet pretty much.  It holds the tablet fine and it's not loose and is really locked down without any worry someone could just pry it loose by hand.  It uses one of those barrel keys like on bike locks.  The lock is a little hard to get to, but it's ok at least for me as I don't plan on taking it out of the stand again.  The stand looks a little different than the picture.  The tablet actually faces the other way around if that makes sense.  There is a long steel cable that connects to the slider bar on the holder and you can wrap the cable around whatever to make it secure, and you can coil the cable through the hole in the base stand as well.  The tablet can be rotated, but it takes a few steps and once it's rotated it has to be locked into that position, so it can't be adjusted or rotated easily 'on the fly'.  The part that the tablet clamp part is connected to the base stand is where the device can be rotated, but that part actually wobbles a little even after clamping down.  It's also a bid off center, well I guess that depends on your tablet and how far out the sliding clamp has to slide out, but for me it's off center so it's difficult to rotate it so that it feels like the table it level.  It's not a two position landscape or vertical option or even clicks, it's all loose and you have to go by your eye and your judgement if it's level.  Also since it wiggles a little even after it's set strait it tilts a little.  The stand can be bolted down I guess if you need more security, as it has holes in the base, but there is no extra hardware to do that.  You would have to provide your own bolts, nuts, screws or whatever.  As far as price I do think it's on the high side for what it is but it looked like the most secure option without having something custom built.

I used to watch a lot of horror movies in my teens, and maybe 20's.  I'm not an old geezer yet at 40, but with family, work, age, etc I guess I've gotten softer as I really don't enjoy horror anymore.  I don't like roller coasters, go carts, or extreme sports either.  I really can't remember the last true horror movie I've seen.  BUT... I heard a lot about this tv series and was very curious.  I watched the first episode and I was hooked from the first few seconds.  I watched all four seasons (it's in the middle of season 4 now) in a few weeks and loved every bit of it.  This is a great show.  Lots of gore but lots more good drama.

I have three of these.  I believe this is an older design but is still being sold as I bought all of mine at different times.  My first one several years ago and the third one just recently (end of 2013).  This was one of the best buys for capacity and price then and amazingly still is.  As you can imagine I've had lots of power outages and these things have been lifesavers (well computer savers).  I use them at home and at the office.  It has plenty of information you need on the lcd.  It's reliable and not fussy, and just plain does what it's suppose to.  The capacity is nice so I can run a lot off it and get enough backup time (for me).  In my office I use clear wireless internet so that's plugged in, my wireless router, pc, two monitors, a laser printer, voip modem, phone, NAS.  If the power goes out (which it does often for a few seconds or minutes) I can just keep on working (with internet) and not miss a beat.

I bought another no name brand thin case that actually looks just like this one for another tablet I have and didn't really like it very much, it didn't fit perfectly and the cover didn't lay flat, was too stiff in the folds, the seams don't line up, and the materials felt cheap.There are not a lot of choices for the new ipad air yet so I thought I'd try one of the 'cheap' kinds from a different seller this time.  From the pictures it actually looked exactly like the other cheap one I bought, but once I took it out of the box I could tell a difference.  The packaging while not great was still better than that last one.  The materials are better, and the fit is perfect - exactly perfect.  The cover lays flat, and folds easily.  Everything I didn't like about the case I bought from the other seller was better with this one.  The price is great on this too, saves a lot over the case apple sells.  It has the magnetic cover that closes tight and turns the screen off and on, which works perfectly.  When closed all the seams match and looks like a custom cover should look.  The back part that clips in has just enough of the front exposed that the metal bevel of the ipad still shows which is a nice touch.

A friend and I compared a lot of screen protectors for our phones that we've both gone through and we've pretty much decided for the clear type Tech Armor is the best.  It is cut just a bit smaller than the actual screen size and that's a good thing, because it allows a slight margin of error when you apply the protector, but just enough that hardly any bare screen is showing or is hardly noticeable.  Also the adhesive is really good, it sticky enough to stick and stay but doesn't attract a lot of lint before laying it on, and it doesn't leave any residue, it's also really easy to use the tape to remove any stray lint.  The included cleaning cloth is better too because it doesn't leave a lot lint, some cloths that we had actually left more lint than it removed.  I bough this for my family's new ipad air and it went on perfect the first time (though I had a lot of practice putting on screen savers for all my phones, wife's, parents, etc.)  I had to remove lint/dust from two places and used the tape and came off fine.  The screen works just like normal, very responsive and it's perfectly clear.  My wife probably doesn't even know I put a protector on it.

Ordered this to go along with a hard drive replacement.  I always replace a cable when I replace a drive because it's just cheap insurance.  This is a nice cable, feels heavy duty with enough flex to get in where it needs.  I needed a cable with a 90 deg connector so that it will fit, this works just fine.

I don't know how Amazon offers these with prime but I'm hooked and thankful I don't have to lug these things to my car and then to my office from the local office supply stores.  As far as the this item, these are envelopes, what can I say?  They hold my letters and and have security tint inside that's fine for me.  As long as Amazon is shipping them I know they'll be packed well enough that they won't get damaged and that is also fine for me.

These are a good length and work fine for my Samsung Galaxy phone.  I wanted this for especially for my Galaxy phone because with regular cables I get constant pop ups about charging/usb storage etc along with the extra icons in the notification bar and it gets very annoying and that is regardless of if I'm plugged into the usb port of my pc or a dedicated charger.  I only use the cable for charging so I don't need the annoyance of those popups.  This cable gets rid of all these at least for me and my phone.  I also like longer cables than the standard oem 3ft cables so I can hold the phone up to my ear in case I get a phone call and don't have to unplug it.  Shipping did take longer than I would have liked but the options for these types of cables with good reviews for product and seller are very limited, so it was worth it for me.  If amazon sold it direct I'd buy it from them.

There are so many learning systems out there so it's hard to figure out what to use.  My wife and I decided to try Singapore Math along with other workbooks.  This is the Intensive Practice workbook which is different from the Primary workbook and the Textbooks.  We chose the Intensive Practice because we still want our daughter to start with the basic levels of Singapore Math concepts and work her way up, but she is already advanced enough to figure out most on her own so we skipped the Primary workbook and textbook.  As she gets to more advanced levels we will likely get the textbooks to explain some more complex concepts.  Just be aware since there are different books even within levels that sellers might get confused as well.  We had one seller send us the Textbook instead so we had to send it back.  I ordered from another seller to be on the safe side and that one sent the the correct book (also better packaged as well).

I'm glad I found these.  Mortise locks are very expensive.  I have a commercial building and I was quoted a ridiculous price by a locksmith to replace one of these, and local hardware stores don't carry them.  Builder supply houses only carry more expensive ones.  This is priced less than half of what I could locally and seems to work fine.  I don't know how they will last long term, but at the price it's more than worth trying out.

I remember not even very long ago that 10,000 rpm hard drives were reserved just for dream machines and prices reflected it, but now with SSD these things are priced pretty reasonably.  I replaced most of my computers with SSD's but one of them had a 1 tb 7200 rpm boot drive that I didn't really want to go breaking up to use a smaller SSD because 1tb ssd are still crazy expensive.  Before trying this I bought a hybrid drive (which is actually based on a 5600 rpm drive) and tried it for a few months and was not impressed.  Supposedly the hybrid drive gets faster with use, but I didn't notice it and it actually felt slower than my original 7200 rpm drive.  This Velocirapter went on sale so I tried it out.  It installed fine and I could notice a big improvement over the hybrid drive (never going back to that technology).  Not really anywhere near as fast as an SSD but for the money I'm satisfied.  I'm deducting a star because this thing is noisy, the clicking is the loudest hard drive I've ever heard.  It's not like drums banging and sometimes if I'm not paying attention it doesn't really bother me, but sometimes it'll be doing something like a program starting up and click loudly like a hundred times and that is annoying.

I use these in my business not as a trade to press for customers but to press linens that we use for our own use.  We started with two.  It's easy to operate and it's portable enough.  We tried using the steam function but it's more of a hassle and it seems to work about the same without it so we never use it.  We use ours regularly so the pad cover wore out and I had to buy replacements for both units, which was easy to replace (even without clear instructions).  One of the machines stopped working so I'm deducting a star, we're not sure why and user error is not out of the question.  These are inexpensive enough that it makes more sense to buy another instead of repairing so we bought another just like it.  The new one works just fine and one of the originals is still kicking even years later.

I've tried every other night guard there is and the result is the same, they all get destroyed.  At least Plackers acknowledges it and give you a box full at a reasonable price so you can discard one and start new.  However, they recommend you use these only once and then discard, which is kind of overkill.  I can usually go a week or two before I need to throw one out so one box can last a few months.  I just brush these when I brush my teeth in the morning and let it dry all day and at night it's fine.  These are better in one regard to some night guards as they only have pieces that contact your back teeth where most of the grinding action takes place. At least it can reduce some of the shifting of your teeth, yes using night guards shift your teeth.  Over the years I used so many of the moldable night guards that cover your front teeth that it pushed my front teeth out so that they the top teeth don't touch my bottom teeth when I clench my teeth together.  Even when using these Plackers every once in a while I'll sleep a few days without them so my teeth can get a chance to shift back into place.  I may wake up with neck and upper back cramps but it's better than having messed up teeth over the long run.

I got this for my business so I could check to make sure I turned down the HVAC when I wasn't there and to turn it on before I get to my office so it's nice and comfy by the time I get there since I don't keep regular hours.  I have a very old system so I had to have an electrician install it.  He had to do some fanagling to get it to work and to get the recommended voltage (including running new wiring), so I wouldn't have been able to install it by myself.  I have four more HVAC units at my business and was hoping the install would be easy enough that I could figure it out after seeing him do it and install extra units myself but that's not happening.After the install, setting up was a breeze.  I think a couple times something got hung up, but it all worked out without too much hassle or having to call customer service.  However, the thing kept disconnecting.  Over the next few days it would disconnect at random times and I would get notices by email.  I went through some other reviews and saw the advice about the router setting and sure enough my router was in mixed mode so I set it WPA2 only.  It's been a couple weeks now and it hasn't disconnected yet, so I'm pretty happy with the thermostat.  After the first few days of disconnections I had decided against replacing the thermostats on my other units, but now I'm satisfied and will be upgrading all the others.

I saw some reviews stating the quality of this item has deteriorated or was poor with loose switches and outlet plates, but mine seemed pretty well built.  I also have the Furman PST 8D and while the SS-6B is no where near as robust as that is, it's pretty sturdy for the money especially compared to some of the power strips you get at Target or Home Depot.  The cable is really long which is what I need and the power strip is heavy so it stays put.

I needed to make some threads in an aluminum door frame so I needed more control over the threading tap than a power drill offers.  It seems there are a lot of the manual hand drills to choose from.  This one seemed to have the best overall reviews.  It worked perfectly fine for me, though it was only used on one project to tap a few threads.  It offered plenty of control and the quality of materials seems fine.

My six year old daughter went through a horse phase and we watched any video we could find with horses. I thought she might like this so we watched the first couple episodes.  While she seemed to enjoy them while watching the videos she never really mentioned it again afterwards and didn't really care to watch other episodes.  It may be because she got over the horse thing and has moved on.  It seems kids have so much available to them now it's really easy to get distracted by something new.  The show seemed fine, nothing controversial, normal tv kids show production quality.

Our old shower squeegee had a hard blade that didn't do so well, so I searched for one with a softer rubber blade.  This one is almost perfect except ours leaves streaks.  The rubber is soft and almost leaves the glass perfectly spotless but the edges of the blade have manufacturing ridges that are not perfectly smooth so it leaves streaks in a few places but a really big one right in the middle.  So while the rest of the blade works mostly fine I get this big streak down the middle.  I tried smoothing out the ridge of the blade as best I could but the streak stays there.  As far as width it's not really that long though not really too short either, but if it did a good job it would be fine.  In order to get rid of the streak I have to overlay my swipes so it effectively reduces the swiping width by half.  If I press down ridiculously hard it makes a clean swipe about half the time, so that's what I'm doing now until we get another squeegee.  It may just be a manufacturing goof with mine, so ymmv. Except for the streak in the middle of the blade this would be a nice squeegee as otherwise everything else about it is fine.

My six year old daughter saw this somewhere and begged for one.  She absolutely loves it.  She turns it on every night.  We've had it for a while and it's held up well, actually my daughter is pretty good about taking care of her things so she really doesn't break anything.  She likes the colors.  The amber color is the dimmest setting and the purple and green are pretty bright - almost too bright.  You can set it to automatically switch through all the color but it's too jarring going from the dimmer color to the really bright colors so we never use that function.  She usually just sets it to the amber color with the 10 minute timer.  Actually she still hasn't figured out there is a timer as she always falls asleep before the timer cuts off the lights, otherwise if she knew there was a timer I know she would demand we don't use the timer and she would probably leave it on all night.

I'm not musical at all so take this with a grain of salt.  My wife plays for fun so she just has beginner violins and uses the bows that come with them.  I had heard the finer bows were made of Pernambuco or carbon fiber and looked around for some.  I ordered this because it was priced so low compared to other bows and my wife likes it.  Side by side it's a lot better in materials and construction compared to cheap bows that come with beginner violins.  Side by side with higher end bows you can tell it's not in the same league but well it's fine for my wife's purpose of just playing for fun.  She had a club she plays together with and they go to places like senior citizen centers and places like that.

These are massive cables, as in they are very thick and look like they can withstand some abuse.  Construction, materials, and build quality are pretty good.  I don't see anything negative about them so far.  I don't notice any extra static or sound degradation so they're fine by me.

I needed to drill holes through an aluminum retail store front door to install new locks myself instead of paying a locksmith $400 to do it.  These worked fine enough.  I lubricated with some oil and that just made things messy as the shards of metal just got sticky and stuck to everything, and there were lots of metal flying everywhere.  The combo guide drill and cutter made the process a little quicker, but the guide would crawl a little until it bit into the metal.  I was able to get the job done and it was well enough within acceptable tolerances for the lock to work though.

I was looking for a taller than normal table/desk to use as a DJ stand, and this fit the bill.  Similarly priced DJ stands are very flimsy, and sturdier professional stands cost many times more than this.  This is the perfect table size and height.  From reading the other reviews I assumed the worst as far as material quality and it pretty much met my expectations of very weak particle board filler with a laminate outer.  I have other furniture like this and from my experience the only way to make these sturdy is to assemble with wood glue and let the original bolts pretty much just be the clamping force to let the glue dry.  The only draw back with that is that you're never going to be able to disassemble the table, as long as you're ok with that the glue is going to make the desk/table a lot more sturdier.  I have my table assembled and the glue has dried and like the results.  It's been used a few times for gigs and it's worked fine.  I plan to drill some holes for cables and then it'll be perfect.  I don't need to move it so it doesn't have to be portable for me, if you need a table that can fold or is easy to move this isn't a good option, but if you want a DJ stand that you can leave at home or a business this is pretty nice for the price.

I purchased this drive at the end of May to "upgrade" from a standard 1TB 7200rpm drive.  From the beginning I didn't notice any discernible improvement in speed.  I thought I'd give it time to speed up after using the drive for a while.  It never improved.  Towards the end of August my pc would not boot from the drive.  I went back to using the old 7200rpm drive I replaced, but surprisingly the the SSHD still showed up on my computer as another drive so I left it on the pc as an extra drive.  More recently the computer would lag and freeze up and it seemed like it was coinciding with the clicks from the hard drive so I decided to upgrade the drive before some catastrophe.  I just recently upgraded to a WD 10,000 rpm drive and I noticed a definite improvement immediately.  But I also noticed that my pc would not work right with the SSHD still attached (lagging and freezing), but when I unconnected it the pc ran perfect.  So I'm thinking the freezing up was not from my 7200rpm drive acting up but the SSHD being connected to the computer even as a spare slave drive.  Either way I'm satisfied with the WD velociraptor drive and keeping it and tossing out the SSHD and giving up on the hybrid concept.  This particular pc I had a 1tb drive so that is why I considered the SSHD or the 10,000 rpm drive.  All my other pc's I've upgraded to SSD and really there is no comparison to an SSD and anything else.

I've been running with Asics gt-xxxx series for ages and upgrade regularly to the newest model.  When they revamped the line and sort of recreated the shoe I looked into other brands as I heard mixed reviews.  After just a few runs in a new pair of Brooks my feet hurt and told me to go back.  I was relieved to find this model still around and in my size.  They are perfect for my feet.  I guess I will try the updated model or another line in Asics when I need another pair, hopefully they'll still work me.

So my mother who is nearing 70 asks me to look in to one of these for her so she can work out while watching tv.  I read all the reviews and people have compliments and complaints about every one of these from the cheap ones to the very expensive models, so seems to me there really isn't much difference and you really don't get what you pay for.  Since I know she really isn't going to be working out all that vigorously and will probably quit using after a couple times I pick out this because the reviews are mixed but fairly good and it's cheap.  I had it shipped to my parents home and my father said it was pretty easy to put together.  It's been over six months now and my mother loves it, she still uses it regularly, and it's held up pretty well.  I've seen it in person and tried a few spins on it, and it does look kind of flimsy and would probably fail if I had a few hard work outs on it, but I didn't get it for me.  For my mom it's just what she wanted.

Overall these are o.k. sound and quality wise, but the fit is uncomfortable.  The earpieces are too big and the other sizes don't fit well either.  I still use them as I can tolerate them if I only want to listen to them for a few minutes maybe up to a half hour.
Easy to replace, and it's fairly inexpensive and seems to do the job.  I really like just being able to replace filters quickly instead of having to clean.

Got this for my 6 year old daughter to help while she's learning inline skating.  We went by the sizing chart and it recommends Xsmall, but the waist was too constricting for her so we sized up to a small.  The small fits a lot better.  This seller was excellent about exchanging and shipped incredibly fast and communication was great.  It's not a whole lot of padding but still enough that it helps absorb the brunt of the falls, and it's pretty slim fitting so she can still wear loose clothing on top of it without people knowing she has it on - which she really likes.

I wanted something with a longer chord to be able to use the phone while it was plugged in and the original is too short.  This works perfect.  Charges fine, no issues and the it's the perfect length.  The only con is that the light on the charger is very bright so it's annoying to leave the phone charged in the bedroom at night - covering up the light solved that issue.

This is a great dash cam.  It comes packaged in a box and it includes the dash cam, manual, suction cup mount, 8GB sd card, cigarette lighter adapter, and mini usb cable.  So basically it comes with everything you need to use it right out of the box.  The manual is detailed and easy to read and in proper English.  I especially like that an 8GB sd card is included with this which will store about 70 minutes of video.  You can also expand up to a 32GB card.The camera itself is small but I like it because it is not in the way when mounted on the dash.  The video quality is full HD 1080p and looks really good.  You can see details like license plates and the video looks really clear and good.  You can also take still photos which come out very clear and sharp.  The night vision also looks pretty good on this camera.  It also has a G sensor which will detect significant or sudden movement and automatically lock the video file being produced at the time.  The camera also has a 4X zoom function as well as 170 degree wide angle lens so you get more of the road in view.This is a great camera for the price.  I see some of the negative reviews mentioned that the manual was bad and they couldn't get it going but like I said I thought the manual was good.  Perhaps they made a new manual since then. I had no problems at all and I high recommend this dash cam. Camera was provided by manufacturer in exchange for an honest review.

Great band.  Really lightweight and the material is very smooth and comfortable.  The pin and tuck works fine for me and the band stays on.  It looks much better than the sport bands that come with the watch.  It is easy to get on and off and it's my go to sport option.  Would love some other colors!  Sample provided in exchange for an honest review, all opinions are my own.

After reading the reviews I wasn't sure what to expect. I have a lot of ornaments and they are all just thrown in a box so this is a much better solution for me.  The boards on the inside are cardboard yes, but it is actually pretty thick cardboard.  There is a board on bottom and on each side and then you insert the dividers.  You can put the dividers in any slot making the sizes as big or as small as needed.  As you can see in the picture you can fit quite a bit in here and there are 3 levels which are all separated by another board.The bag is an okay material and the zippers work well.  Once it is all put together it is pretty good.  Obviously you would put this on top of a stack of boxes rather than on the bottom.  It is not the strongest thing in the world but it is also not flimsy.  It is working out great for me and much better than a plain old box.  I received this item at a discount in exchange for an honest review, all opinions are my own.

What a neat idea.  You get 3 of these and they have several snaps so you can fit them on a variety of heads.  It keeps the water out of the child's eyes and ears (provided that you put them on correctly).  And they also actually do make it more fun.  Plus no crying from soap in the eyes.  The price is great and you get one for each of your bathrooms, or even grandma's house.  Sample provided in exchange for an honest review, all opinions are my own.

This little dresser is so cute!  It came well packaged with no damage.  The instructions are easy to follow and everything is labled so it is very easy and fast.  It only took about 15 minutes to assemble and the only tool needed is a phillips head screw driver.  It is very well made and all the holes lined up as they should.One side has 4 shelves and the other side has a closet pole and comes with 3 wood hangers.  Then on the sides it has a mirror and a shelf, and the other side has 3 hooks to hang things.  The colors are just as pictured and they perfectly match the other Olivia's world doll furniture.  I am in love it is absolutely adorable!  Highly recommend this!  Sample provided in exchange for an honest review, all opinions are my own.

This is the cutest little crib!  It arrived very well packaged with no damage.  It did not take long at all to assemble and everything is labeled, even the screws.  All you need is a phillips head screw driver.  The colors are just as pictured and it even comes with the bedding.  The doors underneath the crib open for storage and there is a magnet closure on the doors.  The mobile spins and there are little butterfly designs on the front on sides.It is very well made and all the holes lined up where they were supposed to.  It is all wood and the finish can easily be wiped down.  This is a very nice and sturdy piece that will last for awhile.  Highly recommend!!!  Sample provided in exchange for an honest review all opinions are my own.

This is nicer than I expected.  When I opened the box and saw I had to assemble it I thought it was going to be horrible but it actually only took a few minutes and it was very easy.  The materials are stronger than expected and once it was together it is actually very sturdy. It is very light and easy to move around. This can hold a lot of shoes too.  I am thinking it would also be great as a plant stand too. I am very pleasantly surprised how nice this is.  Sample provided in exchange for an honest review, all opinions are my own.

I got the red plaid and it is so cute.  This will make an awesome easy gift.  Pop in a bottle of wine and stick a bow on it and you have an awesome present for the wine drinker!  It has a zip top and it is also insulated to keep it cold.  The material is very thick and the whole thing is well made.  It even comes with a bottle opener which is actually pretty nice.  It has a little knife to cut the foil.  Great price on this too.  Get it!  Sample provide in exchange for an honest review, all opinions are my own.

This is a nice basic set of packing cubes.  They are well made and have good zippers.  There are 2 zippers on each so you can open them half way or all the way.  The tops are clear so you can see what is inside.  They would be great for shampoo, lotions, etc because they are closed and will protect from spills. Or you could use them to separate wet or dirty clothes.  I am thinking you could probably machine wash them too.  Great set.  Sample provided in exchange for an honest review, all opinions are my own.

Let me start by saying I have really thick hair. Hair bands actually break it is so thick.  I used to hate these type of brushes because they would actually break apart when I would brush my hair.  This brush has changed my mind totally.  I love it.  It is HUGE for one.  It only takes a second to brush out all my hair.  The handle is great, very grippy so you can really hold on to it.  I used it wet and dry and I love it both ways.  It is very well made and even pulling through tangles it just powers through them.  I am totally in love with this brush!  Highly recommend!  I received this brush at a discount in exchange for an honest review, all opinions are my own.

This thing is HUGE.  I took a photo next to a sharpie so you can see just how BIG it is.  It is also SHARP, so be careful.  It does come with a cover so can store it safely.  It works great for zesting fruits as well as for cheese.  It really is fantastic I was surprised how well it worked.  I find it easier to shred cheese with this type versus the flat kind.  The handle is big and easy to hold. It also has a hook if you choose to hang it up.  Great tool everyone needs this!  Sample provided at a discount in exchange for an honest review, all opinions are my own.

I like to use these teeth whitening pens as a touch-up.  I normally buy them at the dollar store so I compared the two to find that this one uses Carbamide Peroxide and my dollar pen uses Hydrogen peroxide.  A study published in Journal of the American Dental Association showed that carbamide peroxide appeared to produce slightly more dramatic results at first.I do think this pen did work better than what I was using. I have been using it twice daily. It is easy to use and makes me feel good knowing it was made in the USA. I also like that it left my mouth feeling really fresh due to the peppermint oil.  I will have to see what I think when I run out if I will pay more for this or continue using the cheap ones. I received this pen in exchange for an honest review, all opinions are my own.

It works on the Nexus 6P!  The end that plugs into the phone seems of good quality unlike some that come apart after pulling it repeatedly.  It charges fast and worked with the wall adapter I had.  The length is 3.3 ft which is not too long but works for me on my desk.  No complaints!  I received this cable in exchange for an honest review, all opinions are my own.

This bed is adorable! It came well packaged with no damage.  The box was smaller than expected and not heavy at all.  The box does have a photo of a bed on the outside so keep that in mind if your child is around when the mail comes. It took me about 20 minutes to put this together...it was VERY easy.  Everything is labeled and marked and the instructions are easy to understand.The beds can be used as bunk beds as shown in the photos, OR you can have them separate.  They included an extra 4 of the circular bed post tops so you can separate them if that is what you prefer. It also did come with the bedding and pillows for each bunk. The ladder just rests against the bed, it is not attached.  Either way it is absolutely adorable. It is fairly sturdy but I am thinking it may break if a small child tried to get it on it. It will fit dolls up to 18" tall including American girl.  I received this product at a discount in exchange for an honest review, all opinions are my own.

I love these containers. They have compartments so you can put foods together in the same container that you don't want touching.  The container sizes are big enough to fit anything I have cooked so far.  The tops are raised so if the food is taller than the container the lid will still fit on without smushing the food.  They would be great for meal planning, kids lunches, or just storing leftover dinner.  It's pretty great they can go from the freezer to the microwave to the dishwasher.  Plus they are BPA free.  No complaints, great containers.  Sample was provided at a discount in exchange for an honest review, all opinions are my own.

This oil smells soooo good.  It comes in a large bottle that is amber glass.  It is 100% pure and you can tell it is not watered down. It is an uplifiting energizing scent. It is great in the diffuser to help boost your mood.  It is also great for using in cleaning products as citrus is a natural deodorizer. It blends will with: Basil, Frankincense, Ylang Ylang, Geranium, Lavender, Peppermint, Rosemary, and Bergamot essential oils.   Sample provided at a discount in exchange for an honest review, all opinions are my own.

I really like this case (and I am very picky about my cases)  The back is a shiny plastic and the sides (gray parts) are a grippy plastic.  I really like how it feels in my hand. The grips on the sides are very good.  I love how it looks and the colors are very true to what is pictured.  All the ports are accessible but I just have on problem with the volume slider.  It is hard to reach without fingernails.  I can live with it though because I really like the case. The apple logo cutout is not protected but I have a screen protector on the back of my phone to cover it.  The kickstand ring is some kind of actual metal with a tape adhesive on the back.  I did not use it because I do not want it stuck to my phone so I cannot report on how well it sticks.  I just really liked the case.  Sample provided in exchange for an honest review, all opinions are my own.

Nice band!  I got the space gray and I like the color.  I was really pleasantly surprised when I opened the package.  It comes with everything even the screwdriver and device to remove links for sizing.  There aren't instructions in the package but I follow the instructions in the photos on the product page and was able to use the tool to remove links.  It really transforms the look of the watch if you changing over from one of the sport bands.  For the price this band is awesome.  I received this band at a discount in exchange for an honest review, all opinions are my own.

These cubes are really nice.  This is a great way to keep everything neat and organized.  The bonus laundry bag is awesome so you have somewhere to put your dirty laundry instead of shoving it back in the suitcase.  I love how the tops are made of a mesh so you can see what is inside.  Everything can be stored in the bottom cube when not in use.  There are pull strings on all the zippers to make it even easier to open as well as zippers on each side.  I like that there are several sizes and I can even use them in a backpack.  I got the blue on and the color is very nice as well.  I really like this set alot!  Sample provided in exchange for an honest review, all opinions are my own.

This is a really nice quality bag.  It can fit a lot of yarn inside.  It has a carry handle and pockets to store your tools.  I am going to fill this up with several different types of yarn and give it as a gift to my mom who likes to crochet.  It is made of a nice heavy duty material and on the outside and it is soft on the inside.  It also has a cute polka dot pattern on the inside.  It is well made and the zippers are not cheap ones.  Should last a long time.  Sample provided in exchange for an honest review, all opinions are my own.

Good price for these.  You get 20 in the pack.  I purchased in Nov 2015 and the expiration on them were not until 5/2018.  I also really like that they are made in the USA....how many products can say that these days?You will need to pee in a cup to use these as you have to dip the strip and then lay it flat to read the results. This is a very large bottle and it treats 1,880 gallons of water.  It is a very good price because the in the pet stores the bottle costs twice as much for half the product. I received this product at a discount in exchanged for an honest review, all opinions are my own.

This is a great deal for some great towels.  I go through many towels in my kitchen and I have bought "nice" ones and they always end up stained or with bleach spots.  These towels are nice and strong, well made and absorbent. They are 100% cotton as well. They are so handy and good for so many things around the house.  Plus I can bleach them to ensure they are really clean.  No complaints!  Big thumbs up!  Samples provided in exchange for an honest review, all opinions are my own.

This comforter came packaged nicely in a clear zippered bag.  When I opened it I washed it immediately.  The tag says the material is 100% microfiber.  The material is not as soft as I thought it would be.  It is not scratchy and hard but it is not "silky" as described.  It has stitching across to keep the filling from shifting which is nice.  It has a nice thickness to it.  I tried to show the thickness in the photos.The sizes of the comforters are not listed but it was a little small for my bed.  I do have a really tall mattress though so if you have no feather-beds or toppers on your mattress you should be okay.  I put this comforter inside a duvet which I think is the best use for it.  Unless you like the plain white comforter look.  My duvet cover is 104 inches x 90 inches and you can see in the photos it is a bit smaller than the duvet.I think is comforter is decent.  I am not blown away by it.  I think the price is high for this.  I received this product at a discount in exchange for an honest review, all opinions are my own.

I had seen all over the internet people were using this to whiten their teeth so I was excited to try it.  It comes in a huge resealable bag.  Inside it is a very fine black powder.  There is a scoop inside the bag.  When I reached in to dig it out the powder got on my arm and hand.  It doesn't just brush off.. you need soap and water to get it off.  It was kind of like when you check the oil in your car and your covered in black.So I put a bit on my toothbrush and then started brushing my teeth with it.  It didn't really taste like anything but it was crazy looking. I kind of brushed around.  I wasn't sure if I was supposed to let it sit or what so I started trying to rinse.  It took quite a bit of rinsing to get it off.  It got in my gumline and in between my teeth so I had to brush really good and then floss to get it all off. It won't fully come out of my toothbrush which is now a shade of gray.  You may want to use a spare one for this.  I think it did whiten my teeth slightly...maybe.  I think I may need to leave it on longer.  The main thing to note is that it is messy.  I received this product at a discount in exchange for an honest review, all opinions are my own.

This speaker was bigger than I expected.  It comes nicely packaged in a box so it would make a great gift.  It has many features that regular shower speakers don't.  It has separate buttons for everything so you don't have to do any of that press once for volume, press twice for skip, etc.  It is nice to have the buttons for each.  It also has a digital clock which is great if you need to keep an eye on the time getting ready for work or school.  You can even answer the phone with it when connected.  I also really like that is rechargeable so I never need to buy batteries.It also has an FM radio with saved presets!  There has been a ton of times I got in the shower without having my phone's bluetooth enabled so I couldn't listen to anything on my old shower speaker.  With this one if I forget my phone I can still listen to the radio.  Plus I can save my favorite stations so I don't have to spend half of my shower scanning for stations.  You may be thinking the price is high but it is really worth it, this thing is the Cadillac of shower speakers, it has it all!  Sample provided in exchange for an honest review, all opinions are my own.

These sound amazing for the price.  These get 5 stars from me because they have an excellent sound and the price is amazing.  They are well packaged and would make a great gift.Looks: The headphones look great. They look well made and the cord is nice quality.  I don't see it unraveling. There is a button on the cord for pause/play and to take phone calls.  The plug that inserts into your phone/device is made so it won't come apart or rip.Feel: They come with 3 different sized tips to ensure a comfortable fit.  They are comfortable to wear and lightweight.  The cord is very long (4 1/2 feet).  The actual earbuds detach from the cord.  I am not sure why so I will probably never use that feature.Sound: These headphones sound really good.  They stay clear and crisp at high volumes and get pretty loud.  The sound is impressive for such a small speaker and they rival large on ear headphones.  They also have great bass.Cons: I wish they had the flat cord that doesn't tangle.Sample provided in exchange for an honest review, all opinions are my own.

These headphones are awesome!  They arrive in an beautiful box that looks very high end.  Inside you will find the headphones, zippered carrying case, and audio cable.  They are beautiful headphones with many nice little touches.Looks: The headphones look very expensive. The brushed metal is very nice looking.  I thought they would be silver but actually the metal part looks like a gray metal to me.  I actually like it better than the silver look.Feel: All the moving parts seem high quality and work as they should.  They fold up nicely and they are lighter than I expected.  They are VERY comfortable to wear.  The padding on the ears is just right and there is also some padding on the top. I wore them for a good while and they didn't start hurting like some others do. The cable has a volume control and play/stop button, Mic and it worked perfect with my iPhone (just make sure you plug the right end into your phone).  The cable is also the flat style that doesn't tangle.Sound: Wow.  They sound great.  I listened to an assortment of genres of music and they all sound great.  Everything is so crystal clear and the bass is very nice.  They get very loud and the music still stays perfect at high volumes.  You can hear everything.  I really enjoyed listening to music with them.Cons: The person sitting near you can hear what your listening to if you have it fairly loud, so if your trying to listen to Taylor Swift on the down low people can hear it :)Sample provided in exchange for an honest review, all opinions are my own.

I have never seen the movie Fargo so I went into this having no clue what it was going to be about.  After a few episodes I googled it because I thought there was no way this could be a "true story".  It said it was a true story at the beginning of each episode which I later discovered was just a joke.The show is awesome and gets better and better as it goes along.  I am a huge LOTR fan so it took a bit to get past Bilbo Baggins playing the lead, but he is actually a wonderful actor now that I see him playing in something else. Billy Bob Thornton is also really good in this. The story is crazy and will keep you very entertained.  The supporting cast are all very good.  Once you start you won't be able to stop.  This is one of the best shows on TV.

I wasn't sure what to expect but I have completely fallen in love with this show.  I never want it to end!  I am currently on season 4 and there has not been even 1 bad episode.  The dynamic between Prince Aurthur and Merlin is awesome, they are so funny together. I have grown to love King Uther too, he reminds me of the clueless king in the old cartoon Robin Hood movie who sucks his thumb.It is family friendly so any age can watch it, but it is not corny at all.  It has lots of action and the stories are entertaining and fun.  I would give this show 10 stars if I could!  If you like LOTR, Narnia, Harry Potter, etc you will love this show I promise!  I wish the flashy thing in Men in black was real so I could forget the whole show and watch it all over again!

These lights are so pretty.  I really like that they are solar so I can literally put them anywhere.  They come well packaged in a box and you have to attach each shade over the light.  It is not hard just takes a minute. They look really beautiful and at night they emit a soft warm glow.  Solar lights can be hit or miss but so far these lights have come on consistently each night and stayed on for several hours. I think they are worth the asking price especially because they are solar and you have the freedom to place them anywhere.  Sample provided in exchange for an honest review, all opinions are my  own.

This is a great set.  It comes in a black gift box and is well presented.  It comes with everything you need to get started including the razor, 5 blades, blade guard, and polishing towel..  At first glance it seemed a little intimidating but it is easy to use.  The handle has a good weight to it to ensure a close shave.  This actually shaves closer than the expensive razors that have 6 or more blades.  I was quite suprised by that.  Once you get the hang of it you won't go back to overpaying.  This would also make a perfect gift.  I received this set in exchange for an honest review, all opinions are my own.

Before trying this my only experience was with the cardboard VR viewers.  I have an iPhone 6 plus which was too big to fit in any of the cardboard ones so I always had to kind of just hold my phone up to it ghetto style.When this arrived it comes in a nice box.  When I took it out of the box the glasses looked really nice.  It is lighter than it appears.  The head strap is full adjustable with velcro on the top and the sides.  The part that touches your face is very nicely padded and it is really comfortable to wear.  There are knobs on each side AND and wheel on the top that you can turn to adjust the focus.The back where you insert your phone opens and closes with a magnet closure so all you have to do to open it is pull, but it also stays closed when in use.  Inside there is an adjustable phone holder than you snap your phone into.  Like I said I have an iPhone 6 plus with a case on it and it fit!  It was a pretty tight fit but I got it in there.  Depending on how thick your case is you may need to take it off.Using it was fun.  It is sooooo much better than cardboard.  It is far more comfortable and the ability to focus it makes a big difference. It is a little heavier than cardboard but I think this is more comfortable since it's padded nicely. There is also a cutout on the sides so you can hear your phones speaker while your using it (or for the cord if your using headphones).  Also, there is plastic on the inside lenses, make sure you take it off.  I think these are great for the price and really fun to play with.  Sample provided at a discount in exchange for an honest review, all opinions are my own.

My dog (a yellow lab) has really bad skin allergies in the summer time.  It was so bad the first year he had to go on steroids and his skin was bright red and he scratched himself constantly.  The vet gave me this shampoo and told me to bathe him often.  She told me to lather him up and then leave it on about 30 minutes before rinsing.  It helped tremendously.Now that I know he has allergies, I bathe him frequently with this shampoo to help keep his skin under control.  He does still scratch but it is much more manageable and we have not had to go back to the vet.  This is much cheaper on Amazon than at the vet's office.  I also use the Davis Dog and Cat Chlorhexidine Spray, 4 Percent, 8-Ounce in between baths.Another huge plus is that this is the only shampoo that makes my dog smell good.  I have tried countless shampoos and he is always left smelling like wet dog.  I was shocked the first time I used this because he actually smelled fresh and his fur felt really soft.

The myclip is very easy to install.  You just snap it on and your done.  Immediately I was able to brew with my re-usable k cup in my Keurig 2.0 K250 model.  I held off on buying a 2.0 brewer for awhile because I hated that you could not brew ANY k cup but now finally I can.I would like to also mention that I had an issue and had to contact the seller and they responded quickly and professionally.  They were more than friendly and accommodating.  So not only is this a 5 star product, they are also a 5 star seller!  Great product!  I received the MyClip at a discount in exchange for an honest review, all opinions are my own.

I love this shirt!  It is very soft without being super thin.  I think it's perfect.  The stitching is all well done and the logo looks great. It has the vintage look and feel.  It was a little darker green than in the picture but it still looks great.Personally I do not think it runs small.  I went ahead and measured the shirt lying flat so you can get an idea of the size.  The size pictured is a Large.  It measured about 21 inches across and the arms measured about 7 1/2  inches across.  I would measure your favorite shirt the same way and then you will know if you should size up or not.  I received this shirt at a discount in exchange for an honest review, all opinions are my own.

This is 100% organic Ceylon cinnamon. It comes in a resealable bag and contains 4.23 oz.  It is very high quality and you can tell by the taste and aroma. Most cinnamon sold in the United States is the cassia variety. Ceylon cinnamon has a sweeter, more delicate flavor than cassia.  Ceylon is also a healthier choice.  It also contains antioxidants and less of the blood thinning chemical Coumarin.  If you use cinnamon often you should definitely be using Ceylon, and this one is highly recommended.  Sample provided in exchange for honest review.

This is one of the best turmeric powders I have tried!  It comes in a large resealable bag and contains 4.23 oz.  It is an amazing spice and so healthy for you.  I use it mostly in cooking and it can be added to many dishes (not just curry) including rice, veggies, scrambled eggs, soups, and you can even add it to smoothies!  A really good salad dressing is olive oil, lemon juice, turmeric, and salt + pepper.Another cool thing is you can give it to dogs.  A small amount added to their food has been shown to ward off cancer and other diseases. Make sure to consult a vet to make sure it's right for you of course. Highly recommend Kazu!  Sample provided in exchange for an honest review.

This ginger powder comes in a large resealable bag and contains 4.23oz.  It is certified organic and the taste and aroma are excellent.  It is water soluble so it can be mixed readily in juices, teas, coffee, and water.  Ginger is sooo good for you and one of the world's most healthiest foods.  It is great for losing weight because it makes you feel full. Highly recommend this ginger root powder.  Sample provided in exchange for an honest review.

Rejoice, Hermes Press has released another volume of Frank Robbins' Masterpiece Johnny Hazard.  This volume collects four serialized stories starting in May 1949 and going through January 1951.Johnny Hazard is a globe hopping pilot who's adventures are very much in the mode Terry and The Pirates and Steve Canyon. Hazard actually predated Steve Canyon by three years.Frank Robbins style is from the same school as Noel Sickles and Milton Caniff.  He is a little known master who deserves much more attention.This volume is 304 pages in landscape format with two daily strips to a page.  The paper is heavy glossy stock with sharp black printing.  While I found an occasional partial letter missing from a word balloon it is very good reproduction.The page size is smaller then your average strip collection.  But as some have pointed out , the strips are actually the same size as in The Phantom and Buck Rogers collections.  You are just missing lots of white space.  This was done by Hermes Press to make the books in the same price range as the other collections even though they have a reduced demand."Grob and Shah Sharik" is the opening epic in this collection.  This story runs about 200 daily strips or nine months. It starts in China and ends in the Middle East.  It introduces a trio of new villains. Grob the portly leader, Slink his Fez wearing right hand man and the Beautiful American Feme Fatale Velvet.Johnny gets mixed up with this trio and their plans to sell planes to Shah Sharik. In the end Velvet ends up helping Johnny and they end up stranded in the desert.Here the pair meet "Ventro The Great" for a much smaller 80 strip story.  The story involves a Ventriloquist and bandit raiders.The third story "Passport To Paradise" is a taunt 160 strip spy thriller taking place on the road to Burma.  Paradise it turns out is a beautiful Asian woman who cleverly disguises herself at first meeting. Velvet departs at the end of this adventure.The final 80 strip story "Sadie, The System" features Johnny and Paradise trying to protect a million dollars in raw diamonds from a pair of European Thiefs.Hermes Press has now completed a little over six years of Daily Comic Strips in Four Volumes.  Since Robbins run was over 30 years their is much more to come including the Sunday's.Hermes Press is a very small publisher so your support is greatly needed if you want to see future volumes. Don't wait to purchase this and the previous volumes.  Robbins stuff deserves to be in print.My Highest Recommendation.

Just to correct and clarify one of the other erroneous reviews on Amazon, this is not a Hap & Leonard novel or part of that series.  The only thing it shares with those books is the author and a rural setting.This novel is a stand alone novel about a plucky young girl,  seventeen year old Dot Sherman.  Dot works as roller skating car hop for local Dairy Queen knock off , The Dairy Bob.Dot has to come to terms with a few issues like abandonment and rage.  She longs to break out of her Trailer Park life and find a better life.But along the way she must solve a few mysteries.  Why did her father leave one day to get cigarettes and never return ?
