I downloaded this hoping to entertain my younger siblings but after a few minutes they were no longer satisfied. I played it for a bit to see what was wrong and why they didn't like it. It was a very simple and repetitious game that I think would be great for the younger age bracket.
My husband downloaded this game because he wanted to show me how to play it! Needless to say we both stayed up way too late playing this game because once you start you get addicted!

I read this book in less than a day and was so excited to start the next one after reading the teaser chapter! I enjoyed the characters and really felt a connection with the main character! I hope he writes more in this series!

I stumbled on the first few books of this series by accident and I am so glad I did! I have read every one of them and Have been waiting for him to write more! I read each one of these books in about a day because I just couldn't put them down!!

My only regret with this product is that I didn't order more!! I looked around town and could not find any ink for my printer that didn't cost an arm and a leg, so I was going to donate it to goodwill until I found this! I have used this ink for almost a year and just ran out. I have to print tons of paperwork and classwork for school and I have had no problems with any of these cartridges, Will definitely be buying more to stockpile next time!

My husband bought this as a wedding gift for me! I have enjoyed every minute that I've had it! I have more than 100 books downloaded on it and tons of apps for him to play so he can enjoy it too! I love how small it is and I am so glad he opted for the bigger memory, because I can definitely use it! The screen is of good quality and I think I enjoy it more than I do the iPad mini we have!

I have always loved Nora Roberts and all of her J.D. Robb books. When I stumbled upon this one I knew I had to read it! There was just enough suspense and mystery to keep me on the edge of my seat until the end! Great read!!

I have read all of the books in this series and enjoyed every page of them! I finished this one in just under a day because I couldn't put it down! I enjoyed it so much I made my mom buy them and we started a book chain among our friends! This is a great Christian Romance for any and all ages!

I downloaded this hoping it would be something to make my 15 hour car ride pass faster. Once I started playing, I couldn't put it down! I played the whole game in just over 3 days!! Definitely fun to play!

Picked this up for my nephew that was just born a few months ago, and it seems to calm him down. The tune is nice, the controls are easy, and there's a bit of joy found within this mobile. It's easy to set up and turn on, and he really seems to enjoy the way that the characters move a bit, and the song plays on. It's durable, well built, connects to the crib nicely, and plays a little whimsical tune. I love it. It's highly recommended.

I picked this up for my nephew, he's a huge La Parka fan, and fell in love with this costume. For those not of the wrestling fan variety, this is a full skeleton costume and covers pretty much everything. What makes it stand out is the blinking lights on the chest as an added bonus. I love it. Now, as for fit, it fits good overall, a little loose, but this is not a "tailored" suit you know. It's a good costume, with great details, and cool blinking lights. get it just for the lights if not for the skeletal nuances. This is a great costume! Thanks!

I bought this looking for a skateboarding segment that I recall from MTV Sports. This didn't have it. However, it did have some cool segments from the long lost MTV Sports world. Only 2 stars because it didn't have the skateboarding segment which was a special. I really loved that original segment because it featured skateboarders in the midwest, skating an old refrigerator in a barn. It also featured music from Pennywise, and MXPX, which was awesome. Either way, this wasn't it. It's cool, but it's not the same, 2 stars only.

For luck, or for pride, this is a great find. It not only looks visually appealing, it has a lot of meaning within Japanese culture. I picked one up for visual design flow on my patio, and it's really cool when the wind picks up. It flows with the wind and really showcases a great overall design appeal. It's well made, easy to hang up, and really comes into life when the wind picks up. I highly recommend this. Whether you want a bit of luck or you just want something decorative for your porch or patio. I love it.

Picked this up for my nephew and he was so excited. He's already wearing it from time to time getting ready for Halloween. This is a perfect fitting Spongebob Costume, and it allows for free mobility, and easy cleaning. It's well made, easy to put on, and allows for visibility and more. Overall, it's a good costume, and definitely recommended for all children that want to go trick or treating as Spongebob Squarepants. Great buy!

I’ve never seen one of these options before, but after getting hurt skateboarding, someone said I should try this out. It’s like an airplane neck pillow, only it allows for a bit of air and pressure to help with neck. I was impressed with how it can help adjust your neck, and how comfortable it is to have. It helped my neck, but also relieved tension headaches and orbital pain I had in my eyes. It’s a really interesting neck reliever. Just try it, you’ll be surprised how this little thing can really help you get a semblance of relief.

This little book has really helped in the kitchen. It was so good that I bought it twice. The problem that I have is the size and the amount of pictures in the book. It's a little book of great recipes, and while I enjoyed it, it just needs more pictures. Some of the things you have to see in order to really get the full view of what you're making. Others you don't need a picture, so the selection is a bit odd to me. However, the recipes are great, the tastes and flavors really remind me of home. I like it. It's small, to the point, and features great food.

I have a nagging knee injury from when playing varsity sports 15 years ago. Doctors said I didn’t need knee surgery, but the ongoing stress of running has really played havoc on my knees. I was recommended this type of adjustable brace and was skeptical at first. This is an easy to apply brace, you simply adjust the fitting and move a bit before you run. I can truly say it’s great, it helps ease the burden on the knee, and it is not bulky or obtrusive. I tried other options that slipped or were too large for my knees. This is a great fitting, adjustable option and really does help with knee support. It’s well made, durable, and has increased my flexibility a bit. It’s highly recommended, and has kept me running.

It's ok. I liked a few tracks, but one thing that has plagued Coheed on disc is the volume and layers of their music. I saw them live and it was amazing. Their records, however, seem very low in production, and it just doesn't have that boom that rock needs. Over time I found myself liking Rush more, even though they are older. The first record from Coheed was great, the sound design was good, but this one, not so much.

I've been testing out various training collars, and as I keep testing different things with different dogs, I've found this one to be a great choice. The main thing is the balance between warning and shock. I haven't needed to use the upper levels, but just a gentle reminder works great. I love this option for training over muzzles, as it really reinforces the training commands. I like the adjustable collar, the different levels of control, and build. It's sturdy, easy to use, and doesn't really shock too hard in the early stages. It's just enough to teach. I love it. I recommend this option for sure.

My doctor recommended that I take a supplement to help ease my blood sugar spikes. I looked around and saw this option. It definitely has helped me out a great deal. I’m not diabetic, but I do have some issues here and there. This has been able to reverse some of the issues I had with my blood testing. I was impressed with the changeover. The ingredients in this are all natural, and they all work together to deliver nutrients to assist with circulation. My doctor was impressed with how a little exercise, a diet change, and this supplement have completely changed my blood testing. I am grateful to have found this option as it really delivers a powerful blend for circulation and sugar management.

After some time looking this over and trying the recipes, alongside reading the pages, I realized that this was a vegan cookbook. The marketing and gimmick totally got me. But after some time, and tasting the food, I can truly say that this is NOT as great as I originally thought. I've tried a LOT of vegan cookbooks but this one just didn't deliver on the flavors after some time. Some recipes weren't filling, and the use of certain obscure spices killed the pocket book. I adapted some to fit my own needs, but overall, this is a lot of gimmick.If you aren't fully aware, you may get caught up in the "cool" factor. If you're a meat eater, you'll be sorely disappointed. Cool way to present vegan cooking aside, this is NOT going to be grand for some more "traditional" eaters. Sorry, 3 out of 5.

My office has several terriers running around, and I’m always trying to get them to be quiet. I have used other means in the past, but finally settled on this option. I loved that this was not only humane, but that there were several adjustments. I was able to give my dogs a slight vibration and they have calmed down significantly. Even though they seem active and want to bark, they now know not to do so. It’s a fascinating update with no harm, warning, and vibration that has changed the complexion of my office.The warning tone is really interesting, as it quickly taught my dogs. They learned quickly, and are now quiet whenever I get deliveries at home. It took a little getting used to as there are a few settings to test out. However, if you’re looking to teach your dogs, this collar is great. It’s adjustable, there is a test light, it comes with a manual, and it really is a life saver, if you have a loud dog and want to train them properly.I received this product complimentary and all thoughts reflected in this review are solely my own.

The Scorch Trials is getting the movie treatment, but if you have read or are reading the book series (The Maze Runner), than you are going to love this. This is a total analysis of the book with carefully crafted elements from the chapters themselves. Each one is thoughtfully considered, questions are raised, themes are spoken about, and you really get a good guide here. It's not a summary straightway, instead, it's like a class discussion on the central plot devices, the characters, terms, and much more. Miriam Sokolow has done very well to create a companion to the book for those that have read it, or those that want to read it and have a running commentary as to what they are reading. I loved it. This is a great piece to the bigger puzzle of the series and books, and definitely comes recommended.

This little gem really fascinated me upon first hearing about it. It's a small glass indicator of CO2 detection in tanks. I have a few tanks, and my nephew does as well. We picked up a couple of these to test out CO2 levels, and to learn how to use this with some of our fish. I was impressed at how this works, and what it does. I am not an expert, but was able to denote PH levels thanks to this little element. It's small, but it is mighty, highly recommended. I love this drop checker, and have learned something new by picking it up.

I saw Up Syndrome play a backyard in Culver City. They broke up shortly after that, but they put on one of the best punk shows I've ever seen. I wish they never broke up. They should've been as big as New Found Glory. This record is their EP and it's amazing. It has some of their most well received songs, and it's a mix of pop, punk, and frenzied lyrical elements. You owe it to yourself to grab this one.

As far as breast pumps are concerned, most of them are not that good. This one is a life saver. I was able to get this for my sister and she swears by it. The fact that it's small, somewhat discreet, and absolutely quiet is what really sold her on it. Not only that, there are a lot of features that you can take advantage of here. There's also a massage element to this that helps with efficient pumping. The many adjustments are there for comfort, and really deliver on a lot of different levels. Compared to the options from the past, this is a truly unique, and innovative option. It's highly recommended for new moms. It's easy to use, comfortable, quiet, and has an abundance of features to take advantage of.

It's a fast paced game. But the review I have for it is not on the game. I bought this to play and the disc was way scratched, and unreadable. I ended up having to get a new copy because of it. It holds up well for me, but I'm a sucker for downhill brawling and action sports. It's pixelated, but it's fun, fast paced and well worth exploring.

As far as portable breast pumps are concerned, this may very well be the best in the business. It's small, discreet, and quiet. You will not find many other options that pack so much into a small package such as this. Bellema has found a way to create a comfortable portable electric pump with many features attached to it. I gave this to my sister and she raves about how simple it is. The fact that you can take this with you wherever you go and not have to deal with the noise or discomfort that other options bring is definitely interesting. Belllema once again delivers with a feature rich solution.

It's my fault for not measuring things. I thought it was bigger. I also thought the paper quality was going to be a bit better. It's printed on light magazine stock or something that is just flimsy. It works for what it is, but it's no way a 5 star solution. I liked it enough, but just can't bring myself to give it 5 stars. If it were bigger or if it perhaps had better quality paper stock.

A solid bracelet, that looks really cool once you put it on your wrist. I gave it to my wife and she likes the aesthetics of it. It's unique, easy fitting, and definitely worth investing into. It's a no-nonsense, strong, metallic bracelet, very well made.

This is my second Wahl that I have purchased, and it's solid. This helps me shave my head without going to the barber. I admit, I've gotten a lot better in my old age, so I don't know how beginners will do with this. It comes with a lot of accessories, but I only use 1 of them. I like it overall, the price is right and definitely solid. However, I don't see it lasting more than 6 months to a year with heavy use, so 4 stars is all I can give it.

I have read many a book on treating different ailments, but I haven't seen one quite as good as Jim Johnson's here. The book is set up in clear language, without going into a medical textbook of explanation. There are a lot of images, lots of visual references to the content, and that is what I loved about this book. It not only addresses the issue of pain, it talks about what is actually going on. You may find that there are elements that you are not seeing, from the calf, to the knee, to how you're walking and stepping. You can go through the pages and adjust, and in the end, get a bit of healing. Instead of masking things with a pain reliever, the book focuses on the root issue of inflammation, pain, and more.As far as narrative, this is straight forward, easy to read, and definitely a positive approach to getting relief from tendinitis. I never knew there were so many components to the issue. I always figured it was just isolated to the back of the leg and ankle. That's not the case, as you'll find out in this informative book. I highly recommend it to anyone that is an athlete, skateboarder (like me), or just trying to get fit, but is dealing with pain and stress along the Achilles tendon.

This light system is amazing. It's easy to use, it's relaxing, calming, and completely changed bed time. My nephew loves it when he comes over, and it's truly amazing for kids. You can plug in your mp3 player to it with ease, and the music goes with the light show! I love the colors that transition, and how the colors move through the musical notes. It's just amazing.The waves touch you and make it surreal and ethereal when it's bed time.

I’ve had a lot of phones, and like many people, I have seen my phone scratches, scraped and broken. I tried others, but this one has proved to be absolutely grand. Vanguard Cases makes a thin protector that has resisted cracking, and scraping. Even when my nephew threw my iPhone down a hallway, nothing happened. Combined with a good case, this is by far a superior upgrade to your traditional screen protector. It’s easy to install, easy to use, and is just grand. I love it. It’s been a life saver on many occasions, as my iPhone 5 feels like a bar of soap sometimes, always slipping my grasp.

I’ve seen a lot of cases come and go promising greatness. But I have to admit, this is the one that has proven time and time again that it’s a rock solid peripheral. I got an iPhone recently, and went through six cases before landing on this one. Upon putting it on, I accidentally dropped my phone while getting out of a car. I panicked, and realized this case was on, and it is strong. I’ve dropped it, and my nephew threw it across a hallway, and still nothing has cracked, broke, or scratched the iPhone. This is a surprising, lightweight, strong case, with everything you could want. It could save your life, put it in your front pocket and you could possibly take a punch from a boxer and the phone would still be protected. It’s a high quality, case, highly recommended.

I loved the cover on this book, and so I had to dive in. Erez Aharoni has found a way to really hit you hard upon reading. As you read, you will be hit fast with a strong emotional connection to the main character. Ofer Angel is a fascinating character, and as you are given more and more pieces to their life, you start to absolutely speed through a fast paced thrill ride. This is like an action movie come to life, but with a heart and emotional connection of what you’d get in a serious drama. Aharoni has found a way to mix genres and allow you to take hold of the beauty of life amidst chaos.

This is an incredible read. I loved it. Hillel Lerman illustrates a story about what happens when you make assumptions about people. He discusses a story of mistaken identity, or rather, what happens when you assume something about individuals, when in reality, there is a lot of the same. The university professor and the custodial worker, on the same level? That’s what Lerman illustrates, and he does so with quick wit, and easy reading. I found myself thinking a lot about how life sometimes pushes us to disorder. Overall, this is a solid read, a good mirror to our humanity, and a philosophical framework about ourselves and how we view others.

I was floored by this sidekick to the novel “Follow You Home”.  The detail in which this companion piece comes through with is impressive. You get a quick summary, but more so, you are given insight, questions, ideas, motives, hidden elements, messages, and much more. You are treated to an analysis and thoughtful presentation about the book, and so much more. This is like a “book club” discussion piece, and it’s been carefully written. Elizabeth Halprin has found a way to connect with what a reader must be thinking to themselves. It’s a brilliant idea, and executed well enough. I found myself rethinking the novel, and really dwelling on some of the themes that I didn’t really catch the first time. I would highly recommend this, if you are a reader, and want more in depth thoughts on the book. A fine sidekick, that’s for sure.

These have added a vibrancy to my tank and the tank of my nephew that I had to talk about them. These are live, beautiful little things. Tied correctly, and in a good clean tank, this becomes a nice backdrop for your fish. I was able to get these in place and they really give the tanks a little bit of a “natural” boost. They are free flowing and wave a bit, and showcase a good sense of vegetation. The fish seem to like them too, nibbling here and there or at least tasting, I’m not sure. It’s important that your tank is clean, and these are tied properly to get the best effect. I love them, and my nephew was surprised by how green they stay. They are a different shade of green than I’m used to, but make the tank look so much cooler.

I recently went on a camping trip for a few days in the forest, and this was a life saver. Through a thunder storm no less, this kept me dry, and with minimal blankets, I made it through. This is a good waterproof tent, and it’s easy to set up. If you’re an adventure seeker, this is a great thing to have with you. It’s sturdy, easy to put up, water proof, and definitely a great solution, when set up correctly. I loved it. I’ll be using it soon for another trip moving forward. It comes with everything you need, and fits up to 3 people, I went solo, but it’s a good size. Highly recommended if you’re camping.

This is a very unique set piece. It is surprisingly detailed, and lighter than I thought. It's an interesting take on antiquity. It's really just made for design complements and nothing more. I like it, it's a very unique set piece for sure. If you want to liven up your home, this is a cool phone to add to it. Recommended indeed.

I absolutely love this oil. Lavender oil is great for so many different uses. I was able to use this to assist with aromatherapy, to calm my nerves. But I've also used it with epsom salt to help my feet and joints. I love the smell of this oil, and the amazing properties it brings. This is a 100% natural solution, and smells amazing. Just a few drops will give you compelling elements. I highly recommend this option, as it is natural, helps ease nerves, and helps with inflammation and paint if combined with things like epsom salt. I love it, and recommend it greatly. I received this item at a discounted rate in exchange for an honest review

It works. That's what I can say about this. It replaced my logitech keyboard that started to fall apart after 4 months. This is a good basic keyboard. It's not meant for serious writers, or typists. I will end up replacing this for a mechanical one next. It's good for light work, and possibly those that are surfing the internet. But this is not work horse, that's for sure.

I've never read something quite as fascinating in real life as this one. I say real life, because I know people that have squatted, dumpster dived, and have escaped the tyranny of paying rent. This is a fabulous look into that, and it's an easy to read guide about something that is very interesting. It's a guide, but not a dictionary volume of sorts. The book is written with the beginner in mind, and it flows through various areas of how it might be to squat, in empty homes, apartment complexes, and much more. It's truly something that will make you think about possibly jumping into this world. If I were single, I'd do it. But that's just me. If you're curious about squatting or living under the radar in general, this is a guide to get you started. Solid writing, easy to pick up and follow, this is a good book.

Not since I first read "Freakanomics" has a book shined light on so much. This is a book of connections in the modern age, and it's fascinating to see how it all works out. You're going to be enthralled with the connections that Dr. Dov Yanai puts together. Just when you think you know the connections of modern times, you get a new glimpse into the present, and the future. This is a far more cerebral book than a novel, it's very to the point and scientific. It's easy to read, but hard to wrestle with at times as the connections made between the intelligence, science, math, and more are prominent here. I liked it. It's a heavy book that's for sure.

As far as romances are concerned, I am not always up on series that capture the imagination. However, Waves of Desire has been one of those that keep me coming back for more. The breezy nature aside, there is a lot of characterization found throughout the book. It’s a bit of romance, but not so much that you lose the plot points, or narrative. This is a hot book, but it’s part of a larger series that really is compelling to denote. If you’re a fan of romance, here’s another shot in the proverbial arm. I recommend it.

I’ve been utilizing all sorts of little elements for my fish tank, and that of my nephew’s tank. This is my latest option and it works like a charm. Mind you, it does take time to grow, as ferns don’t just spring up and end up like a garden. This takes time, and even though there’s browning on the leaves when you first get them, in time the spores and fern elements grow. It takes time. I know that some people want immediate results, but that’s not how these little guys grow. It takes time, and as you watch your tank, and continue to work with the right elements, tying these down and keeping them in good water, you’ll see them shift. I was impressed at how these little ferns create lively green through the tank. Done right, these are beautiful, but again, you have to have them tied down, and you need to be patient. They are green, living things, and in the fern family. I love them, and my nephew enjoys seeing the fish pass by these. Highly recommended.

Finesonic has completely blown me away with these headphones. They isolate sound, have deep bass, and are wireless. I tested them out in outdoor noise, in my office, and throughout my building with my iPhone and was amazed at how light they are, how powerful the sound is, and how this all works out. I can't recommend these higher. They are easy to use, come with an interchangeable ear bud, and fit comfortably without slipping. I'm going to be testing them in the gym, but so far I am impressed with the construction, the connectivity, and price tag. These are a serious audiophile set of headphones and work wonders with Bluetooth connectivity. Sound wise, they are great, the build is solid, and even the box is very unique and simple. These are high quality all the way, no doubt.

It's adequate. What can I say? It works for the most part, but don't get too caught up with this going fast. It's average at best. It works, but it seems to take on a long time to charge. I will recommend it if you absolutely don't have anything to charge your phone with. It will work, and that's why it's 3 stars, but don't expect any frills.

I have tested and reviewed a few running belts in the last few months and this one is right up there with the best of them. It has a wide, elastic belt and heavy-duty latches, and the material is soft and comfortable. It has a very simple pocket arrangement (there are two zippered pockets) that are lined with a rubberized and I assume waterproof coating. If you wash this belt in the washing machine a lot, there's a chance this coating could start to degrade. I say a chance because it's inside and protected. That's a good thing, I think. My experience with this type of coating is as follows: When it dries out and/or is exposed to the sun, it cracks. When it cracks, it begins to flake. So having it on the inside is way better than having it on the outside. If you buy this running belt -- and I don't think you will be disappointed if you do -- try to not carry chap stick, sun tan oil, or any lotion or creme that might be incompatible with the rubber coating. If you carry your car keys or anything with a semi-sharp edge, maybe insulate them in a baggy first. The more you take steps to protect the inside coating the longer this belt lasts.The only thing I will say negative about this belt (and it's not really a negative) is that it's not particularly manly. It has stitched filagree on the outside with a somewhat feminine touch to it. You can see it in the product photo.For the record, I received this item in exchange for an honest review.

This is a very high quality stainless steel splatter screen. It comes with a removable silicone handle (you can see it in the picture) that you can use or not use as you see fit.What a great idea NOT to have a heat resistant rubber or plastic handle permanently affixed to the splatter screen. Most of the kitchen pots and pans I have end up being thrown out for one of two reasons, either the non-stick coating starts to degrade, or the heat resistant insulated handle goes. The manufacturer could have very easily clamped a plastic handle on this, or glued something on it. Instead, they left it simple and clean. I took this out of the box and immediately wanted a hanger over my stove to hang it on.Screen fits easily into a standard size dishwasher.Put it on top of a pot of boiling water and steam hot dog or dinner rolls.Full disclosure: I received this product in exchange for an honest review, and for the record, I'm very happy with it. I love to cook and this is one of those items that makes high temperature cooking on the stove less of a chore.

Nicely packaged. Make a nice gift. Mine arrived fully charged. Includes stereo ear buds, USB cord, headphone/microphone, manual, and a landline phone and stereo mini plug adapter for recording directly from a landline.Controls are completely intuitive. To record, slide the record button to the rec position, to save what you recorded, slide the record button to the off (marked "save") position. A single menu button will scroll you through the two categories of saved files, downloaded MP3s and files recorded directly with and onto the recorder.The top three buttons are, Prev, Menu, and Next, left to right, in that order. You use these to navigate through your saved files. In playback mode, you use the bottom two buttons -- Stop/Del and Play/Pause -- as you would on any recorder. You also use these to delete files.To delete, hold the stop button down on a selected file. You'll get a delete menu. Choices are Delete, No, Yes, Delete all. Use the Next button to select and the Menu button to erase. There is no "Are You Sure" warning, so if you have a lot of files, I think you're better off doing this on your computer.The recorder connects to the computer like any hard drive. In fact, it connects automatically. You don't even have to turn it on. As soon as you plug in the USB, the recorder comes on and initiates handshaking. The device will show up on screen like any hard drive. Click to open and it will be obvious which files are where.When you plug it into the computer, it auto-connects to the computer. If you hit the menu button on the recorder while the recorder icon is still visible on your screen, you will switch into recorder mode and essentially disconnect from the computer without having ejected the disk first. This could cause you to lose data. Remember, when connected to a computer, you are automatically placed in hard disk mode. Eject first, then disconnect.As a test of the audio quality, I recorder a song being played on my computer. I used the recorder's internal microphone. I thought the recorder did an excellent job reproducing the quality of the audio in terms of separating the various instruments and sounds. I had a heater/fan running in the room at the time, and the recorder picked it up as an ambient background static. At first I didn't even know what it was, just this white noise in the B.G. Turns out it was the heater fan.This is an impressive piece of audio gear for the price. I'm very happy it was offered in exchange for a review. For the record, the seller asked for no special favors, just an honest review. Speaking honestly, it's a very good, solidly built recorder. I plan on using it quite a bit.

Ultra-soft? They're not kidding. I was shocked at how soft these were when I took them out of their bag. Who knew? Bamboo fiber. I would have never guessed you could make cloth this soft from bamboo; actually, it's 70/30 bamboo/cotton. But still. The wife and granddaughter are very fond of these washcloths. We put them through a wash cycle with a load of laundry. A little shedding but not bad, mostly in the yellow one, and a few loose threads poking out from under the edge stitching, easily corrected in two seconds with a pair of scissors.(The photo I took is of three of the four clothes after taking them out of the washing machine. They're still wet.)As you may know, bamboo is one of the fastest growing plants on the planet. It has the added value of being regenerative, meaning, you don't have to seed anything. You just got the stalk down (in fact it is a grass) and a new one will sprout. It's a very important global natural resource and a key component in forest restoration and resource management.Go ahead, help save the planet. Buy all natural and enjoy a soft washcloth at the same time.For the record, I received these in exchange for an honest and objective review.

NIce pair of magnetic ear buds. Comfortable.Pros: Excellent audio reproduction. Very good Bluetooth range - about 35' from source, at my house, inside and through walls -- might even go farther. Older-style device controller situated on connecting wire instead of earpiece, which is better for people with big fingers and people who are driving. Charges quickly. Bright indicator lights. Comes with spare rubber buds, instruction manual, and USB cable. Simple brown box packaging.Cons: Not compatible with Mac OS 10.6.8. Took a few button pushes on and off to get it into discovery mode. Once in discovery, connected right away. On the large size.I received these in exchange for an honest review

I have several OOSILK products and all of them have been of high quality and have come in attractive packaging suitable for gift giving. This is my second pillowcase OOSILK. The first one I received was silk on one side and 100% cotton on the other. This was to keep the pillow from sliding around on the sheet, which is fine for people who sleep soundly or sleep without shifting or flipping their pillows over. Some people complained about this because when they flipped the pillow over they were suddenly sleeping on the cotton side. This was never a problem for me because I'm not a pillow flipper but more of a pillow bunch'r'upper. What can I say? Everybody has their own technique.Anyway, same fine quality silk is used in this pillow case as is used in all other OOSILK products. For the money, it's a good deal.The only down side for me, is the washing part. They say it can be machine washed with other silk items, but we don't have any other silk items so that means hand washing our pillowcases in the sink. They're not suppose to be squeezed, either, and that means drying them on a rack or shower rod. It's time consuming and tedious. Totally worth it if you want to sleep like a princess.Note#: I received this in exchange for an honest review, and in all honesty, I like the pillowcase very much.

My wife took this out of the bag, put it on, and left the house. That's a pretty good endorsement. It's delicate, and we both agree it's definitely gift worthy. That said, I would not put it in the "winter storm gear" category. Too delicate for that, which is part of its charm. The picture on the product page is kind of fuzzy, so bear in mind, this is not a tightly knit scarf, which is why it's more of a fall accouterment than heavy weather protection.Note#: I received this at discount in exchange for an honest review.

This is the third sleep mask I received as a gift or at discount in exchange for an honest review. It's my personal favorite. It's also the hardest and most firm of the three, which is probably one of the reasons I like it and why some others won't. Maybe it's a vanity thing, but I'm a man, and I don't want to wear a sexy, silky smooth eye mask when I sleep. I don't want to wear feet-y pajamas, or a cowboy hat, or a silver kerchief. Anyway, this mask is moulded in such a way it leaves a cavity for each of your eyes. The space gives you room to open and close your eyes without your eyelashes and eyelids rubbing against the material and feeling trapped. The mask also has a small section that sits over the bridge of your nose; this helps keep the mask from sliding. No light leaks under the mask when I wear it.For the record, I'm an older man who normally doesn't wear a sleep mask. I prefer to sleep in pitch, black darkness. I wake up at the drop of a hat, and I toss and turn all night. I have a friend who sleeps with a mask and earplugs every night. He sleeps like a rock. No kidding, he once slept through a hurricane. I hate him.

This is my third OOSilk product. The first was their silk pillow case with the cotton back and the second was an all-silk pillow case. One thing you can count on with OOSilk is a quality product and packaging that looks great and is gift-ready right out of the box. They really go above and beyond with packaging, and I don't mean ostentatious or overly wasteful, either.About sleep masks. I don't really use them, but I have three, and each one is different. One has a nosepiece. One has a contoured/moulded shape that provides spaces for your eyes, and one (the OOSilk one) is ultra soft.Here's what you need to decide. For me, the nosepiece really doesn't work. It lets light in, and not all noses are the same (obviously), so the fit isn't perfect. The contoured or moulded design is nice. It fits snugly and comfortably. As a man, I think I prefer the harder, snug fit. But the OOSilk mask...it's really, really, really soft. I mean, it's what you think of when you think of a sleep mask. It's what the actresses wore in all those old movies. I think I remember Kathryn Hepburn wearing one in the movie, Bringing Up Baby.So, if you want to feel like an aristocrat, or a famous celeb from the fifties, this is the mask for you. If you're a man, and you want to add a little something to your love life, get her this for Christmas and see what develops. The packaging alone is pretty sexy.Oh, I almost forgot...I received this at discount in exchange for an honest review.

This is a terrific scale. It's so simple, and it comes battery included. I have three digital scales. The others were gifts. One came with a drink maker, the other came as part of a cooking kit. This one is better constructed than the other two.I received this at discount in exchange for a review, but I assure you this has not swayed my opinion in any way. It's a nice scale.As far as value is concerned, I can't say for sure. Prices on Amazon change, and I'm sure you can pay less or more depending on quality. At $18.99, the current price, I think it's a fair deal for a digital scale.Accuracy:Generally speaking, quality instruments are calibrated and judged on accuracy in term of plus or minus some percentage error. You see this all the time. Plus or minus X, where X is the unit of measurement.In the first photo below, you will see the scale turned ON and in STANDBY mode, with three antique measuring weights lined up behind it. The first weight is marked 1/2 OZ, the second 2 OZ, and the third 4OZ. The 1/2 OZ weight measured 0.6 OZ on the scale, while the 2 OZ weight and the 4 OZ weight measured exactly 2.0 and 4.0 Ounces, respectively.If the scale was off and truly measuring the 1/2 OZ weight as 0.6 OZ, then the other two weights would have measured 2.4 OZ and 4.8 OZ respectively.Conclusion: Scale is dead on and the small weight listed as weighing 1/2 OZ really weighs 0.6 OZ.5-stars.

I purchased this light when I backed into the page by accident. I liked the look of it and could not believe the price -- $1.58 at the time. You find these in boxes at the counter of hardware and auto parts stores all the time, usually for under $5.00. When this one came in the mail it was everything I thought it would be. Tough little light with a tough belt clip. I've dropped it a few times and no problems. Has a spot/flood adjustment on it. Uses a single AA battery.

Very nice, well designed, solidly built "smart" 5-Volt wall charger pumping out a maximum of 2.4 Amp per USB port, making it perfect for tablets, IPads and other devices capable of pulling a 2.4 Amp charge. I've been using it for my older Android phone pulling 1.0 Amps in addition to using it for an IPad and a bunch of bluetooth devices. It seems to charge things very quickly.Charger carries the CE mark.My phone has a full charging light that indicates full charge. When I use the charger that came with it, or another 1.0 Amp charger, the full charge indicator will come on telling me the phone has reached full charge. When I use this charger, or anything more than a 1.0 Amp charger, this light will not come on, leading me to believe that the higher amp chargers are shutting off before the phone reaches 100%.It's not a problem using the higher amp chargers, because -- if you don't already know -- the device is pulling the charge and not having it pushed into it by the charger.On the other side of the coin, I do not advise trying to pull a 2.4 Amp charge out of the 1.0 Amp USB port on your old laptop.Note#: I received this as a gift in exchange for an honest review.

1:43 Mins So...you'll find lots of super positive and quite a few scorching negative reviews for this toy here on Amazon. I got it at a discount in exchange for an honest review, and I just now finished playing with it for about ten minutes. Here's my honest take on it.This thing come packaged quite securely, so take your time getting it out of the box. There's even a backing screw that holds the controller into the box, but not to worry, the toy comes with a mini-screwdriver. It also comes with spare main rotor blades and a spare tail rotor. There's a charging cable in the box that allows you to charge from a USB port. You can also charge from the controller, but I wouldn't advice that as it will just use up your AA batteries. The charging cable has two plugs, one to charge the battery directly, and one to charge the dragonfly via the input port on the bottom.OK, worst thing about this toy -- the instructions. Wow, these instructions take the English language to a whole new level. I can usually figure out what the intent of the sentence is supposed to be but these were a challenge even for me. I did figure them out though, and my effort will save you many minutes of scratching your head, unless you already know what an "eternal light" is.First thing you're going to want to do is charge the dragonfly. Best way to do this is to open the battery compartment in the bottom of the bug and take out the battery. (See picture in instructions). Slide the battery and its wires out together. Don't worry. It's pretty ruggedly attached. Now that you have it out of the bug, disconnect the male and female plugs of the battery. Use the USB charging cable, either through your computer or a USB wall charger, to connect the matching plug to the plug wire coming off the battery. If a light comes on in the USB plug on your computer or wall adapter, ignore it. It will go out soon enough. If it doesn't go out in five minutes, then the dragonfly is charged. If it goes out, wait for it to come on again. When it comes on again, the dragonfly is charged.If you use the socket in the bottom of the dragonfly to charge instead of going directly to the battery, it's not as easy to figure out when it's charged or even if it's charging. My "eternal light" never came on. In fact I renamed it the infernal light.Now that it's charged, it time to load the batteries into the controller. It takes six double As.As soon as you turn on the power switch on the belly of the dragonfly, the wings will flap (see video), but don't try to fly the thing wih the wings flapping. That's just wild, crazy, hot dog pilot stuff, and you ain't ready for it. No, seriously, I don't think it will fly with the wings flapping. Physics doesn't seem right. So, turn the flapping wings off with the button on the top-right of the controller.Now, to get the thing to fly, you need a lot of throttle (left toggle control) to get airborne. Use the trimmer knob to get the dragonfly to hover without spinning. This is important, because, you won't be able to maneuver if you can't control the spin.In case you're wondering, it doesn't work like a real helicopter or a real dragonfly. You have to spin the chopper and get it to face the direction you want to fly in, front or back. The tail rotor controls the front and back direction of flight. Don't worry if you don't see it spinning. It only spins when you want to go in forward or reverse.According to the directions, you only get 6-8 minutes of flying time on a single charge. That's not that much. If you happen to be airborne when it loses charge, guess what? Yup, you're going to crash.I got this thing flying in about 30 seconds. I crashed it into a ficus, a wall, and a few other things. It didn't break. Came back and flew just fine. (See video for proof.) Some people complained of sharp edges. Mine had no sharp edges. Some people complained of a backwards on/off switch. Mine is not backwards.It's fun, and it's funny looking. Too bad it won't fly for longer on a single charge. By the way, no brainer, but if you turn off the eye lights and the flapping wings, you'll get longer flying times.I'm not sure how easy it is for a kid under twelve to figure out. You'll need to have some supervision there, especially in the set-up and charging phase.

0:38 Mins If you do any kind of work or recreating in the dark or in places that are badly lighted, where you also need to use your hands to take something apart or put it together, then you absolutely, positively need one of these. I have owned several over the years. Some are way to heavy and, after awhile, won't stay on your head. Some are heavy enough that when you're standing upright, and you're trying to look at something straight ahead of you, the light always sort of points down. Some only have the one horizontal head strap, which isn't enough. Some don't provide enough light. Some provide enough light but don't give you any spot/flood option.The Wolverine LED has a spot/flood adjustment in addition to a straight ahead-to down-angle adjustment. It also has a flashing light option. I'm not sure how useful this flasher is as a utility, but I suppose you can use it to warn someone, say if your car breaks down on the road, or you can maybe use it on a bicycle - wear it backwards on your head and ride your bicycle at night with it in flashing mode.I like this light. It's ten times better than the ones I bought five years ago.Full disclosure: I received this item in exchange for an honest review.

I received these in exchange for an honest review. This will be quick as they are what they are: simple USB wall chargers.1. There is no USB cable included2. They are not stamped with UL or any other American safety test certificated stamp.3. I tested all four that came in my pack with a Samsung phone and a radio controlled toy. I had no negative experiences. All chargers tested OK. All chargers provided a 1.0 amp @ 5V output.4. All four of my chargers shut off when the device they were connected to was charged. (I know this because they heat up when charging and return to room temperature when off. Also, the RC toy has a full-charge light.)5. Both tabs on the plug are the same size, i.e. you don't have one wider and one narrower to establish polarity.6. Colors are bright.7. I did not have the issues described by other reviewers.I guarantee this review to be honest and fair.My experience: I got what I was told I'd get.

If you're looking for a sport backpack, consider this one. It's small, light, well made, and it folds up into its own self-contained storage bag. It's a very cool design. I'm kind of a backpack snob, from my days backpacking the AT, mostly through NH and Maine. I like things simple. Just give me a pack with zippered compartments and NOT a bunch of removable pouches, straps, and buckles that constantly have to be tightened. Anyway, in the old days (60s and 70s), when you wanted to take a long day hike away from base camp, you either used a smaller, relatively heavy and bulky day pack that took up a lot of room in your main pack, or you emptied your main back and used that. A few years ago, my wife bought me a backpacker pack from L.L. Bean. Whoever designed the L.L. Bean pack must have had attention deficit disorder or smoked a lot of weed. It has one big compartment, and all the other compartments are removable pouches added on separately and strapped to the main pack like its a possum or something. It's like a puzzle every time I go camping. The Hopsooken 30L is a mini-version of an old-style backpack. It has multiple internal zippered pockets and two water bottle pouches, one port and one starboard. Simple. The carrying handle is a bit unnecessary for such a small pack, and it could have used a belt strap. Other than that, it's just what I want in a day pack or sport pack. Darn near perfect if you ask me.For the record, I got this pack for free in exchange for an honest review.

This review is for the animated short based on the book. Just finished watching it with my soon to be 8 year old granddaughter. We both thoroughly enjoyed it - although maybe I did a little more than she, who, I'm guessing, is at the age where she prefers TV or movies with more dialogue and less narration. Anyway, it's a sweet story about a nice witch who accidentally cauldrons-up a dragon. The title has to do with the animal "hitchhikers" she can't seem to leave behind. There's a nice, subtle message about friendship and teamwork.Stylistically, it's like The Gruffalo.Scares? Maybe the dragon for the very youngest.

I can tell when the suspense in a show gets my granddaughter (almost 8) on the edge of her seat. She'll want to sit real close. I won't say she was actually scared watching this, but there are definitely action scenes in this movie where the outcome is uncertain. There are also quite a few heavy-handed confrontations between the Evil King and the Swan Princess. In most of these scenes, the king is trying to force his will upon the princess; essentially he's trying to subjugate or enslave her. These kind of scenes can be a bit unnerving for young children. My granddaughter's smart enough to know about happy endings and G-ratings, and going in, she knew there would be no reason to be fearful of the outcome. And yet, there she was, seated close, on the verge of being scared.She still loved the movie and would watch it again. (You know kids, they can watch the same movie twenty times, day after day.}Is this movie appropriate for young children? Should it be rated PG? Beats me. I don't know. But let's look at the story. An evil man asks a woman to marry her. She's in love with another and refuses. The evil man then puts a nasty curse on her and tries through various nefarious means to get her to marry him. When she continues to refuse, and after he locks her in a flooded dungeon, he cooks up a plan to destroy her chance at true love. When this plan fails, he tries to kill her -- and he almost succeeds. The fact is, this is Swan Lake, and Swan Lake was originally penned by Johann Karl August Musäus in the middle of the 18th century, later composed as a ballet by Tchaikovsky. It was never meant for children.In all fairness, I think it's OK. I just wouldn't sit young kids down in front of it and walk away.Meanwhile, Jack Palance, who is almost always terrific, doesn't quite work for me as the voice of the evil king. He plays it straight-up evil, and maybe a little too much so for a G-rated cartoon.

Great documentary for musicians and music lovers alike. It's more about the music than the characters. There are glimpses into the lives of a few of them. One talks about his ex-wives and losing his millions of dollars -- it's kind of off-subject. Overall, though, the doc is about the music and how it was made and by whom.The producers and/or director spent most of their time with the lesser known members of The Crew, instead of doing the more obvious thing and focusing on the more famous celebrity crew members like Glenn Campbell, Leon Russell, etc. Maybe these guys didn't want the spotlight (Campbell has his own doc), or maybe the producers/director deliberately chose to highlight the lesser known members and give them their due. Either way, these guys (and one gal) deserve the recognition.You'll recognize quite a few names here, and quite a few songs, if, like me, you cut your teeth on rock music of the 60s and 70s.

It's ten times better than the ones I bought five years ago.Full disclosure: I received this item in exchange for an honest review.

This is a nice capo. It's a little different than the ones the guitarists in my band use (see pics). For one thing, the back is curved to form fit to the back of the neck of the guitar. For another, the clip or locking mechanism is designed opposite to that of the ones my band mates currently use (see pic of two on music stand). Nice solid spring and feel to this capo, with good-quality rubber on the clip. Of the two guitarists in my band, one puts the capo on from the top, the other from the bottom. The one who puts it on from the top preferred this capo to his old standard. The other had no opinion one way or the other but liked the color and the fact that it was less bulky than his old one. Capo functions just as a capo should. Good price ($9.95) at time of this review.Note: I received this as a gift in exchange for product testing and an honest review.

The positive reviews on Amazon about this product speak volumes and not much can be added to what has already been said. If you're looking for a reasonably priced silk pillow case, this is a good deal. I accepted this when it was offered it at a discount because I planned to give it to my granddaughter on her birthday, which is right around the corner. I'm sure she's going to love it. She loves soft, comfy things, and this pillow is as soft and comfy as it gets.However, if you're like me, and you move around a lot in bed, lying on one side and then the other, bunching up your pillow under your head and neck, using two or more pillows because you have to prop yourself up, or you're the type of person who flips the pillow over a lot, I'm not sure you'll benefit from this fine pillow case. For one thing, it's designed with one silk side and one cotton side. They say this right in the ad. They do this so the pillow doesn't surf around under your head, which is great, but probably not the best for someone who flips his or her pillow over a lot, or bunches it up like I do.The pillow case also has a zipper, which is what a lot of good pillow cases have. Zipper and zipper pull tab are made of good quality materials and the actual zipper part is completely covered by cloth when the zipper is closed, with only the pull tab slightly exposed. You see where I'm going with this? If you bounce around in your sleep, or are a fidgety sleeper, you're going to find yourself with that pull tab in your ear every so often, or maybe with the zipper part of the pillow under your cheek.Bottom line: This is a great pillow case for someone who sleeps like a rock.My granddaughter sleeps like a rock.

I connected this to an Insteon 2441TH thermostat in a two wire heat only system that uses the Venstar add a wire relay. Thermostat works fine but no sensor readings show up for the remote sensor. Trying to find any troubleshooting info on this is like looking for the proverbial needle in a haystack. The instructions in the 2441TH pdf manual amount to this: "Connect the sensor to the thermostat." They don't even bother to tell you where. I assumed it was the only two terminals not designated for heat, a/c, fan, com, return. Frustrating lack of instruction and advice. The instructions for the sensor are equally vague and show a four point terminal block, not the block you'll find in a wireless control thermostat like the 2441TH. My advice to you is not to waste your time or money on this unless you know someone who has made this work.UPDATE: Did eventually find a Smarthome forum with the answer to my problem: The Insteon 2433A3 will not work with the 2441TH. It will only work with the 2441ZTH, which is the wireless version. Don't be confused, both the wired version and the wireless version are wifi capable. (I know, confusing, right?) I love this company, but they obviously have some major issues understanding their own products. The 2241TH and the 2441ZTH look exactly the same, and the manual for the 2441TH says right in it the unit will display readouts from a remote sensor. Only it won't, apparently. Btw, the 2441ZTH does not send remote sensor data to the 2441 unless the remote sensor temperature is triggered as the master. It's like a mystery wrapped in an enigma. Don't think too hard on this or you'll end up with a stroke.

Comes in a gift box and includes everything you need to be an expert wine steward. (Fine wine palate not included.) Great stocking stuffer for the holidays. The corkscrew is the highlight of the combo with its classy wood handle.

It's not too often my wife buys a shampoo or conditioner that I like. OK, truth be told, it's never. Frankly, we have completely different tastes in hair care -- and also movies, but that's another story. Fragrance is a big issue, too. I prefer little to none, because, well, I'm a man, and I don't want to walk out of the house smelling like a little princess.For the record, I received these in the mail as a gift from the seller in exchange for an honest review. As you can imagine, I was dubious. But guess what? I love this stuff. And my wife loves it. The chances of this happening are somewhere between slim and none. What it does to my hair I have no idea, because I hardly have any -- hair that is, not ideas. But trust me, my wife would not use this stuff if she did not like the way it made her hair feel. And she wouldn't use it if she didn't like the way it smelled. Take her word for it, not mine. I'd shampoo with dish soap or hand sanitizer if I had to.

Full disclosure: I received these from the seller at a discount in exchange for an honest review.They're quite well made, and secure solidly behind your ears, as opposed to the buds that have the inner ear rubber loops. Compared to the latter, these are much more secure. Setting up your bluetooth is a breeze, although the indicator lights are small and hard to see. I was paired with my phone in a matter of seconds.Audio quality is such a personal thing. It's hard for me to say, exactly, what you'll hear based on what I hear. All I can say is, compared to another set I use, these have a different sound, more live feeling than studio feeling. This could be because the rubber buds don't fit that tight into my ear. There's a little bit of a gap there because the hooks that go behind the ear keep the buds from being pushed in too far. Some people will like this, and I have to say, for driving in the car and listening to music and being able to hear traffic and communicate over my phone, I'm one of those people. I'm guessing they'll be good for jogging or running for the same reason. For sitting at home and working on my laptop and listening to music, I sort of want a tighter fit. I want to be immersed in the music more and have less outside noise. There are different rubber ear pieces that come in the package, and I really haven't tried them. Nor have I worn the buds for more than an hour. Could be, with a different ear piece, and with the ear hooks worn in a little with more use, I'll have a tighter fit. Right now, I'm happy the way they are.One of the things I like with these is the design and the high-tech feel of them.

Well made, sturdy leash good for medium size to large dogs. Keep an eye on the swivel snap hook if you have a big dog. I'm not sure what it's made out of. Looks like zinc plated steel or brass. Should last for years but if you have a dog that pulls a lot -- well, all I'm saying is, these types of swivel hooks are just not indestructible. You have two major wear points, at the swivel and at the snap hook. Good thing is, leash is guaranteed for life according to the company. If you see any wear or something in the hook becomes loose, contact the company and get another one.I like this leash. I think it works exceedingly well as a leash for shortening up in a hurry. It's particularly well suited for kids and dog walkers who may need two hands to get a little extra control over their pet. The extra bright colors are an added plus.For the record, the seller sent me one of these in exchange for an honest review.

1:20 MinsSmart, sturdy, functional design. East to install. All you need is a pair of scissors to cut the excess piece of strapping. Tapes into place with adhesive. No screws or fasteners required.  The latch is child-proof but very easy for an adult to open with one hand. Remove with dental floss to break the seal and then clean off the remnant adhesive with soap and water. (See Video)Full Disclosure: I received these at a discount in order to test and review them. All the seller asked for was an honest review.

I plugged this into a Roku box and a brand new Element TV last night. No complaints. It's a high quality cable and certainly long enough. It is a little stiffer than my other cables and had been coiled when shipped, so it had its own loop "memorized" into it. As it was, I decided not to try and straighten it out forcibly. I figure it will straighten out over time on its own. Like I said, even with the stiff loop in it, there's plenty of cable length here for all but the most extreme applications. NIce quality, gold plated connectors have a protective cover on them when they arrive, which indicates some extra care being taken on the part of the manufacturer. Arrived new in a plastic bag.I can't honestly say this cable works better than any of my other high quality cables, but I can say it works equally well and is being sold for less than I paid for my two other HDMI cables with gold-plated connectors.[I received this cable free in return for testing and for writing a review. The seller asked for no special consideration other than an honest review.]

2:30 MinsThis is a terrific set of labels for anyone who's planning a garage sale or even if you just want to organize a closet or basement. They're re-usable. You can use any kind of chalk on it, permanent or washable, and they can be removed easily and will re-stick to whatever you want to stick them to. I used the white liquid chalk that came with the bag of labels. You can see from the video how easy it is to wash the chalk off and get the label to stick to something.

0:13 MinsFantastic gloves. I just pulled a bunch of hard boiled eggs out of a pot of boiling water. The fit is perfect for me. So often, when I buy gloves these days, the fingers are just a strange length for my hand. Obviously, these aren't a one size fits all type of glove. I'm just saying that I'm pleased -- and surprised -- they fit me so well. However, being silicone rubber, you do have a little flexibility in that you can pull them on tight. Anyway, it's a fabulous product, well constructed and heavy duty. Clearly, not to be used over an open flame. They're heat "resistant" not flame retardant. Keep that in mind. That said, wearing these gloves, I would not hesitate to pick up a whole roasted chicken, duck, or rack of ribs off a grille, as long as the burners are turned off. I use the drip pan/water pan method to slow roast meats on the grille. three to six hours of cooking at about 200 to 220 degrees F., depending on the size of the meat. [Take a roasting pan and put that under the grate where the bird or ribs will be set, place your hot coals around the drip pan. Place another roasting pan full of water (or beer) on the gate next the the meat, to keep the temp down.] When you cook this way, the meat just falls off the bone. If you're not careful lifting your roast or ribs off the grille you can have them fall apart before serving. These types of gloves are the perfect answer to that problem. You can cradle your dinner and place it gently on a serving tray or plate, and then wash them later in the sink. I love these gloves. Use them for steamed lobster or crab.By way of a comparison, I bought a single, heavy duty, heat resistant silicone rubber glove a year or two ago from another manufacturer. I paid more for the single glove than these two cost. Anyway, the glove I bought last year was shaped like a claw, with no actual finger slots. You had to put your hand in the glove like you were giving the Vulcan "Live Long and Prosper" salute. I hate that old glove. You can't grip a thing with it.Full Disclosure: I received these at a discount from the seller for test and review purposes. They asked for no special favors, just an honest review.As soon as I can, I'll add some video to this review.

I was provided these ear buds by the seller at discount for test and review purposes. Nothing was suggested or implied with respect to the review. All they asked for was an honest review.I probably have ten or twelve sets of ear buds, starting with the pair I got with my very first iPod. Generally speaking, until I got these, I really didn't like ear buds. My others are intrusive, literally, and uncomfortable in my ears. I can never seem to situate them so I get the audio the way it was meant to be delivered, and they never quite stay in place. Up until now, I preferred a pair of headphones.But these QY8 mini bluetooth buds are pretty nice. They're very light, sit well in my ears, and provide me a very pleasing hi fidelity audio experience.Setup was a piece of cake thanks to a very simple and smartly engineered combination of lights, red and blue. First step, charge the device. My device charged in about 45 minutes. Now try pairing. Hold the devices power button down for 6 seconds until you see the red and blue lights flashing alternately. Use your phone, laptop, or whatever to scan bluetooth devices (you have 3 minutes, which is a lot more than other devices give you), pair your transmit device to the QY8, and wait for the red light to go off and the blue light to come on. Once paired the blue light will flash every 8 seconds. Having two different colored lights in a device this small is a real plus. A lot of devices this small don't even let you know they're on, or it's a real puzzle to determine if you're in pairing mode or not.The QY8 has the added feature of being able to pair with 2 devices at the same time. In other words, you can pair with your laptop and phone so you can privately work or watch videos on your computer and still be able to answer the phone. [FYI: These would not pair with my iMac running OS 10.6.8.]Anyway, I give them 4-stars. (I downgraded slightly when I found out they would not pair with my Mac.) Great audio. Simple set-up. Comfortable for ear buds. Terrific features. Two different colored indicator lights for 3 way status: on, off, and pairing. Great price as of the writing of this review.

2:30 MinsThis is a terrific set of labels for anyone who's planning a garage sale or even if you just want to organize a closet or basement. They're re-usable. You can use any kind of chalk on it, permanent or washable, and they can be removed easily and will re-stick to whatever you want to stick them to. I used the white liquid chalk that came with the bag of labels. You can see from the video how easy it is to wash the chalk off and get the label to stick to something.

My next door friend and neighbor is an avid mountain biker. In fact, he was a fully-sponsored, internationally-ranked mountain bike racer in his younger days. He has 14 mountain bikes, if that means anything. I got this for him - it was offered at a discount in exchange for a review - thinking it might be something he could use with his Samsung Galaxy.I have seen many different types of these phone holders for cars but this is the first I have seen made specifically for a bike handlebar. Obviously, a mountain biker is going to want something sturdy and robust. My first thought right out of the box was that this holder didn't have as solid a feel as some of the car phone holders I've seen. The handlebar clamp is pretty hefty, but I questioned the clamp and elastic harness set-up that holds the phone. Anyway, I gave this to my friend last week and we put it together and tested it in the house. Turns out the elastic strap and clamp hold's the phone in place just fine.The elastic strap is an integral part of this system and without it the phone holder is rendered useless. You cant trust the phone clamp to hold the phone in place on its own. Meanwhile, you only get one strap with your purchase. Break it or lose it, and you need to get another one if you want to use the phone holder.One last thing, in terms of safety and confidence and keeping your phone secure, my feeling is the elastic strap is better than any kind of clamping method. With the screw or ratched type clamps, you really have no way of knowing if things are getting loose, until they do and your phone falls out. The strap is a an on/off, fail/no-fail kind of thing. It's either going to work or not work. Anybody who has suffered through the eventual loosening of a screw clamp knows what I'm talking about. And yes, there is a screw clamp that holds the device to the handlebars, and, eventually, that clamp will probably fail.My friend was quite pleased with the phone holder and was looking forward to using it on a mountain trail. I haven't heard back from him yet but as soon as I do I'll add his report to this review.Addendum: Here's what my friend had to say:Phone holder is easy to mount on either a bike handle bars or stem.Could also be use on snow machines, ATVs and motor cycles.Holds all sizes of phones securely with spring loaded clamp and stretchy silicon(?) butterfly which secures each corner of the phone. This silicon allow to position the phone in various positions to allow access to the power and volume controls.Able to locate the phone either landscape or portrait.One con is that if you wanted to use the camera app on the phone you might miss the opportunity to get photo of fleeing wild life, but that a cost of have your phone held securely.Stem mounting may not be best if you due a lot of out of the saddle riding as your knees might come in contact with the phone. What a nice functional design. 5 stars

Windsor Harries emailed me about reading and reviewing this book and he graciously offered me a copy. I've been inundated with requests for reviews and have been passing on them because I really have my own reading list and most people who send me requests haven't even taken the time to figure out what I like. Well, for the record, I like to read hard science fiction and hard boiled detective stories. I read adventure, non-fiction, and just about anything, but when I want pure unadulterated reading entertainment I stick to hard scifi and hard boiled mysteries, which is why, after reading the blurb about Moon, I said OK.Moon has something else going for it for a scifi enthusuast such as yours truly, namely, it's a collection of novella length shorts, and I like short stories, especially scifi shorts. You can read them in one or two nights.Moon isn't quite in the hard scifi genre. And I won't call it particularly awe-inspiring. It doesn't break new ground in terms of opening your mind to new ideas or concepts, as great scifi is supposed to do. Nevertheless, I enjoyed the book and looked forward to coming back to it every night. Harries is a skillful writer who knows how to keep the story moving and the drama and action compelling.There are five novellas contained within. All of them share a common theme that can be summed up in one word - Unique. In fact, the actual word "unique" pops up in almost all of the stories at least once. I'm not being critical. It's just an observation. The subjects of the stories are classic scifi. Alien encounter/First encounter. Armageddon/Apocalypse. Genetics. Transmutation. Isolation. Alien Invasion.The alien genetics story (Prime) was my least favorite. My favorites were Moon and the first, Chosen. The second, the Armageddon story, Rumble, had some fuzzy science going on and it bounced around a lot as it was told anthologically, i.e. from the point of view of multiple characters and voices as they struggled to survive the same apocolyptic experience. I enjoyed it for it's international flavor and rich atmosphere. Voltage is about an electrician who, after taking an AC jolt to the head, temporarily enters a fraternity of anti-government superachievers and revolutionaries. It seemed to me this story had some subliminal or allegorical aspect to it.All these stories have their roots in classic scifi, and I'm sure scifi snobs will say classic writers of the 70s and 80s have done it before and better. Maybe so. I still feel comfortable giving it 4.49 stars for providing me several nights of entertaining reading.(If I gave it 4.5 stars, I'd have to round-up to 5-stars above and that wouldn't be quite right.)Well done, Mr. Harries. I'll be checking on your next book.

I downloaded this app for my granddaughter's iPad. I spent two hours looking for children's books she could read because she loves to read. She's 8 years old. The app lets you add the books to your wish list, which you can then buy on-line later. The content gets added to your library and you can then send it to your device using the Manage Devices and Content Page. So far so good. New content shows up. Reader works great. Problem is...app has a toggle button at the bottom -- Cloud/Device -- and when you switch it to Cloud, all your content shows up, your zombie stories, mysteries about mass murderers, whatever else you happen to be reading that you absolutely don't want your 8 year old granddaughter to see the graphic cover of let alone download and read. So you look for parental controls in the app. There are none. OK, so you figure you've already download her books, why not just unregister the device? Nope. That won't work...a warning comes up telling you all content will be deleted when you unregister. Wait, you think, I'll use Amazon's new Household Family feature to create a kid-safe library and then only allow the iPad to access the safe library. So you go to your Manage Device and Content page and go through all your books ten at a time (you can't click on more than ten and at a time) and you create a new library just for your granddaughter. You put her new books in the new library and make sure the adult content books are not in there. But then you discover, there is no way to set the new device (iPad) to choose the new kid-safe library. At this point, you have about 3 hours into this project. So you go back to the Manage Device and Content page and you go through every book (ten at a time) and take all the adult content books out of the main shared library leaving only the kid-safe books available for viewing in the cloud, which also takes all these books off your other adult-only devices. But what the hey, it's about your kid, right? She loves to read! Ok, another thirty minutes down the tube. But holy moly it's totally worth it, right? She loves to read dagnabbit!!!!! Molding young minds and all that. So you go back to the iPad with a big satisfied grin on your face and click on the Cloud button and even though you went through all this hoopla and wasted half a day, all your adult content books are still right there!!!!! But wait, you can't give up yet. There's always tech support. You haven't shaved or left the house, but the sun still has about an hour to set. You call Amazon. You get someone in Cloud support who sounds very nice and somehow is already in your account navigating through your digital content. She says everything looks right and transfers you to a Kindle guru sitting in a haze of incense somewhere in Pakistan with his legs folded like a pretzel. He sounds like he's in an all fired hurry to cook a goat or catch a train but nevertheless listens to your conundrum. He puts you on hold for 15 minutes and when he comes back he says. "I'm sorry, but the Kindle app on the iPad will not function with the Household and Family Library. Have I solved your problem today? Is there anything else I can help you with?"[For the record, I love Pakastani food cooked with goat and have nothing but respect for gurus.]
My wife loves it. My granddaughter loves it. What more is there to say?

If you like the design as seen in the picture, and you're looking for a hand-sized, low cost walkway or garden light, this might be just the thing for you. It's not the most rugged product you'll find at Amazon, but it's also being sold for under $6. You kind of get what you pay for, and in this case, I think you get a pretty good deal. I have my doubts about it's water-reistance and I have yet to test it that way. Tonight, maybe, as we're expecting 4" of rain. Check back and I'll let you know what happens.The light has a footprint about the size of a man's hand, and it is designed to be mounted with the solar panel in an upright position. If you mount it exposed to the elements, I think it's safe to say you will lower its life expectancy, because the panel is meant to pop out of the top of the lens housing and the seal there is not watertight. Underneath the solar panel is the battery compartment. A little silicone around the edge of this will go a long way in keeping this section dry.Here's an easy way to mount it without having to measure anything:1. Remove the battery compartment.2. Remove the inner lens sleeve.3. Mark your screw holes with a pencil going through the open sections of the outer housing.4. Install screws.5. Slide inner lens sleeve back into position.6. Pop the battery compartment back using a bead of clear silicone as a waterproof seal.7. Mount light.The light casts a nice, mellow hue that's very pleasing and not to hard on the eyes. (See photo: I took this inside, in the dark. In the background is an AC powered night light for comparison.)Check out other photos.Give the solar panel and light a full six hours to charge.Full disclosure: I received this product at a discount for test and review purposes.

This is a nice wallet, and I think it's worth the selling price. Even if it did not block thieves from electronically stealing your credit card and I.D. information, it would still be a nice wallet. Soft, genuine leather. Nice stitching, well constructed, and, for me, the right number of sleeves and places to put things. A wallet is a very personal, utilitarian thing, and everybody has different needs. I want easy access to my credit cards, licenses, and I.D.s, and I have nine of these. My driver's license I place in the flip-out holder with the clear window and the eight others I put in the facing sleeves. Behind the sleeves are two hidden compartments. I use these for registrations, fishing licenses and other things I don't take out very often.I was offered this item as a gift for purposes of testing and reviewing, and I can honsetly say I would have passed had the wallet not been made with the exact number of sleeves and pockets I require. Functionally, this wallet is a duplicate to the one I've been using for twenty years, and until now, I've been unable to find a one to replace it.
