I used both sides of one pad and a LOT of elbow grease, and my spouse said she hadn't seen the stove top this clean since the day we moved in. There are still a few deeply-cooked in stains that will probably need a bit of razor-assistance to remove, but on the whole, this cleaner took care of all our recent stains around the burners.I liked the hard plastic cleaning tool that was supplied, it made it easier to apply pressure while scrubbing. I didn't see a single scratch mark on the stove top once I finished. Having resealable bags for the scrubbing pads was a nice bonus.Overall, I'm quite happy with this product, and it did very well.

To make sure this item gets a proper review, I've enlisted the help of my child to describe how she likes this doll...Me: Was it hard getting this doll out of the packaging?My child: Not really, once you open the bottom of the box, the inside part comes right out. There were tabs on the back of the box, the kind you fold in. There were about 5 rubber bands on the head, arms and legs. It took me about 5 minutes to get it out of the box. I was really happy they didn't have a bunch of string and wires holding her in, like some other dolls.Me: What do you like about this Barbie doll?My child: Well, the necklace goes a little over the shoulders, so it's different from my other dolls. The crown has a rubber band on it, but if you take that off, it still stays on her head. I can open the wings with my thumb, and the dress works like it's supposed to. There's a lot of glitter on her dress and her top, and I like that. Her hair is poofier than my other dolls. I like her belly button (hey, belly BUTTON!) that opens up the dress, it looks like a jewel.Me: This doll doesn't come with a brush and it can't stand up on its own, and there isn't a stand to hold her up. Does any of that bother you?My child: No, I have a lot of brushes from my Bratzillaz dolls and my Monster High dolls, so that's okay. Most of the time I have the doll in my hands and I don't need a stand for it. I really like this doll.MY IMPRESSIONS:Every Barbie doll has some little hook or gimmick to grab a child's attention, and this one has fairy wings and the 2-sided dress for that. The necklace and crown can slip around, but that shouldn't be much of an issue.I've uploaded some pictures in the "Customer Images" section for you to take a look at.The main concern I have with this doll? The glitter...it has a tendency to get everywhere. Don't be surprised if your child plays with this doll and ends up with glitter on both hands.All in all, it's a cute doll. I have a feeling we'll be picking up the DVD before too long.

These were a huge hit in our household. The sea salt isn't overpowering, and they taste very light and airy. There's a slight buttery taste in each stick.As with many gluten-free foods, when wheat is removed, potato starch is a common replacement, and this doesn't diminish the taste here. These sticks have a good crunch like regular pretzel sticks, albeit a bit softer.A single serving size is 33 sticks, which is more than enough to satisfy for a light snack. Since these come in packs of 6, there's more than enough to go around.We'll definitely be picking these up again.

Horror films have developed many different flavors over the years. There's supernatural horror, psychological horror, found footage, and so many more.Dark Skies falls into the category of science-fiction horror, which is familiar ground for people who've watched TV shows like Fringe (or the X-Files, depending on your generation). This kind of horror isn't for everyone, as evidenced by the mixed reviews Dark Skies has gotten. However, it made back its production budget at the box office several times over, so clearly there's an audience for this particular flavor of horror movie.Some might be turned off at the idea of a horror movie being PG-13, but if the story is done well, horror movies don't need buckets of blood or rampant cursing.PLOT:Our tale takes place in the suburbs, with husband and wife Daniel & Lacy (played by Josh Hamilton and Keri Russell), and their two boys Jessie and Sammy (played by Dakota Goyo and Kadan Rockett). There's some existing strain on the family since Daniel has been out of work for about three months, and Lacy is struggling to hold on to her realty job. Jessie is going through the awkwardness of his early teens, but still makes the time to tell bedtime stories to his little brother Sammy through their walkie-talkies.Strange, unexplained things start happening to this family - stacks of cans appear in their kitchen for no reason, every sensor of the house alarm is tripped at the same time but no one is found in the house, and in one particularly unsettling sequence, every single picture is removed from their frames on the first floor of the house. After a while, each family member finds themselves personally affected by things they can't explain.It's clear that someone or something is targeting this family, and over the course of the film, we see everyone's horror and panic grow as their safety slips away.WHAT DID I THINK?I thought Dark Skies took a slow-build approach to its horror, and it didn't take the cheap way out with jump scares or shaky-camera footage. The horror took its time, building very slowly over the course of the movie with unsettling imagery. As a parent, the greatest fear I have is being helpless to protect my children...and the director tapped into this fear with unsettling horrific events that couldn't be explained or protected against, such as the time-loss/possession moments or the children being covered with bruises and brandings.In horror films, you either care about the characters, or you want them to meet a well-deserved death. I found myself caring about every main character in Dark Skies, which is not easy for a horror film to pull off. I particularly enjoyed the performance of Kadan Rockett as Sammy...he was able to adapt to whatever the scenes required, and I felt he reacted just as an actual six-year old child would act - whether it was screaming, silence, or happiness over the family getting a new dog.The character of Edwin Pollard (played by J.K. Simmons) was a real treat. This type of movie requires an "expert" on what's happening, and he played the role perfectly...no overacting, no underplay, just right. I was starting to lost interest in the film partway through, but his character brought me back and got me refocused...he wanted to do what he could to help, and he was very honest with Daniel & Lacy about their fears.The ending, I'll admit, wasn't what I expected, and I won't lie, I was disappointed. Everyone has a different reaction to an ending like this one, so I'll let you make your own decisions on that.BONUS FEATURES:There's one audio commentary track with the following people -(1) Scott Stewart (writer/director)(2) Jason Blum (producer)(3) Brian Kavanaugh-Jones (executive producer)(4) Peter Gvodas (picture editor)The commentary track is quite good. Several topics are discussed, such as their decision to not make this a "found footage" film, their schedule of 6 months from shooting to release in theaters, giving creative control to the actors, explaining how to shoot "night shots" in the daytime, and much more. Overall, a good track, but I wish we could have had a 2nd track with the actors to hear their thoughts, character motivations, etc.There's also 9 deleted/alternate scenes with optional commentary. Lots of these sequences were cut because they disrupted the pacing of the movie and the overall tone. There's also an alternate ending...it'll be up to you to decide which one is better.MY FINAL VERDICT?All in all, Dark Skies did what it set out to do, to unsettle its audience. However, it's a one-time viewing for folks like me.Initially I was going to give this movie 3 stars, but the solid performances by the actors and the extra features rounded it up to 4 stars.If you like your horror movies with Pinheads or found footage or buckets of blood and gore, this definitely isn't your movie. However, if you're looking to try a different flavor of horror, I'd recommend Dark Skies for a rental. Who knows, you might like it.

This review is for the "Brownie Crunch" flavor of thinkThin bars.My spouse and I both tried out this protein bar, here were her thoughts:"I can taste the outer coating of chocolate but the inside of this bar tastes hollow. It's dry and flavorless."For the most part, I agreed with her conclusions. This bar has soy crisps in it, so I found it occasionally tasted like a Rice Krispy treat...but that was only the texture. Without standard sugar, this bar just didn't taste very good.I've uploaded a picture into the "Customer Images" section so you can see what the bar looks like on the inside.There's a lot of sodium in this bar (170mg), and 7% of the bar is made up of sugar alcohols, which can't be completely digested.The package advises that this bar is made in a plant which also processes eggs, peanuts and tree nuts, so be careful if you have any allergies to those.I'm sure there are people out there who love the taste of these bars, but for me, a brownie without sugar isn't a brownie...it's an imitation.

At first glance, I didn't think this applicator would work. I thought the edges would curl up and it wouldn't be able to handle the jobs I put in front of it. I'm happy to report that I was wrong on all counts.Setup couldn't be any simpler - just attach the refill pad to the applicator on the bottom of the sponge, and you're ready to clean.The sponge foam is a huge plus. It was able to mold itself into different angles while I cleaned out a frying pan, and when I finished, it went right back to its original shape. There's a faint lemony smell while cleaning.Removing the pad is a little tricky since it clings like velcro to the applicator, but once it's off, you can attach a new pad when you're ready to clean again.I used this on one of our frying pans - it took about 15 minutes of scrubbing, and the pan got squeaky clean. I also used this on our refrigerator doors (as per the cover of the refills) and it gave them a really nice shine.All in all, this is a very good product. It cuts through grease like a hot knife through butter, and if that's what you need, this will do the job.

+ PROS:+ Improved weaponry, armor, etc.+ Even more ways to kill Necromorphs+ Extra difficulty modes of Zealot and Hard Core+ Extra game "Dead Space: Extraction" included- CONS:- Has a "been there, done that" feeling- Scare factor is diminished with repeated play-throughs- Multiplayer can be very frustratingPLOT:Dead Space 2 takes place three years after the conclusion of the previous game. Isaac Clarke, our hero, has been reduced to an asylum patient in The Sprawl. Before long, he escapes his confinement and discovers yet another plot by the Unitologists to use him and his Marker-infected mind.Using his wits, his trusty plasma cutter and some strategic dismemberment, Isaac starts on another journey to eliminate as many Necromorphs as he can.GAMEPLAY:As before, we take control of Isaac in a 3rd person, over-the-right-shoulder view. As the game progresses, various weapons and schematics can be found. We can also find power nodes for weapon upgrades, armor upgrades, and more.We're not confined to the Ishimura anymore, and Isaac has different objectives to complete each level. There isn't as much emphasis on puzzle-solving as we had in the first game...this was dialed back, and the amount of firefights with Necromorphs has clearly increased.Though it's been 3 years since the last game, Isaac remembers that shots to the body only stun, and even decapitations are ineffective...and in some cases, make Necromorphs more dangerous. He's ready to strategically dismember each enemy until there's nothing left but a bullet-riddled mess.A power-up called STASIS can be used to freeze Necromorphs while Isaac uses them for target practice/dissection, and another power-up called KINESIS can bring objects to Isaac or hurtle them away with lethal velocity. I LOVED the tweak in gameplay where Isaac can use kinesis to rip a bladed arm off a dead Necromorph, and impale another enemy against the wall with it. This is also a great way to save ammunition.Players still have the in-game store to buy and sell items; and the upgrade Benches are back to maximize effectiveness for weapons and armor. There's been an additional tweak: if you spend 5000 credits, you can remove all the power nodes from one weapon and assign them to another.Mercifully, the game still spoon-feeds us objective locations, store locations and save points by using the R3 button.Dead Space 2 also increased the number of zero-gravity areas, where Isaac can jump off the floor and use suit thrusters to propel him towards his objective.When you play through this game on the easier settings, you might think you've got it made. However, when you try playing on Zealot mode, that's where you have to carefully plan out each attack so you don't run out of ammunition. Hard Core mode cranks the difficulty level up for seasoned players...you can only save 3 times across the 15 levels of gameplay, and there are no checkpoints. If you die, you go back to your last save point.MULTIPLAYER:This is a new addition to Dead Space. These are team-based matches, which last 2 rounds. You can play a Necromorph trying to keep a team of humans from reaching their tactical goals, or you could be a human trying to cleanse a path through a vicious pack of Necromorphs.HOW ABOUT THAT EXTRA GAME, DEAD SPACE: EXTRACTION?This was a VERY pleasant surprise. A port from the Nintendo Wii, Extraction takes place prior to the events of the first Dead Space game, and it's played in a first person rail-shooter view. If you don't have a Playstation Move controller, the game can still be played with a DualShock controller. However, since there's virtually no lag while shooting with the Move, that's what I prefer using.There are 10 levels to play, and there's a large replay value because of all the extra powerups and trophies you can earn. If you're on the fence about buying Dead Space 2, I think this additional game will tip your scales to the "purchase" side. You're basically getting 2 full games for the price of one.TROPHIES:Trophy lovers, now is the time to REJOICE. Dead Space 2 has 51 trophies to earn (8 more if you purchase the DLC pack), and Dead Space Extraction offers 48 additional trophies.Many of the trophies are earned for completing chapters of the game, using certain weapons to kill Necromorphs, and so forth.Without a doubt, the hardest trophy to earn is to complete the game on the "Hard Core" difficulty setting. You can only save 3 times throughout the course of the entire game. Your skills will be pushed to the ultimate limits, as well as your patience. If you manage to complete this task, you are rewarded with a ridiculously overpowered weapon that will make all subsequent playthroughs as easy as falling off a log.CONS:The first Dead Space game had a very, VERY claustrophobic feel to it. The creaking of the ship's deck plates, the sound of Isaac's breathing, the sharp music changes when a Necromorph appeared, it was all designed to scare us to our core.Even though I enjoyed Dead Space 2, I didn't get the same sense of all-encompassing fear as I did when I played the first game. There weren't many new monsters, and most of the fetch-questing was toned down in favor of more face-to-face combat. To me, it simply felt less scary and more predictable. I found the scare factor diminished with each New Game+.The weakest part of Dead Space 2, by far, was the Multiplayer mode. In a nutshell, you play as either a Necromorph or a human. Humans will regenerate at one central spawn point, but if playing as a Necromorph, you can choose where you want to emerge from.The problem is, the spawning is so slow that it paints a bulls-eye on your face while your online opponents turn you into hamburger.Powerups can be earned as you accumulate experience points, which in turn increases your attack damage, but the matching of players is completely random and unbalanced. I played with a couple of other people that were levels 3 to 10, but a few of my opponents were upwards of level 20-30...This was the same problem with Multiplayer matches in TRON: Evolution. I found the Necromorphs were very slow and clunky to control - instead of performing a slashing attack, I usually ended up jumping up and down in front of my opponents.FINAL VERDICT?While I enjoyed the harder difficulty settings and the addition of Dead Space: Extraction in this package, I didn't find myself as scared. Killing Necromorphs and upgrading my weapons and armor was fun, but the fear factor and the puzzle gameplay definitely felt like they were dialed back. I didn't get much enjoyment out of the multiplayer mode, but to each their own. However, if you like killing Necromorphs, you'll get a lot of enjoyment out of Dead Space 2.

Recently, while watching an episode of Family Feud, the question was asked: "What animal does your significant other sound like when they snore?" and my wife replied: "An ELEPHANT!"Soon after, I decided to look into an anti-snoring aid.I've uploaded a picture of this clip into the "Customer Images" section. It's a pretty simple design, the two nubs have magnets in them to hold the clip on your nose. The product description tells us that the clip will open nose passages to promote air flow, and it "applies gentle pressure to your septum trigeminal nerve". Not sure what that last part means, but if it makes me snore less, I'll take it. The clip stays on all night, and the little nubs seem to tickle my nose while I wear it.It's impossible for me to tell if this item worked or not, so I'll share my wife's thoughts:"Before you used this thing, you snored pretty much all night. I had to leave the room every night because your snoring was so loud and obnoxious.After you started using the clip, you would not snore ALL night long, it worked for about half the night, but you start snoring between 1am and 4am. When you snore now, it isn't as loud and obnoxious, I only leave the room a couple of times a week rather than every single night. It only works for about 4 hours."So there you have it. This device didn't stop my snoring completely, but it's downgraded my snoring level from "elephant" to "bulldog" levels [citation needed].

This is one of the harder movies I've chosen to review. Not because I didn't like it, quite the opposite - I liked it _so_ much, my hope is that you would choose to watch this movie the same way I did, without any prior information.However, since you're already reading my review, I'll do my best to tell you why I liked it and try to keep spoiler material to a bare minimum. My best advice is: DON'T WATCH THE TRAILER FOR THIS MOVIE! I cannot stress this enough. It reveals way, way too much of the plot twists.THE PLAYERS:There's a wide range of talent attached to this movie...Michael Chiklis (who also serves as a producer of this film), Forest Whitaker, Ray Liotta, Nikki Reed from the "Twilight" films, Stephen Lang from "Avatar", Sean Faris, and many more.THE PLOT:The best way to describe this film is that it's a 3-man-heist-gone-wrong at a small diner, but with more twists and turns than you can shake a stick at. In all honesty, offering any more information threatens to reveal too much, so I'll move on.DVD FEATURES:English or Spanish subtitles, no other options.EXTRAS:This is one bare-bones DVD. There's no trailers, no commentary tracks, just a 23 minute "Behind the Scenes" feature from most of the players, but it's missing input from Ray Liotta and Michael Chiklis.WHAT DID I LIKE?I loved the non-linear style of telling the story. This movie had several flashbacks, and sometimes the same scenes were shown but from different character points of view, which offered more information than in the first viewing. Anyone who's seen a Quentin Tarantino film knows his movies should be watched more than once, and Pawn invites you to do the same.I liked seeing Michael Chiklis and Forest Whitaker on screen, which brought back memories of their days together on "The Shield". Ray Liotta was quite a pleasant surprise, delivering one of the most chilling monologues I've ever heard in his career to date. I had to do a complete double-take when I saw Stephen Lang, who played a frail older man with a bad hip...a stark contrast to his role as Colonel Miles Quaritch in "Avatar". Sean Faris did extremely well with these veteran actors - he was able to play a roller coaster of emotions without hamming up his role.Most of all, I liked finding out that the director, David A. Armstrong, was the cinematographer of the "SAW" franchise. Just like the first "SAW" movie, Pawn was shot in one main location and very few other locations, and the director was able to hold my interest all the way through to the end.WHAT DID I NOT LIKE?Common's depiction of Jeff Porter, the hostage negotiator. Out of all the characters in this film, I felt this one was portrayed the weakest with his soft voice and flat affect. I wish he had studied Kevin Spacey's character from "The Negotiator". Thankfully, his weak characterization didn't ruin the rest of the film for me.I also didn't like the lack of features on this disc. I would have loved to hear the director's thoughts on an audio track.FINAL VERDICT?All in all, I liked Pawn. I was pleased to discover a film shot over the course of 15 days on a low budget which was able to entertain me and keep me guessing about different plot points. Some were obvious, while others were not.If you like crime dramas, I would definitely recommend seeing this at least twice to catch all the little subtleties.

The bag promises that each kernel is "sprinkled with mouthwatering seasonings for a big burst of flavor in every wholesome bite!"I tried this popcorn, as did my spouse and our child, and none of us were impressed. When I think of a "sharp" cheddar taste, I expect the cheddar flavor to overpower everything else.The cheddar taste in this popcorn was mild at best, but the deal-breaker was the aftertaste of the popcorn - it was almost...metallic.If this was advertised as a mild cheddar popcorn, it would be a more accurate description. You won't find a powerful cheddar taste with this product.

In order to give this doll a proper review, I enlisted the help of my child, our resident expert on dolls!Me: So what's the doll look like?My child: "This looks similar to my Liv Sophie doll, it's about the same height and the hands on Jade J'Adore look exactly the same."Me: How hard is it to get the doll out of the package?My child: "You will probably need scissors to get the head out of the back of the box, it has those little plastic ties that clamp on the head. There's lots of little rubber bands on everything, too."Me: Do you like the way she looks?My child: "I like that these Bratzillaz are different than regular witches. Regular witches have a black dress, a black hat, and a broom. These witches have better fashion, and they're good witches."Me: What do you like about this doll?My child: "I like that this doll can fix broken hearts, I think that's the most helpful power out of all the other Bratzillaz dolls. I like her more than regular dolls, and the Liv dolls, and the Monster High dolls, most dolls don't come with this much extra stuff. The box gives her story and that's good for people who have never heard of her."Me: Is there anything you didn't like about this doll?My child: "I'm a little sad that Kissifuss wasn't included, the box has a picture of Kissifus but in real small lettering it says 'Pet Sold Separately' on the picture."---------------------------MY IMPRESSIONS:This is a pretty nice doll. It has a LOT of extra trinkets, such as:- heart-shaped purse- removable cape- removable earrings- hairbrush / broom- removable "kneecap holders"- removable boots- removable hat (rubberbanded around her head)- scannable "spell scroll" on the boxI've uploaded some pictures in the "Customer Images" section of this product for you to look at.We didn't notice that Jade's eyes were tiny hearts until we lifted up the mesh covering, that was a nice little touch!My only concern is this: when we brushed her hair for the first time, we noticed white flaky particles that fell on her cape. After a few brushings this stopped happening, but it's worth mentioning.Overall, my child loves this. Looks like we'll have to make room for the other four other dolls!

6:51 MinsIn this video I show you everything that comes in the Premium Edition box set.Changes in button mapping for the games:Reload - Previously R2, swapped to R1Fire - previously R1, swapped to R2Open Inventory - previously [triangle], swapped to [circle]Drop Item - previously [circle], swapped to [triangle]I've also uploaded some screenshots to the "View and share related images" of this product.Enjoy!

As some other reviewers have mentioned, this product isn't too great.On the bottle it says "absorbs quickly without greasiness". I tried this on my hands and elbows and they felt clean and soft, but only for about 15 minutes...then the dryness returned.In regard to their claim of "without greasiness", I thought this product felt very greasy, similar to sunscreen. It also felt slightly sticky after application.I noticed a very powerful aloe/powdery smell that didn't seem to fade after this lotion was used, I had to use soap to remove the scent.While this product does moisturize, the effects don't last very long.

Our family loves a good tasting pasta sauce, and this 4-pack provides more than enough for us!I'll admit, by itself, the sauce is somewhat bland, similar to plain tomato soup...but this is also a strong point, since extra ingredients can be added to this sauce and make it taste better. This depends on the flair of the cook, and the tastes of their audience.Since we have a small family, there is a lot of leftover sauce, we use roughly half of a 45 ounce bottle for a pasta meal. The frustration-free packaging was easy to open (no hassle at all), and the klutz in me breathed a sigh of relief upon seeing the bottles were plastic.If you've got to serve 5 people, one jar should fit your needs.

The title of this review is a quote is from my child, our household expert on peanut butter.I served her some PB Crave Razzle Dazzle on a slice of wheat bread, and our conversation is below:Me: "So...how do you like it?"[chomp] "Dad, This is REALLY GOOD! It tastes really creamy..." [chomp] "I can smell raspberries and I taste the chocolate." [chomp] "...it tastes like a mix of peanut butter, dark chocolate [chomp], and marshmallows."  [chomp] "I don't think this needs jelly [chomp], it almost tastes like raspberry jelly and peanut butter mixed together." [chomp] "Aww..."Me: "What's the matter?"[sad] "I only have bread left!"MY IMPRESSIONS:I concur with my child, this peanut butter tastes GREAT. I will admit, the smell is a little bizarre at first - when I opened the container, I was bombarded with the scent of raspberries and peanut butter. It's got a standard peanut butter taste but with the added kick of white chocolate, dark chocolate and raspberries. This peanut butter spreads very thick, so with all the extra ingredients, it threatens to rip apart the bread. It's very sweet, and very tasty.By toasting the bread first, it will make this peanut butter a little easier to spread, and the warmth melts the chocolate to make a good treat taste even better. If you fancy a sweet topping for waffles, this will be a nice little addition.My only complaint? I want a bigger jar...more, I say!Enjoy!

6:51 MinsIn this video I show you everything that comes in the Premium Edition box set.Changes in button mapping for the games:Reload - Previously R2, swapped to R1Fire - previously R1, swapped to R2Open Inventory - previously [triangle], swapped to [circle]Drop Item - previously [circle], swapped to [triangle]I've also uploaded some screenshots to the "View and share related images" of this product.Enjoy!

+ PROS:+ Frank West and his camera return to Dead Rising!+ New weapons to create+ New plot twists, new psychopaths and new challenges+ 2 Multiplayer modes: Game campaign and Sandbox Mode+ New area: The Uranus Zone- CONS:- Still has long load times- No more "Terror Is Reality" 4-player mode- Extra save slots and improved survivor AI make the game too easy for veterans of Dead Rising 1PLOT:It's been 5 years since the Willamette disaster, and in this game, we play Frank West, a photojournalist who's covered wars. He's had his 15 minutes of fame, and now he's slumming around the game show Terror Is Reality to pay the bills. A zombie outbreak occurs, and Frank needs to keep himself alive for 3 days until the military arrives to clean up the mess.In a nutshell, The game starts as Dead Rising 2 did, but the story is told with Frank West in the spotlight.GAMEPLAY:From the beginning, Frank starts off with his hands and feet as his weapons. As you wander around the mall, you can use pretty much anything as a weapon, whether it's a can of whipped cream, a bottle of whiskey, or a pitchfork. Zombies are EVERYWHERE, and when 7pm rolls around, those zombies take an extra dose of the crazy and get super-violent.Killing zombies earns character Prestige Points, which in turn levels up inventory slots, strength, hit points, offensive and defensive capabilities. Frank West is also able to earn PP by taking pictures of people in various poses such as brutality, horror, outtake, drama, erotica and more.Frank has a series of case files to complete over the course of 3 days and during this time he can choose to try and save random survivors throughout the city, attempt to defeat psychopaths who have lost their minds due to the zombie outbreak, and try to find the life-giving Zombrex medicine that he needs every day to survive. Or, he can choose to do nothing more than wander around trying on clothes, eating various foods, or gambling in the casinos.There are additional weapons to create that weren't in Dead Rising 2, and the Uranus Zone is a new kids-theme park area which allows the use of carnival rides to kill zombies.IS IT BETTER THAN DEAD RISING 2 WITH CHUCK GREENE?Well, I liked the alternate Frank West storyline. I assumed I knew everything that would happen and where to find everything, but the game developers counted on this and made several changes to the plot and item locations which made it harder for folks who played through Dead Rising 2 several times (like me).I love the return of Frank West's camera, because that's what made Dead Rising so memorable...taking pictures of zombies is a very fun activity, though it's pretty hard to get a picture of a psychopath when they're trying to cleave me from neck to navel.There are times when this feels like a complete clone of Dead Rising 2, but then I find new enemies, new plot points or new attack moves which remind me that I'm playing a different game.MULTIPLAYER:A player can choose to complete the storyline with an online partner. This makes defeating psychopaths a lot easier than standard 1:1 fighting, and some of the trophies can't be unlocked unless you have a co-op partner with you.The second online gameplay mode is Sandbox mode. This is what I was dreaming about...I can run around and slice up zombies with no time limit, no need to find Zombrex, no missions, just plain old fashioned FUN. There are several challenges to complete for single player mode, such as trying to drink 30 alcoholic drinks within a time limit, and these challenges have increased difficulty if you decide to play with an online partner.Your character needs $50,000 to complete a game mission? No problem! Just do an online session and save that game file. Then when you go back to story mode, the money's all there.TROPHIES:There's a LOT of busy work in getting all the trophies for Dead Rising 2: Off the Record. There are easy ones such as getting 69 zombie kills or making a zombie slip in a puddle of vomit. For the more dedicated players, there are some time consuming trophies such as finding all the combo cards, photographing all the PP stickers, or abstaining from consuming meat, dairy or alcohol until the military arrives.Some trophies are missable during playthroughs unless you use a strategy guide.CONS:I've said it before, I'll say it again..these load times are RIDICULOUS. Going through a door or moving from one part of the mall to another can take up to 20 seconds with each load. When you fight a psychopath, there's a cutscene...then a loading screen...then you fight...then there's a closing cutscene...and yet ANOTHER loading screen. These load times kill the pacing of the game.I must admit, I miss "Terror Is Reality". It was fun to run around and put blenders on zombie's heads, tear through a crowd of zombies with a slicicle, or use a zamboni to grind them up on the ice rink. However, Sandbox mode was a fair tradeoff because in the end, it's all about killing as many zombies as possible in the most satisfying ways.Finally, the save slots. One of the things that made the first Dead Rising so hard and so challenging was having only one save slot. This left no margin of error and would require another run-through if something was missed. The survivors in Dead Rising 1 had a nasty habit of walking into packs of zombies, making trips back to the safehouse very difficult as the game progressed.In this game, the characters are much better at avoiding zombies and can even use weapons, if they accept them from you. With 3 save slots and the improved AI, Dead Rising 2: Off the Record is more forgiving...but some folks do miss that challenge.FINAL VERDICT:On the whole, I really enjoyed Dead Rising 2: Off the Record. This gets 4 stars from me because I'm SO masochistic.My main goals are hacking up zombies like I've got a hunting license, collecting difficult trophies and playing some short, goofy and blood-soaked online gaming sessions. If you like the same things, then I think you'll get a kick out of this game.Now if you get frustrated with weapons that break (and all of them eventually do), long load times and time-limit missions, you might want to give this game a pass. I'd recommend at least a rental...Once you combine a 2x4 with a lawnmower and see the damage you can wreak, you might like this game enough to buy it.Enjoy!

I recently attended MAGFest 11 and cosplayed as Agent 47, or The Hitman. This was the last item I needed to complete my costume.This blood-red tie sold my look. I'm a tall person (6 foot 2 inches), and when tying a half-Windsor knot, this reached to my belt buckle with ease.My only complaint? This tie had a tendency to bunch up whenever I made adjustments, but this was a minor concern after smoothing out the bumps.If you need a red tie for a low price, this one will suit your needs.Recommended!

I decided to dress as Agent 47 (from the Hitman video game series) for a local gaming convention, and I knew I had to find a set of pistols that looked similar to the Silverballers.The pistols in the game are clones of the .45 ACP Colt M1911, and since these Airsoft pistols are extremely similar in look and feel, I picked them up.While checking in at the security office, the workers there said these pistols felt like the real thing. They were impressed with the workmanship on the slide as well as the clips. They had to zip-strip the triggers since these looked so real.I can't speak of the shooting accuracy of these pistols, because I only used them for costume purposes...but if you want to get some prop weapons that look like the real thing, you can't do much better than these.Recommended!

I was pleasantly surprised my the quality of this towel set, let alone the length. The mat towel is quite long (bonus for me), because my yoga mat is very long (72 inches); so to have a yoga mat towel that's the same size was a huge plus for me! The towels are soft, not scratchy and do not slip during yoga practice. It is absorbent, light weight and an overall great towel.*I received this product free in exchange for my honest/unbiased review.

I ordered these for yoga practice and was quite pleased with how well they fit. They offer a good solid grip on the floor without feeling like I'm sliding around.I also have a pair of "Toe Sox", but I like these a bit better since the toes are actually able to be out rather than covered. Perfect for cool mornings practicing at home or in the yoga studio. I took off one star only because after wearing these for over an hour during yoga, my toes started to hurt so they were a bit uncomfortable. Other than that, the size was perfect!*I received these socks for free in exchange for my honest unbiased review.*

This was an absolute Horrible Mess! I'm not sure if I got a bad batch, but this was awful! NO hair came off and I followed the EXACT directions! Not only did I try this for my legs, but, my husband tried this for his chest and BOTH times we both ended up completely sticky! I'm really upset because I used BodyHonee's Hard Wax Kit: Face, Underarms & Bikini Hair Remover with no issues, but this one was terrible! My advice, avoid this one!! I ended up throwing this in the trash! That's a waste of 20 bucks!!

I bought this bag to take with me on my trip to India and I wanted a bag that was large enough to fit my laptop, iPhone, passport, etc.... this bag is PERFECT!! Oh my gosh, it is so roomy that everything I plan to carry-on the plane will fit in here with room to spare. I'm usually not a fan of large bags, but this one is perfect for my needs. I love the color too, it's not "too" bright red, but more of a "burnt" red color, just that bit of "pop" that I wanted. Straps are adjustable too and the inside has 2 pockets for your mobile phone and a tablet (7 inch). All in all, I don't have any complaints. Totally recommend this bag.

I am not usually a buyer of shoes on line, but I am so glad I bought these sandals! I'm a big fan of the Born brand and this is my first pair of boc shoes. They are comfortable and look great-these are my new go-to sandals!!

There's not much to talk about when it comes to a PS4 stand but it does save a lot of room and the stand locks on to the PS4 so its not going anywhere. The stand does what it is intended to do. Helps keep Ps4 up straight. No issues with quality and like how it locks to the ps4 on the bottom. This accessory is a must for anyone who wants to install the PS4 vertically. The stand works well even on carpet.*I was given this product at no cost in exchange for my honest/unbiased review*

I was expecting a product that worked quickly, but instead I found this product took too long in bringing my water to a boil. I would understand having to wait a while if in fact the kettle was boiling a large quantity of water, but the kettle only accommodates a small quantity. Moreover, it does not keep water hot. You boil the water, turn it off, and then start all over again. I want a product that will keep my water hot for at least a while. This is really a disappointment. I ended up returning it!

Not bad for inexpensive washcloths. The Disney Little-mermaid made for a lovely gift! They washed up and dried just fine with no shredding. Just make sure to wash these first )prior to using) in cold water. The thickness of these is also pretty good. Don't expect "plush" cotton because these are not that soft. Again, if you're just looking for novelty and a gift, these are fine. Maybe not for everyday use and certainly NOT for small kids since these are not that soft.

I think this probably could have been a good idea, but, it's a pretty cheap plastic. I mean for the price, you're not going to get "perfectly" shredded vegetables; so don't be under that misgiving. Your food processor could do a better job! The "recipe book" that came with it, is almost a joke. The writing is so tiny that I could barely make it out without having a magnifying glass! Not good at all! On the positive, I guess if you call it that, I like the little cleaning brush and the peeler that came with it. Who can't use another peeler right?! I don't "hate" this product, but I honestly just don't see myself getting much use out of it either.

I just purchased this ink pen and had much higher hopes than what I received. The ink has already run out of this pen! Seriously?! Papermates are better quality! You'd think for the amount one spent on this grip pen that the ink might last longer than a month! So not worth buying!

I ordered my normal size (medium) like I usually do in Soybu, but once I tried these on, NO way were these a medium! I couldn't even get these up around my thighs!! These were more like a small. I quickly returned these. I'm not sure if these were outsourced and made by someone other than Soybu, but these definitely are NOT like the other many pairs of Soybu I own. My advise, order a size or two up! Or, spend more and buy some better yoga leggings, especially if you really practice yoga. Buyer beware!!

I bought this case for my Mom for her 3G and she absolutely loved it! She said it was very easy to slip on to her phone and she liked the "feel" of it, plus it made her old phone look more up to date and stylish! Not too bad for an inexpensive case!

I was really excited to have a new cookbook and to test (and eat) some recipes from this book. As a daily practitioner of yoga, I was looking fro some lighter recipes that are more sattvic; but upon receiving this book, it was more like a book of appetizer and drinks. There were only a handful of "entrees". Yes, the book did offer nice pictures, but that was about it! I ended up returning the book. The title of this book is quite deceiving!
Perfect case since I needed this to give someone the 3GS as a gift. It's a box, but hey, it was well worth the money spent!

I have been using this for almost 30 days now and I am down 2 lbs and 0.7% body fat. You are to take 2 daily. I usually space mine 6 hours apart. 15-20 min into taking, you feel a gradual increase in energy, not an instant jittery rush. On top of that it definitely has mood enhancing effects and the appetite suppression is great, because I struggle with that the most. I will repurchase, but as always, diet and nutrition are key. I also love that these are veggie capsules because I am also vegetarian and vegetarian caps can be hard to find.

I think that the picture to this top is a bit deceiving. The top was not as "flowing" as the picture. The fit itself was just okay, but just was not my style. I'm not a large woman (149 lbs. 36B) but again, the fit was just weird. You can certainly tell that this top was handmade which probably explains the odd sort of fit. Anyway, I ended up returning it because it just didn't have the "wow" look.

Weird fit even though I bought a size larger than what I normally wear. Not too mention, the lotus "picture" was like an iron-on from the 70's! Not a very comfortable shirt at all. Don't bother with this shirt because I'm sure anyone could make their own by buying a cheap t-shirt and some iron-on symbols and do much better!

Very, very cheaply made! I just wanted a cheap tablet for watching videos, nothing "fancy" and well, I guess you really do get what you pay for, because within 2 weeks, the tablet broke! I accidentally dropped it and after that, it wouldn't even turn on, at all!  Not very fast either from the few apps I did have and it's very very sensitive to the touch. Every time I touched to click on an app, it kept taking screenshots! What's with that?! HORRIBLE TABLET!! Do yourself a favor and avoid this tablet!!

I lost 10lbs in 2 weeks with little work. Their formula targets appetite and fat burning. I noticed I was eating less and not feeling hungry and the weight just seemed to fall off.I just take it twice a day (at breakfast and again at lunch)  that's it-very easy to incorporate into my supplementation plan. I highly recommend to anyone who wants little extra help dropping some extra weight. This works really well for me and I can't wait to try more of their products.

I returned these immediately! When I received these in-person, the color was waaay different than from the picture here on Amazon. These were more like a neon salmon color and not really a "coral fusion" like the description. The rise on these is also pretty low, so if you practice any type of yoga, these are just about guaranteed to come down from the waist. The fit is also a bit "odd", not long at all unless you are under 5'6 and I'm 5'10, so these won't work at all! Too bad too because I was hoping for a really nice pair of yoga leggings (colored ones) instead of the boring black or gray..oh well.

Normally I don't bother to buy tanks with the built in bra, but, I figured since it was Soybu and I usually like their stuff, that I would give this a go. I really should have gone with my first thought and passed on this. The fit is weird; like it's kind of short length wise and the built in bra seems more like for a young teenage girl and not for women. I mean I'm not a larger busted woman by any means, but this top is just funky! NO stretch in this at all. It clings everywhere, so if you're looking for a top with a lose fit, don't get this OR if you have a body like the model wearing the shirt, then by all means, this shirt is for you! I'll pass.

Oh my gosh, where has this been all of my yoga life?! I was originally going to buy a yoga mat towel until I saw this product. After reading the reviews, I figured I would hold off on buying the mat towel and buy this rosin bag instead. I am so happy I did because this really works! I practice Ashtanga yoga everyday and sweat quite a bit which of course causes my hands and feet to slip on my mat. I dab a bit of this rosin on my hands and feet, and it works! No need to reapply as it does absorb excess oils from my hands and feet along with sweat. It doesn't leave any "powder" on your mat either so no worries on hand or footprint being left behind. Just keep this in the little plastic bag it comes in and it will keep fresh for a while. I am huge fan of this and will certainly continue to buy it! Next up, I'm going to try their Aurorae Organic Yoga Mat Wash.

I decided to take heed as some of the other reviewers said and order a size up. Sooo glad I did because even though I bought this in an extra-large, it fit more like a large-medium. The cotton will NOT stretch, so if you're looking for one of those "stretchy" cotton shirts, this one is not it. I'm a small frame gal (36B, 5'10) and I think anyone larger may not like this fit to well. I really like this shirt, it's soft, the fit is nice, and it washes up well (wash on cold and don't dry this in the dryer). The price is good and the color is exactly like the picture so you won't be disappointed in whatever color(s) you choose. Overall, I'm satisfied.

This was my first purchase of Champion Sports Bras. The fit of this was really good for me (36B) and for me when wearing this for yoga, it held up well. It didn't move nor rise up (which is a BIG plus for me). The bra is really soft, not scratchy or itchy at all. The downside, well ladies, if you sweat in this bra doing any activity, let's just say that your "highlights" will indeed "shine" through this bra! Oh my! I cannot wear this bra to the yoga studio AT ALL even with a shirt over it because the problem still prevails! Totally wearing this one at home only!

I really was hoping for the best with this top based upon the reviews, but alas, once again, I was highly disappointed! I am 5'10 and this shirt barely hit me at my waist! I bought the medium seeing as that's the size I usually wear AND others said it ran large...Ha! No way was this a medium. It fit more like a small and is definitely for women who are about 5'6 and shorter. Sadly, I had to return this one.

These wipes are a joke! Seriously, you could buy baby wipes and they'd be just as effective at getting your mat clean and rid of sweat, germs, etc. These wipes are just as thin (if not thinner), and I had to use about 4 of them just to wipe my mat good! How can a company sell these bogus wipes in the name of saying that they are for your yoga mat? Do yourself a favor and just use a homemade cleaner! Don't waste your money like I did!

This little copter is about as close to having a drone as you can get without spending $100's on a quad prop machine with a GO-Pro camera. Obviously the camera needs proper lighting to maximize picture quality. However, having the ability to snap still photos and/or roll video from the controller is really cool. Durability is good, I crash it often and it is still flying. Its very durable and video & picture quality is very good.

I usually look for the higher end under eye moisturizers/depuffers, so I decided to try this product out. I read good things about this brand, so I thought why not? I've been using this for a month. Not quite as good as the first movie, but still very interesting since it did follow-up with some of the people from the first movie. As always, Joe offered some great advice backed-up by doctors (not from mainstream either).

Nice jeggings for the price. At first I thought since the sizes were so HUGE that these would be too, but, they do fit my size (U.S.) The XXL which fits sizes 8-10 was perfect for me as was the length. Very comfy for my long flight to India!

I was so excited to buy this cardigan since I have purchased a few tops from 82 Days, I figured this cardigan would be okay too. Sadly however, that was not the case. This cardigan is definitely not made for the taller woman in mind like myself (5'10, 148lbs). The sleeves run quite short, like they are almost 3 quarter inch sleeves and certainly NOT long sleeves on me nor like the picture. Yes it does "flow" and the size (medium) was just perfect, but what difference does that make if the sleeves are short? That being said, if you're tall like me, be warned, you may want to pass on this cardigan!

I've tried a few different brands and types of "C" over the years. I've experienced different results from no real effect to having a product actually make me sick.These are pretty decent, with no complaints. And they're a great value so I've been sticking with these and will continue to purchase them.

I decided to try this toothpaste for my chihuahua based upon the other favorable reviews. We were pretty sick of using the "other brands" peanut-butter flavor, and I'm sure she was just as sick of it too. This toothpaste does have a very pleasant smell and of course leaves her breath smelling fresh and gets her teeth whiter. Mind you, she still hates getting her teeth brushed, but, at least the flavor is pleasant.

Can you really write complaints about a $50 phone? I bought this phone primarily as a backup phone for work purposes. If you're looking for a good, low cost, no-contract phone, then this one is tough to beat. It can't compete with the higher end phones, but it should not be expected to at its far lower price point. It offers decent call quality, although the volume doesn't get quite as loud as I'd like. The display screen is also decent, as is the camera. However, there is no flash and no front facing camera. Not really a surprise at this price. Basically, the first sentence of my review sums it up pretty well. If you want an inexpensive no-contract phone that gives you good bang for your buck, I believe you'll be very happy with this phone. If you want higher end features, you'll need to spend significantly more money. Overall I am quite happy with this phone.

Okay so these sunglasses have a MUCH BETTER appearance online than in-person. I guess that's the risk one takes when purchasing sunglasses online. These were cheaply made and clearly a knockoff of the D&G brand only cheesier!! I could have probably picked up something similar at my local Walmart and it would have been the same. The frames are large, covered half my face, almost like goggles. Great for someone who's taking a wood-shop class, but definitely not for someone who wants actually sunglasses. Don't waste your money on these!

Perhaps I should have read further on how big this ring is in person. I have pretty small fingers and this ring was HUGE on me. It almost seemed like it would be better suited for a man and not a woman; unless of course you are a woman with large hands and fingers. Oh I so wanted to like this ring, but alas, it was returned. Not my style and way too big!

At first glance I though that this might be a good idea to keep a lot of dust off the top of my phone where the earplugs go, but as it turned out, the best thing about this was was the "OM" design. Once I put my phone in my purse with this attached and then digging back in to retrieve my phone, the "OM" part (the dangley design) fell off!! Another time when answering my phone, it got caught in my hair and I had to literally pull it out of my hair. Needless to say, this did not work for me. Only if you leave your phone sitting on a desk does this thing even make sense. I returned it! Great symbol, poor construction!

This is probably one of THE BEST B12 vitamins I have tried...and I have tried many. It's always difficult being vegetarian and finding a GOOD B12 with methylcobalamin AND one that dissolves quickly, tastes good, and without a bunch of artificial ingredients. The tablets have a fruity flavor, soften quickly and were offered in the strength and type I was looking for. The size is small enough to be comfortable resting under the tongue and do melt within about 30 seconds, give or take. I will continue to use this brand and highly recommend them!

Pros: DurableInexpensiveLightweightBright displayCons: Battery Charging Speedsd card sizeCamera qualitybloatware installed and not able to be deletedI have had this tablet for several weeks now, and am enjoying it. It is a nice size to tuck into a purse. While the screen is small, it has good resolution and is easy to read. Battery life is good (5-6 hours), but not exceptional, and charging time is fairly slow. The cameras are decent, but not exceptional with 3 megapixels rear and 1.3 mp front. I have been disappointed to learn that it can apparently only accommodate a 32 gb sd card, especially because internal memory is only 8 gb. I was also initially disappointed that it was not possible to root this tablet, although that has since been remedied.

Why oh why did I waste my money on this thing? This is probably one of the WORST tablets on the market!! After having this tablet for a few months the tablet has become VERY slow and sluggish! It's a joke really even trying to watch videos since it doesn't come with an app. The camera on this takes very fuzzy pictures, so why bother. Great for someone who has never owned a tablet or even for a child. Just not for me!

I am so happy I purchased this Kurti blouse. I have gotten more compliments on it! Being in Southern California, we have been extremely hot and this blouse has kept me cool and comfortable. As far as the fit goes, I am a small framed woman (36B,5"10, 148 lbs.) and the medium fits me perfect! I think that if you are a larger framed woman this may not be too comfortable for you. I would say too that it should be washed in cold water, gentle cycle (I used Woolite) and by all means DO NOT dry this in the dryer! This Kurit will definitely being going with me to India in January! Awesome blouse at a great price!

First off, I have to say that I am a HUGE Hello Kitty fan. That being said, I really wanted to like this wallet. From the picture on here, it seemed like a "normal" size wallet, however, that is NOT the case at all. This wallet is more like a wristlet! My cellphone case is smaller and I have a large cellphone! The material didn't seem too cheap and probably would hold up for maybe a few months with normal wear. However for me, I ended up sending this back and looking for a more normal sized wallet.

This fan is a really good fan if you want one to help cool a decent size room. For the size of the fan it pushes out a lot of power. Mind you, if you're expecting  super cold or cool, you will not get it from this. However, if you are looking to circulate the air around your bedroom, then this fan is perfect!  Does the job when you are looking for a small fan to cool a small area. Overall, I am happy with this purchase.

Got this one to replace another that had the teflon scraping off of it. Works great & cleans up easy. I use this several times a week cooking rice, quinoa, barley,etc. Haven't used the steamer for the vegetables yet, but I am satisfied with how good it cooks my grains. No complaints thus far. Easy and simple to use, and a great value for the money.

I  love this 3 cup food processor! I use this for my everyday family meal cooking. Very helpful in chopping carrots in small bits.  This chopper does a good job in chopping carrots, onions, celery, etc. To get better results, I chop the carrots first into cubes and then toss them in this chopper and I do shake the chopper to get better results because it does not do a good job when you don't shake them. For the price of this chopper, I don't have complains and don't mind at all prepping the carrots and shaking the chopper because I hate manually chopping hard raw carrots into tiny bits, it is very tedious. For everyday-family meal-chopping chores, I will definitely recommend this. It's cheap, convenient, and very useful.

After the glowing reviews on this dress, I decided to give it a try. Normally, I wear a medium in dresses (5'9, 148 lbs), but this dress clung EVERYWHERE on my body. Seriously, unless you are very thin like the model, I recommend ordering a size up...as for me, this is going back. Spending a bit more on a better maxi dress is probably the way to go on this item!

I like these tank tops, especially for wearing for yoga (at home). The cotton is not too cheaply made and the fit of these tanks is right on! I wouldn't however, recommend putting these in the dryer, and I always wash mine on cold gentle cycle. Again, for me, these work for yoga since they don't rise-up like some other tops do. They stay in place. Not a bad buy at all and I like the Bella brand. Give them a try!

Actually this tube bra was my first time trying them, and to me the fit was okay. I'm a 36A/B, so the "support" was okay for me, but I would imagine that if you're any larger then this may not be for you at all. For me, I used them for lite yoga practice when a sports bra seems "too much", not really for wearing out of the house, and especially not the way the model looks. Great to wear under say a sheer top, but not for much else. The quality seems pretty decent and they did hold-up in a gentle wash cycle on cold. I did NOT put these in the dryer at all; they dried relatively quickly. The length is long (as described) and for some women it may be quite long on the torso, for me, it was okay. All in all, not a bad purchase.

I really wanted to like these yoga leggings a lot simply because I saw all the decent reviews and because I practice yoga daily and wanted a good pair of leggings. After trying these on when they arrived they were too short for me (I'm 5'9 and 148). These are definitely for someone 5'6 and under. I can't see how one could possibly practice in these because the cotton is pretty thick and the rise on these seems weird (meaning if you do any inversions or downward dogs). The quality seems up to par and seems as though they would last, however, I had to send these back because they were simply not for me. I will continue my search for an actual long yoga legging for tall women.

I am not certain why these melatonin received such rave reviews, because I was so excited to try them based on how highly they came recommended. Were we trying the same things? Seriously, they did absolutely nothing for me. I do experience some insomnia, and researched a bit before buying these, but they did nothing for me and my lack of sleep! I was really looking for something that I could take naturally, especially as I prepare for my trip to India. I was very disappointed in these. The upside (if there is one) they are quite pleasant tasting and dissolve relatively quickly. Alas, I will continue my search and continue with my "sleepytime" tea, because that's what these remind me of.

Based on other reviews, I decided to give these sandals a try, plus, I figured for the price I wouldn't be too disappointed. HA! Boy, was I ever wrong about these! I decided to take these sandals for a "spin" and take a walk in them around my beach area. Going was fine, but walking back, my husband about had to carry me because these shoes rubbed pretty badly against the top of my feet! OUCH!! I thought I would simply cry by the time I arrived back home. I will give these sandals this much, they are cute and they do look nice on; but for sheer comfort, they are laughable! My opinion, pass on these unless you are just wearing them as flip-flops on the beach, NOT for walking ANYWHERE!! As the adage goes, you get what you pay for!

I ordered these pants based on other reviewers on these pants as well as, the many other high reviews I have read about this brand, I decided to order these pants. However, once they arrived and I tried them on, the fit was off. The rise and cut-off in the crotch making these impossible to travel in by a long flight to India. The length too, was not quite a 33 inch inseam as described, more to me like a 32 (I'm 5'9, 148 lbs). Too bad too because I had such high hopes!
This shirt is even more beautiful in-person. The cotton is so soft and the colours really "pop"!The fit is true to size. Love this shirt and I am so glad I purchased it.
Great service and I love this wallet case! Many thanks!!

I was a bit skeptical when I read some of the other reviews, but, I decided to take a chance anyway and purchase this. I am glad I did, because it really does heat the water fast, and it's a lot faster than my gas stove for boiling water. There's an indicator light (it's red) that stays on while the water is heating, then in a matter of maybe 2 minutes, voila! water is boiled! The indicator light goes off and you're set. I guess if one is looking for something fancy, then look elsewhere, because this is NOT fancy; just quick and convenient.

Halle Berry must have owed a favor to someone to have made this movie. I don't know which was worse, the movies horrible soundtrack or Halle Berry and Benjamin Bratt's acting! Equally as bad I believe. This was probably one of the cheesiest movies I've seen in a long time! Heck, the original Batman TV show was better! For all of the bad acting, they could've brought back Julie Newmar!

I purchased this robe based on the brand and figured that since it was from Dearfoams, it must be pretty good. Boy, was I off base on that! It's been a few months and it already has a tear near the right pocket. Mind you, I only wear this robe after shower/bath time, so it doesn't get what I'd call "normal" wear. As far as it being too small, I'm not sure what other reviewers mean, because I bought a large (just for extra room) and it fits like a large! I'm 5'9, 147 pounds, and the large was plenty big. If you want something made from lycra or the sorts, pass on this one; or if you want 100 percent cotton, don't buy this one. All in all, I got what I paid for. Next time I'll spring for a better robe not one so cheap!

I should have really read the other review prior to my purchasing this clock for the bedroom, but, I wanted to just buy this on a whim; well, I got what I paid for; a cheaply made clock! The artwork is nice, but other than that, this clock is so NOT worth the price! It's artwork on what appears to be cheap cardboard that look to be glued on. Seems like a replica of art done on cheap paper and glued to the cardboard. On the positive side, it does keep the time well and looks nice on the wall. I would NOT hang this anywhere guests would see as it is cheap.

Our chiquaqua hates water and hates baths! So, in my quest to find the "perfect" alternative, I stumbled upon this item. I was elated to find that these were not only natural, hypo-allergenic, and cruelty-free as well. Turns out that these have a pleasant smell, are not too soapy and actually do the job intended. These are gentle enough for me to wipe her face off and keep her paws clean too! No more running away at bath time since we got these. I totally recommend these to anyone who has a smaller breed dog or whose doggie is an indoor pooch (like ours). Give them a try and see for yourself.

This is a nice laundry bag for holding small items like, lingerie, delicate items, etc. Not for heavier clothing as it will break the bag. I like this because when not in use, it is collapsible and wipes off easily. Takes up no space at all, especially if you don't have a lot of room for dirty laundry. All in all, this is a nice laundry bag.

I like to consider myself somewhat of a coffee connoisseur, but this tasted like an upgrade of Folgers in a bag. Unless that's what coffee brand you drink, then perhaps you will like this. My impression of Sumatra is strong, not bitter like this and it was certainly not strong and not a bold coffee either. I have tried Caribou previously and actually liked it, but this one has to be a definite pass!

When you hear the namer Otterbox, thoughts usually go immediately to the well-known Defender case.  The Symmetry cases are thinner and sleeker than their bulkier Defender series siblings. It is designed for those who want Otterbox protection without the bulk.The case is constructed of a rigid plastic with firm buttons and a criss-cross styled raised pattern on the interior made of rubber or TPU.  The back of the phone rests on this pattern which is described on the packaging as "shock absorbing".  My assumption, based on that statement, is that the interior is designed to absorb and disperse the force of impact from a drop. The edges and front of the cased are raised and constructed of TPU.  It provides good screen protection.The case easily installs on the Note 5 and the button covers work well despite their initial stiffness. It doesn't add much extra bulk and maintains a reasonably sleek appearance.  So far, I'm very happy with the Symmetry.  It offers a very good balance between protection and looks.

This is the third shredder I've tried this year.  First I tried a Royal, then a Fellowes.  Both had the same problem, they overheated way too quickly. I was able to get three full baskets and roughly fifteen minutes of shredding 5 sheets at a time before this shredder shut off due to heat.  I have yet to find a shredder live up to 12 sheets of all but the thinnest paper.  After a roughly 15-minute cool down, aided by unplugging and sitting outside on the patio in the cool night air, it was ready to go again.  I can do a full grocery bag of documents in one sitting with this shredder.  Like most shredders, it's noisy but not overly loud.  This cross cuts but doesn't do the tiny cube cut.  If you're looking for the tiny confetti top security pieces, this doesn't cut that small but it cuts small enough for my needs.  The shredder has forward, reverse, stop and auto-run settings.  the top latches onto the basket which allows for easy transport via the top handle as opposed to the side handles found on many shredders.  The only minor con is that paper tends to build up in the teeth and require occasional manual cleaning.  Once cleaned, I put a few drops of oil on the blades and it's ready to go on the next batch.  Overall, it does a decent job.  It's not the absolute best shredder I've ever owned but it does a very good job for a shredder under $100.

The readings on this meter are always high compared to other meters, including two other Bayer meters.  Readings are usually a minimum of 15-30ml higher.  High on too many occasions to be trustworthy.  Went back to my Bayer Contour USB.

The MySymmetry is a clear back version of the Symmetry case.  For that reason and the available decorative inserts, it’s little more stylish than the regular Symmetry case, not to mention nearly twice the price.  If you have a gold or rose gold iPhone, it will really pop in this case without inserts.  In fact, the inserts, which themselves cost $10 a pop for a 2-pack, seem to defeat the purpose of a case like this because none compare with the natural beauty of the iPhone itself.Like the regular Symmetry, the case fits the phone nicely and the port cutouts line up perfectly.  It offers adequate protection if normal caution is exercised by non-klutz types who don’t regularly drop their phone.  It also doesn’t add much bulk. The MySymmetry is an attractive alternative to the regular Symmetry but at a premium.  Given the price difference, I’d personally opt for the regular Symmetry.

I originally used Apple's OEM silicon case for my iPhone 6 Plus.  It kept the phone slim and sleek and provided a much grippier surface than the naked phone.  However, the bottom was exposed, it provided very little screen protection and with moderate handling it started to peel.  So it was time for a new case and I decided to try the OtterBox.  This is the polar opposite in terms of form factor.  It's huge.  It turns an already large phone into a tank. It makes carrying the phone a chore in anything other than baggy clothing.  However, it's a little sleeker and less boxy than previous OtterBox Defender cases.  The primary phone case can be used with or without the holster.  It has a built in screen protector that works fine with my 6 Plus.  If you have a 6S model, I strongly suggest you confirm compatibility with the new 6S 3D touch feature before buying.  I've already purchased  a couple "6S" advertised cases and screen protectors only to receive items originally designed for the iPhone 6.  The word 6S was nowhere on the packaging despite the products being advertised as specifically made for the 6S on the website (not Amazon).  The home button is also covered and protected by a thin silicone type material so the fingerprint scanner works.The case comes with a holster with a rotating belt clip.  It allows for easier carrying on a belt but I refuse to walk around with a big goofy phone case clipped to my belt looking like Captain Kirk with my phaser set to stun.  With or without the case, I pocket the phone.  I just wish the belt clip were removable because I like the additional front/screen protection that the holster offers and removing the clip would eliminate some of the bulk when the phone is pocketed.  On the bright side, like the case, OtterBox designed the clip to be slimmer than past models.  The case does not add much in terms of weight, at least to me, and protects the phone very well.  If you need max protection over max aesthetics, this is the way to go.

My wife really likes this smoothing tank top.  She described it as a "girdle for the upper half".  It creates a nice even smooth appearance without being overly tight or restricting.  It doesn't feel like s modern day corset.  It can be worn with or without a bra.  The fabric is soft and smooth and it looks good underneath her clothing. Not much more to say other than she likes the fit, feel, and appearance.

The sound quality of this set is pretty decent.  I recently purchased another set of bluetooth earphones primarily used for workouts and they didn't sound too hot.  These rival a decent pair of normal buds but don't come close to a top quality set of buds. Quality is decent regardless with good even tonal frequencies and little distortion, although there is an occasional popping sound or two that seems like it's related to the wireless connection but I'm not sure.  I had no problems pairing the set with both my iPhone 6 and my 4th gen iPod touch running iOS 6.  These are good hands-free music while you work play but they fall out a little easier than my other buds with wings. For that reason, I'm reluctant to recommend them for very active activities. I think they'd be okay for a power walk or light jog but not much more.  Bluetooth distance is pretty good, easily 20-30 feet.  My only problem with the buds is that I think they sound too quiet for me.  On the other hand, my wife finds them loud.  So, satisfaction with the max volume will likely be a subjective matter. Either that or I spent one too many days blasting super loud music through my headphones and earbuds.  The usable water bottle that they ship the buds in is a nice touch. Cute little set that would make a great gift.

I have to admit, I didn’t have high expectations when offered this watch for review.  I’ve both purchased and reviewed numerous sub-$100 as well as moderately expensive watches over the years. My watch collection ranges from a $19 Timex up to an Omega Speedmaster Chronograph.  I’m not a watch collector or connoisseur but I like wearing nice reliable watches for both fashion and function, much like any other articles of clothing or accessories.  The common theme that I notice is that I usually get what I pay for.  Despite absurdly high supposed MSRP’s of hundreds of dollars, most $50-100 dollar watches that I've owned didn’t even feel like they were worth $25.This watch breaks that mold by having some pretty decent quality components for the money.  The leather band is thick and luxurious with quality stitching and the brand name engraved on the inside.  The case is large with a mechanical see-through front and rear.  The dial, arms and second-hand are all black with white and red accents. The chronograph sub-dials indicate day of week, 24-hour clock and day of month.  The date sub-dials are set using the buttons.  The primary 12-hour time and the 24-hour sub-dial time are both in sync and set with the crown.  Setting this type chronograph is not in the instructions.  Also missing from the instructions is a guide or explanation of how to use the not so intuitively fastened clasp.  None of the watches that I've owned have ever come with that funky clasp.  It took me quite a while to figure it out.  The watch has a Chinese automatic movement that mimics the Swiss mechanical movement found on high end watches.  That means the arm appears to sweep rather than tick like a quartz movement.  For that reason, it’s also the movement found on most knock-offs and counterfeits.  I don't mind because although it’s not quite as smooth as the Swiss automatic movement on my Omega, it’s a welcome relief from the ubiquitous Quartz movement found on most watches.  Also, this watch makes no claims of being a Rolex or Patek, so the movement is justified.  My only concern would be the accuracy of the Chinese mechanical movement. This would be the first one I've owned, at least to my knowledge.  Time will tell how accurate it is, pun fully intended.Overall, I like this watch.  It’s classy and flashy without appearing pretentious.  It has a decent size case but not one I'd consider oversized unless you have tiny wrists.  Neither the strap nor the case scream “look at me” yet is attractive enough to earn compliments.  In fact, if not for the see-through body, it would be fairly conservative.  You can wear this watch with confidence that you won't come off as a poser or attention seeker.  Yes, It’s an automatic, so it doesn’t require winding but you do have to keep it moving to keep it running. That's where the differences between this watch and the much more expensive automatics show.  I can go a couple days without wearing my Omega and it will still be running when I put it on.  This watch seems to stop running much quicker.  If you plan to wear it regularly, I suggest investing in an inexpensive automatic watch winder.

This case offers decent protection without the added bulk of cases like the Otterbox Defender.  It fits the S6 nicely without being overly loose or snug.  It does not include a screen protector of any type but the front of the case protrudes enough to protect the screen if the phone is laid face down on a flat surface.  There is enough substance to insulate the body from drop-related damage but given the size of the phone and the amount of exposed screen, screen protection looks to be minimal against drops. This is not a case for the clumsy. It’s a case for those who take pretty good care of their phone and are generally cautious.  It’s built to offer a decent amount of protection with little added bulk.  Anyone skewing toward the klutz side should definitely look at the Defender or Commuter cases rather than this. This case leans more toward the aesthetics end of the spectrum rather than max protection.

I recently bought a Black & Decker D2030 iron and absolutely love it.  It has great size, weight and produces perfect steam and heats nice and evenly.  I just tried this D3040 and although it does a decent job of ironing, I prefer my D2030.One of the biggest pros of the D3040 is that it gets hot; hot enough to iron anything.  It also shoots out a nice amount of steam. The weight and ergonomics are both decent.  I can iron comfortably for long periods.  It has a nice wide fill spout and the digital push-button temperature control is easy to use.  Just push the button until the blue LED indicates desired temperature setting.I don't necessarily know if I'd label if a con, but if you're not careful the iron can easily get too hot.  The very first item I attempted to iron was a cotton/polyester blend work shirt.  I typically iron this fabric on the highest setting or just below it with most irons, including the D2030.  The D3040's highest setting (linen) is way too hot for that fabric. It nearly burned the shirt on first contact.  Thankfully, I felt that it was too hot immediately and lifted the iron before any damage occurred.  I turned the heat down two settings to polyester but then it wasn’t hot enough to heat the water and started leaking.  I turned it up one setting to 100% cotton and it was hot enough to steam but didn’t seem quite hot enough to efficiently iron the shirt without numerous passes.  I later learned that anything other than the hottest linen setting requires the steam to be set at mid instead of high steam.  That's why it leaked.  The digital temperature control is easy to use but doesn’t offer the flexibility or versatility of a regular heat control knob.  With a knob, I can adjust heat incrementally if it’s too hot or too cool.  With digital controls, it’s all or nothing for a particular heat setting.  My D2030 is also digital but doesn’t have as wide of a heat variance between the highest heat settings.  If a really hot iron is needed for stubborn linens, the D3040 is definitely the hotter of the two.The steam burst is nice during ironing.  It puts out a nice amount of steam but when you sit the iron upright, it spits out one last strong burst of steam each time.  Make sure the iron isn't facing toward any exposed body parts when you turn it upright.The last con I'll list is the reservoir.  It’s a very dark grey color which makes it hard to see the water inside.  Further complicating matters is the fact that the max water level line is designed to be read with the iron sitting horizontal, not vertical.  I have to tip the iron horizontal at least once while filling if I want to ensure I fill it to the max without overfilling.I like the performance of both irons but for my everyday ironing needs, the nod goes to the D2030.  As I said, if you need an iron that gets really hot or frequently iron a lot of linens that can withstand the heat, the D3040 gets the nod.  Just make sure you use caution with the higher heat and steam settings and watch out for bursts of steam whenever you raise it vertically while ironing.
